similar improvements    32700   6809 accumulations of trash junk debris and nonliving plant material on property a subject to subsection b no owner agent custodian lessee or occupant of property shall permit the accumulation of trash junk debris or nonliving plant material on any exterior portion of the property including the exterior portion of any building located thereon accordingly such owner agent custodian lessee or occupant shall maintain and keep the property free of accumulation of trash junk debris and nonliving plant material b a shall not be construed to prohibit any of the following 1 the storage of trash junk debris and nonliving plant material in garbage containers which comply with all applicable ordinances relating to solid waste collection  2 the storage of nonliving plant material in compost bins  or 3 keeping wood on the property for use as fuel provided such wood is piled stacked bundled or corded and the area surrounding the piles stacks bundles or cords shall be free of excessive growth of grass weeds brush and branches     6809 excessive growth of grass weeds and brush on property no owner agent custodian lessee or occupant of property shall permit the excessive growth of grass weeds or brush on any exterior portion of the property accordingly such owner agent custodian lessee or occupant shall cut trim or remove such vegetation and keep such vegetation cut trimmed or removed so that it is not in a state of excessive growth notwithstanding the foregoing all land areas within the city used as orange groves or where the natural growth has never been removed are exempt from the provisions of this section requiring the cutting or removal of vegetation provided however that where such land areas abut or are directly adjacent to cleared land areas the natural growth shall be maintained in a presentable condition free of weeds undergrowth and long grass for a distance of at least five 5 feet from all such cleared land areas  6809 control of rodents and insects a structures and exterior property shall be kept free from rodent harborage and infestation where rodents are found they shall be promptly exterminated by approved processes that will not be injurious to human health after pest elimination proper precautions shall be taken to eliminate rodent harborage and prevent reinfestation b if any building shall remain vacant and unattended for more than ninety 90 days the owner of said building shall provide continuous control of rodents and roaches baits powders or sprays shall be placed as often as the city considers necessary any building containing rodenticides or insecticides dangerous to pets or humans shall be secured against unauthorized entry this control is not intended to apply to small detached buildings on otherwise occupied property  6809   62716  enforcement  abatement of nuisance a whenever the code enforcement officer finds that there appears to be a violation of section 75 76 or 77 the code enforcement officer may serve a notice of violation upon the owner and if applicable the agent custodian lessee or occupant directing such owner and if applicable the agent custodian lessee or occupant to terminate and abate the violation within ten 10 calendar days of the date such notice is received for purposes of this chapter notice is received on the earliest of the day it is hand delivered to the property owner the date the property is posted with said notice or five 5 days after said notice is mailed to the property owner postage prepaid the code enforcement officer shall within five 5 days of the date the notice is mailed cause a sign to be placed upon the property in a conspicuous and easily visible location the sign shall be at least eight 8 inches by twelve 12 inches in size and shall include the following information 1 a sufficient description by address andor legal description to identify the property upon which the violation exists  2 a description of the violation to be terminated and abated  3 a statement that if the described violation is not terminated and abated within ten 10 calendar days after notice is received the code enforcement department shall cause the violation to be terminated and abated  4 that a lien shall be imposed upon the property for the actual cost of such termination and abatement plus administrative expenses  and 5 a preliminary nonbinding minimum estimate of the cost of termination and abatement 6 the notice of violation shall further state in bold and conspicuous letters that if such violation within the tenday period prescribed by subsection a of this section a has not been terminated and abated  or b has not been timely appealed in accordance with section 79  or c has been timely appealed but the appeal process proves unsuccessful  the city shall cause the violation to be terminated and abated and the actual cost of such termination and abatement plus administrative costs shall constitute a lien on the property in accordance with section 710 b if the property owner fails to terminate and abate the violation within the tenday period prescribed by subsection a of this section the code enforcement department shall cause the violation to be terminated and abated the city may hire and enter into contracts with independent contractors to terminate and abate violations of this article  6809 appeals a within the tenday period prescribed by subsection 78 after notice is received an aggrieved party may appeal the code enforcement officers determination that a notice of violation is warranted for the property in question b an appeal by an aggrieved party shall 1 be addressed to the code enforcement officer  and 2 be either handdelivered to the code enforcement officer or postmarked within the tenday period after notice is received c upon receipt of a timely appeal the code enforcement officer shall schedule a hearing date before the code enforcement special magistrate d at the hearing the code enforcement special magistrate shall allow the city and the appellant an opportunity to present evidence and to examine and crossexamine witnesses after considering the evidence and testimony the code enforcement special magistrate shall make a factual determination as to whether the property is in violation of this article if the code enforcement special magistrate makes a factual determination that the property is in violation of this article he shall affirm the code enforcement officers issuance of the notice of violation and issue an order requiring the appellant to promptly clean the property in order to terminate or abate the violation if the appellant has not remedied the violation within five 5 calendar days after the date of the code enforcement special magistrates holding that this article has been violated then the code enforcement department shall terminate and abate the violation as provided in section 78b e any appeal of the code enforcement special magistrates decision shall be filed in a timely manner with the circuit court  6809 liens  assessment a after causing the violation to be terminated and abated as provided in section 78 the code enforcement department shall certify to the city clerk the actual cost incurred in remedying the condition whereupon such cost plus the citys administrative expenses shall be due within ten 10 days b upon certifying to the city clerk the actual cost incurred in remedying the condition the code enforcement department shall by hand or certified mail return receipt requested deliver or send a notice of assessment of costs to the last known owner of record of the subject real property if the assessment is not paid or arrangements satisfactory to the city have not been made to pay such assessment within ten 10 days after notice is received then the code enforcement department shall refer the matter to the city council to consider the imposition of a lien against the subject property if a lien is imposed the amount due shall bear interest at the rate of twelve 12 percent per annum from the date the council approves imposition of a lien c a certified copy of the claim of lien shall be recorded in the public records of the county and shall constitute a lien superior to all other liens and mortgages except for tax liens and mortgages recorded prior to the effective date of  a certified copy of the claim of lien shall constitute notice to any subsequent purchasers successors in interest or assigns d ninety 90 days after the recording of a certified copy of a claim of lien in the public records of the county the city council may authorize the city attorney to institute legal proceedings to foreclose such lien the property owner shall be liable for all costs including reasonable attorneys fees incurred in any such action  6809 removal of carcasses it shall be unlawful to deposit or permit the carcass of any animal to remain at any place within the city so as to constitute a nuisance or unhealthy condition upon failure or refusal of the owner or person responsible to remove any such carcass after reasonable notice of not to exceed four 4 hours he shall be guilty of a violation of this chapter if the owner or person responsible is unknown the police shall cause the carcass to be removed  6809 note formerly numbered as  74 secs 712715  reserved article ii  garbage and trash footnotes  2  editors note  adopted sept 23 201 amended and restated former art ii  717734 in its entirety to read as herein set out former art ii pertained to similar subject matter see the table at the end of this volume for a listing of ordinances which amended this former article definitions as used in this article city shall mean the city of maitland florida and where context permits the physical geographical area of the city collection services shall mean the provision of service to remove solid waste and or reyclables from a designated storage point for disposal at a separate location utilizing persons and specially designed equipment for such purpose collector shall mean the current franchise holder who has executed an agreement with the city and who is required to perform collection services commercial collection service shall mean the provision of collection services to commercial improved real property commercial improved real property shall mean improved real property utilized by commercial establishments whether such establishments are profit or notforprofit establishments including but not limited to motels hotels stores office buildings restaurants service stations and garages laundries and cleaning establishments and manufacturing and other industrial establishments commercial service shall mean any service that is not residential including businesses using garbage carts construction and demolition debris shall mean debris and wastes accumulated from land clearing excavating building rebuilding and altering of buildings structures roads streets sidewalks or parkways by an owner or contractor such construction debris may be either commercial or residential in character container shall mean a dumpster compactor recycling cart garbage cart or any container intended for the collection of solid waste or recyclable materials customer shall mean the owner occupant tenant or other person having control of the improved real property extra pickup shall mean emptying a customers container on more than its normal sequencing this occurs when a customers waste generation exceeds scheduled service garbage shall mean every accumulation of animal fruit or vegetable matter that attends the preparation use cooking and dealing in or storage of edibles and any other matter of any nature whatsoever which is subject to decay putrefaction and the generation of noxious or offensive gases or odors or which during or after decay may serve as breeding or feeding material for flies or other germcarrying insects or any container of the material defined herein but excludes animal carcasses garbage cart shall mean a container between sixty 60 and ninety 96 gallons capacity on wheels for rolling with a nonremovable hinged lid suited to automatic dumping equipment provided by the collectors collection vehicles and containing not over two hundred fifty 250 pounds hazardous waste shall mean material which is radioactive volatile flammable explosive infectious toxic or otherwise hazardous including but not limited to material designated as hazardous in any federal florida orange county or maitland statute or regulation also that waste determined to be hazardous by the united states environmental protection agency or any other federal agency pursuant to the resource conservation and recovery act of 197 as amended or any other applicable federal state or local government or agency thereof industrial wastes shall mean the waste products of canneries fisheries slaughterhouses or packing plants condemned food products agricultural waste products and other solid waste products generated from industrial processing or manufacturing improved real property shall mean all residential commercial or other property that generates or is capable of generating solid waste junk shall mean any tangible item such as furniture appliances bicycles or smaller property not having a useful purpose to the owner or abandoned by the owner and not included within the definitions of garbage yard waste industrial wastes or rubbish noncombustible refuse shall mean refuse material that is unburnable in ordinary incinerator temperatures eighty 80 degrees hundred eight hundred 1800 degrees f such as metals mineral matter large quantities of glass or crockery metal furniture auto body parts and other similar materials or refuse not usual to housekeeping or to operation of stores or offices this category also includes household appliances greater than thirtysix 36 inches in any dimension greater than sixty 60 pounds in weight or of more than twenty 20 cubic feet in volume owner shall mean the person designated on the real property tax roll maintained by the property appraiser for each parcel of improved real property recyclable materials shall mean those materials which are capable of being recycled and which would otherwise be processed or disposed of as solid waste from residential and commercial sources refuse container shall mean a large metal box for commercial solid waste or recyclable material usually of the twocubicyard to eightcubicyard size which are lifted by mechanical means these containers will normally have plastic lids rolloff container shall mean a large metal box normally used for construction debris demolition or other large amounts of solid waste usually of the twenty thirty or fortycubicyard size which are lifted by mechanical means these containers may be either open top or enclosed compaction type rollout shall mean the moving of a container with casters from the customers use location to a location where the collection vehicle can empty the containder and returning the container to the use location rubbish shall mean the accumulation of paper excelsior rags wooden or paper boxes or containers sweepings and all other accumulations of a nature other than garbage which are usual to housekeeping and to the operation of stores offices and other business places also any bottles cans or other containers which due to their ability to retain water may serve as breeding places for mosquitoes or other waterbreeding insects service charge shall mean commercial collection service charges solid waste shall mean a general term that includes the specific terms garbage yard waste rubbish industrial wastes and junk but excludes all recyclable materials as herein defined hazardous wastes including fecal wastes animal carcasses and pathological wastes and biohazardous wastes are excluded solid waste facility shall mean a transfer station resource recovery facility processing facility or sanitary landfill designated and approved by the city and licensed and permitted under all applicable rules and regulations to receive solid waste white goods shall mean inoperative and discarded refrigerators ranges water heaters freezers and other similar domestic appliances yard waste shall mean all accumulations of leaves grass shrubbery cuttings logs tree limbs brush palm fronds and other such matter attending the care of lawns shrubbery vines and trees  92313 deposits and accumulations prohibited generally it shall be unlawful for any person to do any of the following 1 to place or cause to be placed any solid waste industrial waste noncombustible refuse or hazardous materials upon the property of another 2 to deposit or dispose of any refuse on the paved or traveled portion of any public street alleyway sidewalk bike path stream ditch river pond bay creek park or public place in the city except at such areas as may be designated by the city manager or designee 3 to deposit dump or dispose of any solid waste industrial waste noncombustible refuse or hazardous materials at upon or in any incinerator or landfill without first obtaining the permission of the custodian thereof 4 to burn any solid waste industrial waste or hazardous materials within the city except as specifically permitted by the chief of the fire department or his designee 5 to produce or accumulate any solid wastes such as construction and demolition debris or yard waste while acting in the capacity of a contractor such as a tree surgeon landscaper or building contractor without removal of the same to a designated approved disposal area 6 to allow any scattered solid waste to remain at or near the curbside or fail to remove any windblown or animalscattered wastes from public areas or rightsofway which wastes have blown or otherwise scattered from the dwelling residential curbside collection point 7 to place any solid wastes out for collection by any alley service drive easement or rightofway not serviced by collection vehicles 8 to place any solid waste industrial waste noncombustible refuse or hazardous wastes for collection adjacent to any street if the truck services the area from an established alley 9 to place any solid waste industrial waste noncombustible refuse or hazardous materials in an underground container for pickup 10 to do any act prohibited or fail to do any act required by the regulations effecting the collection and disposal of solid wastes or other waste within the city 11 to deposit flammable liquids hazardous wastes or explosives in any refuse container 12 to place or caused to be placed in any container dangerous or explosive substances such as strong acids or alkalies unexploded gun shells sealed noncombustible containers pressure cans such as aerosol or any dangerous substances or devices which have not otherwise been rendered harmless and suitable for incineration by neutralizing expending or other effective means before placing such substances for disposal ashes shall be cooled for twentyfour 24 hours before depositing in any container  92313 permanent rolloff all permanent rolloff containers shall be serviced by the collector  92313 disposal of trash accumulations too large for containers yard waste which is properly bundled or containerized in such a manner as to enable lifting the trash in a single lifting movement to place same in the compaction truck in which bundles or containers do not exceed forty 40 pounds in weight or four 4 feet in length and which are placed at curb or roadside in the manner and time as is designated by the city manager or designee will be collected grass leaves and pine straw must be containerized by either using disposable or reusable containers and if properly placed for collection as above will be collected yard waste containing no combustible matter or matter which will during decay give off offensive odors may be accumulated by the owners as mulch or compost piles in the rear of the premises upon which accumulated  92313 collection disposal to be by city or collector except as herein otherwise provided all residents occupants or owners premises in the city shall be required to have accumulations of solid wastes removed and disposed of by the city or the collector it shall be the responsibility of the owners or the occupants of residences and of all buildings used for business commercial or industrial purposes to apply for the necessary number of containers in accordance with any need therefor the city manager or designee shall determine the number and size of containers necessary to protect the health and welfare of the citizens of the city spent oils or greases accumulated by garages filling stations or similar establishments will not be removed by the city or collector and must be removed and properly disposed of by persons licensed to provide such services  92313 boxes crates to be collapsed before placement in containers prior to depositing solid waste or recycling for collection in containers the owner or person shall collapse all cardboard boxes and crates  92313 establishment of rates and deposits the city shall by resolution set collection rates and may establish security deposits for all customers served under the terms and conditions of the franchise agreement for collection of commercial residential and multifamily solid waste and recyclable materials these rates shall be reviewed periodically and shall be adjusted based on available data such as current cost paid to the collector cost of solid waste disposal administrative cost incurred by the city and any cost associated with compliance with state county or federal environmental regulations this resolution will be known as the solid waste rate resolution  92313 billing collection of fees for city service garbage trash collection and disposal service will be provided on application only credit reference letters from other municipalities or utilities providing similar service will be accepted in lieu of an initial deposit providing the applicant demonstrates two 2 years of continuous nondelinquent payments continuous nondelinquent payment shall be defined as no more than three 3 delinquencies within the last two 2 fiscal years and no delinquencies within the last three 3 months of the refund year previous residents who have moved from the city within the last two 2 years and have maintained a good credit standing will be exempt from initial deposit requirements garbage trash collection and disposal service charges shall be billed and collected monthly bills are due upon receipt if any bill for garbage and trash collection shall be and remain unpaid on and after twenty 20 days from the billing date a penalty of ten 10 percent of said bill may be imposed and shall be added to such bill  and if the bill shall remain due and unpaid for a period of thirty 30 days from the date of the original bill the water service may be disconnected service will be reconnected upon payment in full and all past due water and sewage disposal service charges plus any penalties assessed together with a water reconnection charge as established in section 203 when water service is suspended upon customer request garbage and trash collection will also be suspended  92313 removal of solid wastes or other debris 1 if customer has not removed extra or nonconforming solid wastes or other industrial waste hazardous wastes or noncombustible refuse within twentyfour 24 hours after notification by the city the city manager or designee may order such removal and all costs incurred shall be placed against the customers utility account 2 in the event of a hurricane or similar act of god the city manager or designee may request the removal of temporary roll offs loose construction material loose yard debris or similar potential hazards at the customers expense without notice  92313 fee declared debt for city collection the amount of collection fees imposed by this article is hereby declared to be a service secured by a property owner or occupant and which inures to the benefit of the subject property and is therefore declared to be a debt due the city and any person required under the terms of this article to have accumulations of solid waste removed and disposed of by the city shall be liable to the city for the amount of applicable collection fee therefor and such fee shall be recoverable in any court of competent jurisdiction if such fees are not paid within ninety 90 days of the date of billing the city may assess the amount of such fees as a lien against the benefited property of the same extent and character as a lien granted to the city by law for special assessments for the cost of local improvement  92313 frequency of city collections the city manager or designee shall determine the frequency of each customers pickup necessary for the health and welfare of the citizens of the city  92313 points of collection a residential containers shall be placed for collection at the edge of the customers property adjacent to a street or alley and shall be accessible without entering into a building or shelter of any type or by walking under or around a yard or property obstacle provided however that the city manager or designee may make exceptions to the above in the case of handicapped or infirm persons b commercial containers shall be placed in a location approved by the city manager or designee  92313 dead animals not to be placed for collection no dead animals shall be placed for collection  92313 time for placing removal of containers all garbage and recycling carts shall be placed in the manner provided in this article no earlier than  pm of the day preceding the day designated for collection and shall be removed not later than  pm on such designated day dumpsters and rolloff containers may remain in their permanent location  92313 furnishing maintenance replacement of containers for collection a garbage carts the city shall furnish each residential customer a wheeled garbage cart in accordance with specifications approved by the city manager the city shall also furnish small business establishments ie commercial establishments not using containers furnished by collector with a wheeled garbage cart as above b recycling carts the city shall furnish each residential customer a wheeled recycling cart in accordance with specifications approved by the city manager c dumpsters and rolloff containers the collector will furnish containers to all other commercial establishments and certain multifamily dwelling units d other containers prohibited no solid waste industrial waste noncombustible refuse or hazardous material shall be deposited or collected from any other receptacle not specified herein without specific approval of the city manager or designee e maintenance all containers shall be kept in a sanitary condition by the customer any container which fails to meet such sanitary standards is declared to be a nuisance and shall be condemned and disposed of upon order of the city manager or designee f replacement the city or collector will replace at its own expense containers lost damaged or worn fault of the customer the city will replace at the customers expense containers lost damaged or worn of the customer  92313 fines a in addition to any other penalty or remedy available to the city stated within this any person violating any provision stated within sections 717 718 719 720 721 724 727 728 729 andor 730 of this article shall be subject to the following fines 1 first offense written warning 2 second offense $5000 fine 3 third offense $12500 fine 4 fourth offense $47500 fine 5 subsequent violations fine not to exceed $50000 b notice of the offense and fine may be given in accordance with code enforcement procedures of or of of the ordinances failure to timely pay the fines shall result in a code enforcement action being brought by the city against the violator c each day in violation of this article shall constitute a separate offense officials charged with the responsibility of enforcing this article shall provide violators with no more than one 1 written warning in addition to the fines contained herein the city may take any other appropriate legal action including but not limited to injunctive action to enforce the provisions of this article d the fines shall be applied to any violators garbage trash collection and disposal service bill and any person violating the provisions of this article shall also be responsible for reimbursing the city for any attorneys fees and costs incurred in correcting the violation  92313 requirement of franchise agreement for construction and demolition debris 1 any person or entity who engages in providing construction and demolition debris roll off container collection service within the city shall be required to enter into a nonexclusive franchise agreement with the city to provide such service 2 in addition to the franchise agreement required hereunder every franchisee shall obtain and maintain at all times during the franchisees operations all applicable permits and licenses required by any public agency having jurisdiction over the operation of said business 3 the following services are excluded from the nonexclusive construction and demolition franchise requirements a self haul materials which are generated by a residential or commercial entity and delivered by that entity directly to a recycling facility transfer station or disposal facility b removal of materials from a premises by a contractor as an incidental part of a gardening landscaping tree trimming cleaning maintenance construction or similar service offered by that contractor rather than as a hauling service provided that the hauling is performed by the contractor itself and not a subcontraceted hauling company c removal of construction and demolition debris from a construction site by the construction contractor provided that the hauling is performed by the contractor itself and not a subcontractor hauling company  92313 granting of nonexclusive franchise agreement 1 the city manager shall be authorized to grant nonexclusive franchises to qualified persons or entities in accordance with this chapter all qualified applicants as determined by the city manager shall be granted a nonexclusive franchise for construction and demolition debris collection service 2 each applicant shall be required in order to be granted a nonexclusive franchise to provide the following a a signed application demonstrating experience providing collection and demolition debris experience in the city or in comparable jurisdictions or other comparable business experience  b a signed franchise agreement as specified herein and in a form approved by the city manager and the city attorney  c proof of insurance in the amounts specified in the franchise agreement  d a minimum of three 3 customers that the city may contact to conduct a reference check  and e provide operations information including equipment description invoice and billing system and customer service procedures and a recycling plan in a form designated by the city manager f the application fee as established in the solid waste rate resolution 3 the city manager shall have the discretion to deny any application for a nonexclusive franchise under any of the following circumstances a failure to comply with any of the provisions set forth in subsection 2 above  b evidence that the applicants franchise was previously terminated within five 5 years prior to the date of the application  c evidence that the applicant previously operated a construction and demolition debris collection service in the city without holding a valid franchise  or d a finding that the applicant lacks sufficient experience equipment or recycling plan to safely comply with the requirements of the franchise agreement e any applicant whose application is denied shall have the right to appeal said denial to the council as provided under section 737  92313 franchise terms and conditions the franchise agreement authorized by section 733 shall provide but not be limited to 1 nonexclusive right of franchisee the agreement shall provide that the franchisee is granted a nonexclusive franchise to provide construction and demolition debris collection service within the city 2 franchise fee the agreement shall provide that the franchisee shall be required to pay to the city a franchise fee in the amount of fifteen 15 percent of the gross revenues generated by the franchisee from services performed within the city on the dates specified in the agreement 3 public liability insurance the franchise agreement shall provide that the franchisee shall carry public liability insurance in amounts determined by the city for the death or injury of one or more persons and for property damage such insurance shall name the city its officers agents and employees as an additional insureds 4 performance standards the franchise agreement shall specify standards of performance that the franchisee shall be required to comply with as determined by city to insure protection of the public health safety and welfare 5 additional terms and conditions the council shall retain the power by resolution to provide for the inclusion in such agreement of such additional terms and conditions as the council deems necessary to protect the interests of the city  92313 supervision authority the city manager shall have the authority to supervise the operations of the franchisee and the collection of construction and demolition debris  92313 termination of franchise 1 the city shall have the right to terminate a nonexclusive franchise based on the city managers determination that an event of default has occurred as defined in the franchise agreement 2 the franchisee shall have no right or authority to engage in construction and demolition debris collection recycling or disposal operations in the city for a period of five 5 years from the date of the termination after five 5 years should the franchisee provide proof that the event causing the franchisee to default has been corrected and at the sole and complete discretion of the city the franchisee may be reinstated upon resubmittal of an application to provide nonexclusive c&d debris container collection 3 any franchisee whose franchise is terminated by the city manager shall have the right to appeal such determination to the council as provided in section 737  92313 appeal of city managers determination 1 any person whose application for a franchise is denied or whose franchise is terminated may appeal such decision to the council by filing with the city clerk within ten 10 days from and after the date of denial or termination of the franchise a written notice of appeal which shall set forth the grounds for such appeal 2 the council shall hold an appeal hearing not later than thirty 30 days following the receipt of the written request the council shall render its decision after the close of the appeal hearing and its decision shall be final  92313 land development procedures footnotes  1  editors note the provisions of this chapter derive from  adopted  of the ordinance provides as follows that all ordinances as resolution or parts thereof except for provisions of the 2010 comprehensive development plan which may be determined to be in conflict herewith to the extent of such conflict are hereby repealed cross reference board of zoning adjustment  472 et seq  development
