regulation act fs   et seq article i  in general establishment of procedures the city council may establish and provide for the administration of procedures to ensure that property is annexed or developed consistent with city goals compatible with surrounding properties and consistent with service levels adopted by city council  42291 article ii  annexation footnotes  2  editors note exh a adopted oct 24 201 amended and restated former art ii  752756 in its entirety which pertained to the same subject matter and derived from     65  purpose and intent the procedures established in this article are intended to provide for orderly incorporation of properties within the citys planning area consistent with florida statutes exh a 102411 applicability the procedures contained in this article are applicable to all minor or major voluntary annexation requests to be accomplished pursuant to section  florida statutes a minor voluntary annexation as it is used in this chapter means and refers to a voluntary annexation of either a residential lots for singlefamily homes platted by the county after   b any single platted lot consisting of onehalf acre of real property or less  or c any parcel of real property consisting of onehalf acre of real property or less a major voluntary annexation as it is used in this chapter means and refers to any voluntary annexation which is for a parcel of real property not meeting the requirements for classification as a minor voluntary annexation exh a 102411 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges and expenses for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application exh a 102411 application procedures i preapplication and filing procedures a preapplication conference before submitting an application the applicant shall schedule a preapplication conference with the development review committee the applicant shall obtain a copy of the preapplication form from the community development department the city shall provide written comments to the applicant prior to the development review committee preapplication meeting the comments and information provided by the city of maitland do not constitute a waiver of any requirements contained in the citys land development   but are meant to assist in the preparation of the application for formal submittal a preapplication conference must be held no more than six 6 months prior to filing an application following the preapplication conference the applicant may submit an application for processing by the city the applicant shall submit the application and supplemental materials to the community development department in quantities designated by the city b sufficiency review all applications for major or minor voluntary annexation into the city shall be submitted to the zoning administrator application must be submitted at least forty 40 days prior to the first or third thursday of any month the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted should the applicant fail to submit all information as required within five 5 days the application will not be considered complete and will not be processed ii notice of planning and zoning commission hearing after receipt of a complete petition the city shall give notice in a newspaper of general circulation as defined in florida statutes at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the planning and zoning commission public hearing date on which the petition is to be heard notice shall be posted on the property proposed to be annexed and in two 2 public places as well as the city web site notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property the distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point on the boundary of the property subject to the annexation petition nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addresses to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a a statement that annexation of certain property into the city has been requested  b the legal description of the property subject to the annexation petition  and a general location map to correspond with the legal description of the property as noted on the hearing notice this does not mandate publication of the location map in the newspaper noted above unless otherwise required by the florida statutes c the name of the owners of the property subject to the petition  d that a public hearing will be held by the planning and zoning commission  e the date time and location of the hearing  f that the public is invited to attend the hearing and make comment orally or in writing  and g the location and times during which an interested party may inspect the annexation petition iii planning and zoning commission public hearing the planning and zoning commission public hearing shall be held on the first or third thursday of the month any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney iv review by development review committee following a public hearing by the planning and zoning commission the development review committee shall review the petition and any public hearing testimony and shall make a recommendation to the planning and zoning commission for approval approval with conditions or denial of the proposed petition for annexation the development review committee shall formulate its recommendation and make findings with regard to the following factors a whether the proposed petition will have a favorable or unfavorable effect on the citys budget  b whether the proposed petition will diminish the service level of the citys transportation system and if it will whether an adequate agreement between the property owners and the city has been consummated that will provide for improvement of the citys transportation system in such a way that the proposed petition will not diminish the level of service and will incur no cost to the city  c whether there will be a favorable or unfavorable impact on the environment or the natural or historical resources of the city or the region as a result of the proposed petition  d whether the proposed petition is consistent with the comprehensive development plan  e whether the city is able to provide adequate public services to the affected property if the petition is granted and whether the petition will promote the efficient use of or unduly burden water sewer solid waste disposal recreational facilities or other public facilities  f whether approval of the petition of the lands proposed for annexation is compatible with surrounding neighborhoods and land use  g whether the proposed petition will promote or adversely affect the public health safety welfare economic order or aesthetics of the region and the city  and h whether the proposed petition meets the requirements of florida statutes regarding annexation v recommendation by planning and zoning commission within sixty 60 days of the planning and zoning commissions public hearing the planning and zoning commission shall review the development review committees findings and recommendation and shall make a recommendation to the city council for approval approval with conditions or denial of the annexation request before any annexation recommendation is forwarded to city council the planning and zoning commission shall make a written finding certifying consistency with the comprehensive development plan and that satisfactory provision and arrangement has been made concerning the factors itemized for review by the development review committee in iv above vi city council hearing and review upon consideration of the recommendations of the planning and zoning commission and the development review committee the city council may elect to introduce an ordinance to annex the subject property and set a public hearing date for the proposed ordinance the public hearing and notices shall be consistent with requirements of the florida statutes exh a 102411 annexation application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the annexation application in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the community development director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following 1 minor voluntary annexation all applications for a minor voluntary annexation shall include a completed application form for minor annexation a completed application form for minor annexations with the name address and telephone number of applicants property owners and agentss the statement requesting to be annexed and the zoning districts to be established for subject propertyies and appropriate signatures all owners of real property subject to the petition shall be required to execute the petition under oath taken or administered before a notary public and each such owner shall attest to the truth of the statements on the petition or that to the best of such owners knowledge and belief the statements on the petition are true and correct petitions executed under corporate property owners shall be executed under corporate seal and by an authorized vicepresident or superior corporate office petitions executed by a partnership shall be executed by an authorized general partner if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed said parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw application must be submitted in writing to the community development department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c list of property owners if specific property is involved a list of the names and mailing addresses of all property owners of real property within five hundred 500 feet of outer perimeter of property proposed for annexation taken from most recent tax rolls in orange or seminole counties the fivehundredfoot distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point of the boundary of the subject property nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof d authorizations the name address and telephone number of any agent who is authorized to represent the owners of parcels of real property proposed to be annexed in any city review proceeding  if the agent is other than the property owners the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization for each from the property owners e supplemental information 1 vicinity map a vicinity map drawn to a noted scale and showing a the location of the proposed annexation  b relationships to surrounding streets  and c existing zoning and land use on the site and surrounding area within five 500 feet 2 surveylegal description a boundary survey and legal description for each parcel of property subject to the petition but owned by separate and distinct persons corporations partnerships or other legal entities  and prepared by a surveyor registered by the state under a surveyors seal and certified to the city if applicable provide gross and net land area which may be provided on a separate sheet 3 copy of deed a copy of a deed showing title to be vested in the name of the property owner listed on the petition form if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition for annexation shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing 4 analysis a an analysis of the degree of consistency of the proposed annexation with the citys comprehensive development plan b an analysis regarding compatibility of the development and proposed development of the land proposed for annexation with surrounding neighborhoods and land uses c an analysis determining if the annexation request is consistent with florida statutes for annexations 2 major voluntary annexation an application for a major annexation shall include everything required for a minor voluntary annexation application and shall also include a additional supplemental information 1 analysis a an analysis of the fiscal impact of the proposed annexation on the citys finances b an analysis of the impact of any existing development and proposed development on real property subject to the petition of all levels of service including data to illustrate that all adopted levels of service affecting the property are met or if any service levels are not met including maps of existing and proposed major sewer and water lines and storm water outfalls and the proposed extensions of these systems necessitated by the annexation data shall include but not limited to traffic stormwater drainage water sewer and parks and shall be in a format acceptable to the community development director c of the impact of any existing development and proposed development on the real property on significant environmental historical or natural resource areas within the city d of the citys ability to provide adequate public services to the land proposed for annexation eg police fire garbage etc 2 statement of benefit a general description of the proposed annexation explaining why the annexation is appropriate or beneficial to the city its residents and the owners of parcels of real property subject to the petition 3 phasing plan estimated timetable and method of financing for each public facility improvement necessitated by the proposed annexation 4 copy of title policy a copy of the owners title policy or a title opinion by a member of florida bar for proof of ownership of subject propertyies if requested by the city exh a 102411 secs 757759  reserved article iii  appeal of administrative ruling purpose and intent the procedures established in this article are intended to provide for adequate review of the interpretation and administration of the zoning code consistent with florida statutes  42291 applicability the procedures contained in this article are applicable to all appeals to the board of zoning adjustment concerning interpretation or administration of the zoning code any person aggrieved or any officer or bureau of the governing body of the city affected by any decision of the zoning administrator concerning the zoning code may appeal the determination or interpretation to the board of zoning adjustment any appeal must be filed in writing within thirty 30 days after the rendering in writing of the order requirement decision or determination subject to the appeal  42291 stay of proceedings an appeal stays all proceedings in furtherance of the action appealed from unless the zoning administrator from whom the appeal is taken certifies to the board of zoning adjustment after notice of appeal is filed that by reason of facts stated in the certificate a stay would cause imminent peril to life and property in such instance proceedings or work shall not be stayed except by a restraining order which may be granted by the board of zoning adjustment or by a court of record  42291 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges and expenses for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application the fees for appeal are not intended to prohibit legitimate applications  42291 application procedures i sufficiency review all applications for administrative appeal under this article shall be submitted to the zoning administrator the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted should the applicant fail to submit all information as required within five 5 days the application will not be considered complete and will not be accepted if complete the zoning administrator shall transmit to the board all application materials and any records deemed by the zoning administrator to be pertinent to the request ii notice of board of zoning adjustment hearing after receipt of a complete petition the city shall give notice in a newspaper of general circulation as defined in florida statutes at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the board of zoning adjustment public hearing date on which the petition is to be heard if the application involves a specific piece of property a notice shall be posted on the property subject to appeal and in two 2 public places and notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to all property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property all at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the board of zoning adjustment public hearing the distance for mailing notices shall be measured by a straight line from the point on the boundary of the property subject to the appeal nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addressed to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax roll in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a the name of the appellant  b the location of the property if applicable  c the action requested  and d the date time and location of the public hearing iii board of zoning adjustment public hearing the board of zoning adjustment public hearing shall be held within sixty 60 days of receipt of a complete application any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney the board of zoning adjustment shall render its decision to affirm the interpretation or administrative action of the zoning administrator or to grant the appeal consistent with the powers allocated to the board by city council  42291 administrative appeal application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the administrative appeal application in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the community development director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following a completed application form for administrative appeal a completed application form for administrative review with the name address and telephone number of each applicant property owner and agent statement indicating request and appropriate signatures if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw the application must be submitted in writing to the community development department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c list of property owners if specific property is involved a list of the names and mailing addresses of all property owners of real property within five hundred 500 feet of outer perimeter of property taken from most recent tax rolls in orange or seminole counties the fivehundredfoot distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point of the boundary of the subject property nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof d authorizations the name address and telephone number of any agent who is authorized to represent the owners of parcels of real property proposed in any city review proceeding  if the agent is other than the property owners the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization for each from the property owners e supplemental information 1 written statements a literal citation of questioned b applicants requested interpretation c copy of administrative officials determination of  legal description and street address if available for each parcel of real property subject to the petition  42291 secs 75167519  reserved article iv  comprehensive development plan amendments footnotes  3  editors note exh a adopted oct 24 201 amended and restated former art iv  75207524 in its entirety which pertained to the same subject matter and derived from     67      exh a  cross reference comprehensive development plan generally  1213 et seq purpose and intent the procedures established in this article are intended to provide for orderly and effective change for future development and quality of life in the city consistent with state law exh a 102411 applicability the procedures contained in this article are applicable to all requests for changes deletions or additions to goals objective policies or standards in the city comprehensive development plan as well as for requested changes on maps in the comprehensive plan a proposal to amend the comprehensive development plan may be initiated by any member of the city council any member of the local planning agency or by the city manager or division or department head of the city by filing a written proposal with the community development department as provided in this article the written proposal shall be classified as an application as that term is used herein and the proposal may be in a separate written document or as part of the minutes of the local planning agency of or city council applications filed pursuant to this paragraph shall be classified as administrative applications of the city and shall be exempt from the requirements of sections 7523 and 7524 hereof a proposal to amend the comprehensive development plan may also be initiated by an owner of real property within the city a governmental entity other than the city or others these applicants are required to meet all the provisions of this article except as otherwise noted exh a 102411 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges and expenses for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application exh a 102411 application procedures i sufficiency review a complete written application for an amendment to the comprehensive development plan shall be submitted to the zoning administrator by no later than the close of business on the last regular city business day in december to be considered for cycle one review and no later than the close of business by the last regular city business day in june for cycle two amendment process cycle two processing will commence following adoption of cycle one amendments unless otherwise approved by city council cycle two will follow all sequential review application material submission and processing requirements specified herein for cycle one with the exception of exact review months for each step may be adjusted depending on the adoption date for cycle one amendments the zoning administrator will examine the application and request that the applicant supply additional information or clarify ambiguities if any in the application within five 5 working days of application submittal if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted should the applicant fail to submit all information as required within five 5 working days the application will not be considered complete and will not be accepted ii information prehearing review applications may be reviewed by the city administrative staff development review committee and the local planning agency prior to a public hearing the review shall be considered to be for information purposes only and not part of the amendment procedure iii review by the development review committee the development review committee shall review the application and provide a draft report for the local planning agency by the third thursday in march or as soon thereafter as may reasonably be possible the report shall include an analysis of the application according to the following factors if applicable a whether the proposed amendment will have a favorable or unfavorable effect on the citys budget or the economy of the city or the region  b whether the proposed amendment will diminish the service level of the citys transportation system and if it will whether an adequate agreement between the property owners and the city has been consummated that will provide for improvement of the citys transportation system in such a way that the proposed amendment will not diminish the level of service and will incur no cost to the city  c whether there will be a favorable or unfavorable impact on the environment or the natural or historical resources of the city or the region as a result of the proposed amendment  d whether the proposed amendment is consistent with the comprehensive development plan  e whether the city is able to provide adequate public services to the affected property if the amendment is granted and whether the amendment will promote the efficient use of or decrease the service levels to unacceptable standards for water sewer solid waste disposal recreational facilities or other facilities  f whether the amendment is incompatible with surrounding neighborhoods and land uses  g whether approval of the amendment will cause the comprehensive development plan to be internally inconsistent  h whether the amendment will have a favorable or adverse effect on the ability of workers to find adequate housing reasonably accessible to their places of employment  i whether the proposed amendment will promote or adversely affect the public health safety welfare economic order or aesthetics of the region or the city  and j the contents of any evaluation and appraisal report prepared pursuant to the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act fs   et seq iv notice of local planning agency hearing after receipt of a complete petition the city shall place a notice of the time place date and purpose of the local planning agency public hearing in a newspaper of general circulation as defined by florida statutes with the first publication not less than fifteen 15 days prior to the date of public hearing if the application involves a specific piece of property a notice shall be posted on the subject property and in two 2 public places as well as the city web site and notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to all property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property all at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the local planning agency public hearings the distance for mailing notices shall be measured by a straight line from the point on the boundary of the property subject to the application nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addressed to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax roll in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a a statement that a comprehensive plan amendment has been requested  b the legal description of the property subject to the amendment request  and a general location map to correspond with the legal description of the property as noted on the hearing notice this does not mandate publication of the location map in the newspaper noted above unless otherwise required by florida statutes c the name of the owners of the property subject to the petition  d that a public hearing will be held by the planning and zoning commission  e the date time and location of the hearing  f that the public is invited to attend the hearing and make comment orally or in writing  and g the location and times during which an interested party may inspect the petition v local planning agency public hearing the public hearing on plan amendments received for the years cycle shall be held by the local planning agency on the first thursday in april or as soon thereafter as may be reasonably possible for the city staff to schedule the hearing and prepare a report from the development review committee and as may be reasonably convenient for the local planning agency any party may appear at the hearing in person or by agent or by attorney the local planning agency shall encourage and accept oral and written comments from the applicant or the applicants agent or attorney the development review committee the city administration other governmental entities and the general public letters or other written communication received by the city regarding a pending application shall be considered by the local planning agency and made part of the record if the proposed amendment is the subject of an evaluation and appraisal report prepared pursuant to the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act fs   et seq the local planning agency shall consider the report and make it part of the record vi development review committee recommendations the development review committee shall make a recommendation to the local planning agency on the second thursday in april or as soon thereafter as possible the development review committee may recommend that the application be denied approved or approved with modifications the recommendation shall be based on the factors outlined in section 7523iiia j any public input received and direction from the local planning agency vii local planning agency recommendation to city council on the third thursday in april or as soon thereafter as possible the local planning agency shall make a recommendation to the city council with regard to each application the recommendation may be based upon all factors affecting the public health safety welfare economic order public interest and aesthetics but the recommendation must also include a finding whether the proposal satisfies the following standards a that the proposed amendment will not have a negative effect on the citys budget  b that the proposed amendment will not diminish the service level of the citys transportation system or if it will then an adequate agreement between the property owners and the city has been consummated that will provide for improvement of the citys transportation system in such a way that the proposed amendment will not diminish the level of service and will incur no cost to the city  c that there will be no negative impact on the environment as a result of the proposed amendment  d that the proposed amendment is consistent with the comprehensive development plan  e that the city is able to provide adequate public services to the affected property and that service levels will not be reduced to below adopted service levels if the amendment is granted  and f that the amendment is not incompatible with surrounding neighborhoods and land uses the recommendation of the local planning agency may be to deny an application approve an application or approve an application with modifications if the recommendation of the local planning agency is for denial of a request the minutes or a separate written document shall reflect the basis of the local planning agencys recommendation of denial viii city council first public hearing the city council shall hold a public hearing with public notice as may be required from time to time by the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act fs   et seq the public hearing shall be the first monday in may or as soon thereafter as may be reasonably possible and convenient for the city council the city council shall encourage and accept oral and written comments from the applicant or the applicants agent or attorney the development review committee the city administration other governmental entities and the general public the report of the development review committee and the local planning agency letters or other written communications received by the city administration and any other written comments entered into the record during the local planning agency public hearing all regarding any pending application for amendment of the comprehensive development plan shall be made a part of the record during the city council public hearing after completion of the public hearing the city council may approve an application for transmittal to the state land planning agency or deny an application if an application is denied the applicant shall be advised in writing within twenty 20 calendar days of the decision to deny the application in such case no further action need be taken by the city ix transmittal of amendment to state if an application is approved for transmittal to the state land planning agency or approved with modifications for transmittal to the state land planning agency the proposed change shall be promptly forwarded by the community development department to the state land planning agency for review x city council second public hearing after receipt of all comments forwarded to the city by the state land planning agency regarding the amendments proposed by applications reviewed pursuant to the city the city council shall hold a public hearing with such public notice as may be required from time to time by the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act fs   et seq during the public hearing all comments received from the state local planning agency together with comments from other governmental entities shall be made part of the record the city council shall encourage and accept oral and written comments from the applicant or the applicants agent or attorney the city administration other governmental entities and the general public letters and other written communications received by the city after the first city council public hearing shall be made part of the record during the city council public hearing upon final action by the city council the applicant shall be advised in writing within twenty 20 calendar days of the final decision exh a 102411 application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the comprehensive development plan amendment application in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the community development director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following a completed application form for cdp amendment a completed application form for comprehensive development plan amendment with the name address and telephone number of applicants property owners and development plan and appropriate signatures all owners of real property specific to the petition shall be required to execute the petition under oath taken or administered before a notary public and each such owner shall attest to the truth of the statements on the petition or that to the best of the owners knowledge and belief the statements on the petition are true and correct petitions executed under corporate property ownership shall be executed under corporate seal and by an authorized vicepresident or superior corporate office petitions executed by a partnership shall be executed by an authorized general partner if ownership of any part of or all of the real property specific to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw the application must be submitted in writing by the signatoryies of the application to the community development department should the application for amendment to the comprehensive development plan be submitted as a text amendment that does not amend the future land use map signatures of at least one but not all owners of property specific to the amendment shall be required b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c list of property owners if a future land use map change is requested a list of the names and mailing addresses of all property owners of real property within five hundred 500 feet of outer perimeter of property proposed for amendment taken from most recent tax rolls in orange or seminole counties the fivehundredfoot distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point of the boundary of the subject property nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof d authorizations the name address and telephone number of any agent who is authorized to represent the owners of parcels of real property proposed for amendment for a land use map amendment if the agent is other than the property owners the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization for each from the property owners for a text amendment the applicant may provide a notarized letter of authorization for an agent to represent the property owner whose signature appears on the application form pursuant to a completed application form for cdp amendment above e supplemental information 1 surveylegal description a boundary survey and legal description for each parcel of property or an exterior boundary survey if the amendment involves more than one property for which a land use map amendment is proposed such survey shall be prepared by a surveyor registered by the state under a surveyors seal with the date of certification not in excess of one year if applicable provide net and gross land area which may be provided on a separate sheet 2 vicinity map a vicinity map if the proposed amendment involves a specific property drawn to a noted scale and showing a the location of the subject propertyies  b relationship to surrounding streets  and c existing zoning and land use on the site and surrounding areas within five hundred 500 feet 3 analysis a an analysis of the degree of consistency of the proposed amendment with the citys comprehensive development plan and whether an internal inconsistency between provisions might be created b an analysis of the fiscal impact of the proposed amendment on the citys finances c an analysis of the impact of the amendment on all levels of service including data to illustrate that all adopted levels of service affecting the property are met or if any service levels are not met including maps of existing and proposed major sewer and water lines and stormwater outfalls and the proposed extensions of these systems necessitated by the annexation data shall include but not limited to traffic stormwater drainage water sewer and parks and shall be in a format acceptable to the community development director d an analysis of the impact of the amendment on the environmental historical or natural resource areas within the city e an analysis of the citys ability to provide adequate public services with regard to the amendment eg police fire garbage etc f if the application involves a specific parcel of real property an analysis of the compatibility and impacts of the proposed amendment on surrounding neighborhoods and land uses 4 statement of appropriateness a general description of the proposed amendment to the comprehensive development plan explaining why the amendment is necessary or appropriate 5 phasing plan estimated timetable and method of financing for each public facility improvement necessitated by the comprehensive development plan amendment exh a 102411 secs 75257529  reserved article v  offsite and shared parking and combined onsite parking  footnotes purpose and intent the procedures established in this article are intended to provide for an effective alternative to onsite parking where property exists within six hundred 600 feet to satisfy parking needs consistent with quality development standards acceptable to the city the procedures established in this article are also intended to provide for an effective alternative method to establish combined onsite parking consistent with quality development standards acceptable to the city exh a 102411 applicability the procedures contained in this article are applicable to all required offstreet parking facilities which are not located on the same lot or parcel of land they are intended to serve but which are located within six hundred 600 feet of the lot or parcel for which they are intended in addition the procedures contained in this article are applicable to all required offstreet parking facilities where the owners or operators of adjacent buildings or uses or uses within the same building make collective provisions for such facilities the owners or operators of parcels requiring offstreet parking facilities which are within six hundred 600 feet of each other may make collective provision for such facilities the development review committee may approve shared parking facilities for developments or uses with differing or nonoverlapping operating hours or different peak business periods or excess parking spaces if the shared parking complies with items a g below combined onsite parking must meet items c g below a required parking spaces reserved for accessible parking may not be located offsite b shared parking spaces must be located within six hundred 600 feet of the lot or parcel they are intended to serve c required parking spaces reserved for persons who require accessibility shall meet all requirements of the americans with disabilities act accessibility guidelines adaag and of the florida building d those wishing to use shared parking as a means of satisfying offstreet parking requirements must submit a shared parking studyanalysis to the community development department that clearly demonstrates the feasibility of shared parking the studies must be provided in a form established by the community development department the analysis must address at a minimum the size and type of the proposed development the composition of tenants the anticipated rate of parking turnover and the anticipated peak parking and traffic loads for all uses that will be sharing offstreet parking spaces e a shared parking plan shall be enforced agreement among all owners of record and shall be subject to approval by the city the owners shall agree to bear the expense of recording the agreement and such agreement shall bind owners and their heirs successors and assigns an attested copy of the agreement between the owners of record shall be submitted to the community development department recordation of the agreement must take place before issuance of a building permit or certificate of occupancy for any use to be served by the shared parking area f when the uses or the property subject to shared parking agreement are proposed to change the community development director or designee shall have the authority to require a revised shared parking study and shall with the approval of the development review committee either revoke the shared parking agreement when it is determined that it is no longer necessary to meet the parking requirements of the uses or shall require a new shared parking agreement when the revised parking study indicates additional parking is required g the community development director or designee may reevaluate a parking agreement previously approved by the city under the following circumstances 1 expiration of the agreement  2 when there is proposed revision to the use or property that would require additional parking under the maitland city parking such as an increase in square footage of structuresbuildings affected by the agreement or increased seating or employee counts for restaurants  or 3 when there is a proposed revision to the use or property that would require less parking under the maitland city parking such as modifications to reduce seating area for restaurants or changes in use exh a 102411 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges and expenses for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application in addition to administrative fees the applicant is responsible for all fees associated with recording any agreement required to effect an approved application exh a 102411 application procedures i sufficiency review all applications under this article shall be submitted to the zoning administrator the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted should the applicant fail to submit all information as required within five 5 working days the application will not be considered complete and will not be accepted ii review and decision by development review committee after receipt of a complete petition the development review committee shall formulate its decision to approve approve with changes or deny the application such action shall be taken within twentyone 21 days of the date the application is determined sufficient by the zoning administrator in doing so the development review committee shall make findings with regard to the following factors a whether the proposed application will diminish the service levels adopted by the city b whether there is compliance with the applicable ordinances and regulations for the proposed development c whether the proposed agreement to effect the proposed application is sufficient d whether circumstances exist that warrant offsiteshared parking or combined onsite parking this procedure does not apply where approval may be granted as part of a formal application review process such as for the site plan review permitted conditional use review or planned development review processes within the city of maitland for these instances the required application materials should be included as part of the respective application processes iii recording of agreements no approval granted by the development review committee shall be effective until all agreements required to effect the approval have been recorded with the orange county comptrollers office exh a 102411 offsite and shared parking application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the offsite and shared parking application in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the community development director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following a completed application form for offsite and shared parking a completed application form for offsite and shared parking with the name address and telephone number of applicant property owners and agents the request for offsite or shared parking and appropriate signatures if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw application must be submitted in writing to the community development department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time by the city council c authorizations the name address and telephone number of any agent who is authorized to represent the owners of parcels of real property in any city review proceeding  if the agent is other than the property owners the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization for each from the property owners d supplemental information 1 vicinity map drawn to a noted scale and showing a the location of the proposed parking area and sites to be served by the parking area  b connections to surrounding streets  and c existing zoning and land use on the site and surrounding areas within five hundred 500 feet 2 site plans for propertyies subject to the application with a north arrow and drawn to scale and to include a legal description and property lines drawn to scale  b street address if applicable  c required and proposed offstreet parking detail number and location loading areas service and refuse areas  d schematic landscape plan if requested by the city  e screening and buffering if requested by the city reference type dimensions and character  f the layout of bikeways and pedestrian ways especially those linking parking area to buildings to be served  g locations of ingressegress to property existing and proposed  h parking studyanalysis that clearly demonstrates the feasibility of shared parking the analysis must address at a minimum the size and type of the proposed development the composition of tenants the anticipated rate of parking turnover and the anticipated peak parking demand and traffic loads for all uses that will be sharing offstreet parking spaces  and i existing and proposed buildings located on site 3 level of service data and analysis data illustrating that all adopted levels of service affecting the property are met or if any service levels are not met schedule of improvements which will be provided to ensure that all service levels are met  and a detailed analysis of parking requirements including time of use and function to support request 4 agreements submit copies of all agreements proposed to effect application request 5 existing building uses listed for all buildings if any and intended use of each building or portion thereof 6 signs and lighting if any existing and proposed locations elevations and typical sections should an item listed under the category of supplemental information in d above be determined by the community development director or designee as not applicable to a particular application the items may be waived without affecting the sufficiency of the application exh a 102411 secs 75357539  reserved article vi  development agreement amendment footnotes  5  editors note exh a adopted oct 24 201 repealed former art vi  75407546 in its entirety which pertained to permitted conditional uses and derived from      exh a adopted feb 13 201 added a new art vi as herein set out purpose and intent the purpose of this article is to ensure that when an amendment to a development agreement da which was adopted pursuant to et seq florida statutes is considered by the city of maitland that a review process is articulated within the maitland city provide for a clear and efficient review process exh a 21312 applicability the procedures contained in this article are applicable to any amendment to a da previously adopted by the city of maitland pursuant to florida statutes when referencing a florida statute within this article it shall include its successor provisions exh a 21312 procedure for amendment to a development agreement da i development review committee review and recommendation the development review committee drc shall review the da amendment and provide a recommendation to the lpa to approve approve with modifications or deny the da amendment the drc shall make findings as to each proposed da amendment and shall forward such findings to the lpa the findings shall be based on the following criteria a whether the amendment to the da is consistent with the city of maitland 2030 comprehensive plan or as may be amended  and b whether the provisions of the da amendment are in the best interests of the public health safety welfare economic order and aesthetics of the region and the community  and c whether the development will adversely affect the orderly development of property in the area of the parcel of land subject to the da amendment  and d any findings required to be made pursuant to florida statutes ii local planning agency public hearing and recommendation upon consideration of the recommendations of the drc the lpa shall hold a public hearing notification of the public hearing shall be accomplished pursuant florida statutes following the public hearing and after review of the drc recommendation and findings the lpa shall make its written recommendation to the city council and shall make a written finding certifying consistency with the items listed in i a d above iii city council public hearing and decision upon consideration of the recommendations of the lpa and the drc the city council shall hold a public hearing notification of the public hearing shall be published and mailed in accordance with florida statutes following the public hearing the city council shall approve or approve with modifications or deny the proposed da amendment this does not preclude an additional public hearings as may be required by law or as may be deemed appropriate by the city exh a 21312 procedure for minor amendments to a development agreement i review and approval by community development director a minor amendments to a development agreement may be approved as a nonstatutory development agreement pursuant to the citys home rule powers under the florida constitution and florida statutes after review by the community development director provided 1 the change is substantially consistent with the overall purposes and intent of the approved development agreement  and 2 the change conforms to all other applicable city ordinances and regulations  and 3 the change does not require a change in any other provision of the development agreement that would require review under section 7542  and 4 the change is not inconsistent with the citys comprehensive development plan b an amendment is considered minor if it includes one or more of the following 1 adds less than five 5 percent of the approximate structural square footage of the project if the development agreement states an approximate maximum square footage of the project 2 changes provisions regarding easements or utilities so that more effective service levels can be achieved 3 corrects any scriveners errors 4 changes provisions which are specifically provided for as minor in the approved development agreement 5 change time frames for development application review as long as the modified schedule does not trigger any default dates that may exist within the agreement and the modified review time frames and all required improvements can be accomplished without an extension of the expiration date of the agreement 6 changes resulting from changes to any section or subsection numbers of amended florida statutes florida administrative or any other state or local law so long as the substance of the state or local law has not changed 7 when the development agreement provides that a city official take certain action the change adds that the city official or his or her designee may execute the action 8 changes provisions that allow administrative site plan reviews by providing that site plan reviews shall be processed in accordance with of 9 extends the effective date of a current unexpired development agreement if state law applicable to the development agreement requires such extension so long as the developer follows the requirements of the law 10 when a development agreement requires a letter of credit or maintenance bond the change allows other forms of security interest so long as any surety is approved by the city staff  provided however that any stated amount or percentage of the security interest remains the same 11 changes the corporate name or address of developer when such changes have been accomplished state 12 changes the name of the subject property or project unless the name of the subject property listed in the development agreement is the same as an alreadyplatted subdivision ii development review committee review and recommendation if the community development director desires review and recommendation by the drc for a determination of whether the change is minor she may require drc to review the proposed change the drc shall recommend approval or denial that the change is minor iii decision of community development director if the community development director determines when applying the above criteria that the change is minor the amendment shall be prepared executed and recorded in the public records of orange county without necessity of any public hearings before the lpa or city council if the community development director determines that the change is not minor she shall state reasons in writing to the applicant and the amendment shall be reviewed in accordance with section 7542 exh a 21312 periodic review of development agreements the community development director or designee shall review each development agreement in accordance with florida statutes or as may be amended a determination shall be made as to whether the developer has complied with the terms of the development agreement the development agreement may be revoked or modified by the city of maitland in accordance with florida statutes or canceled at any time in accordance with florida statutes  or revoked in accordance with florida statutes exh a 21312 secs 7549  reserved article vii  planned development footnotes  6  editors note exh a adopted oct 24 201 amended former art vii  75507558 to read as herein set out former art vii pertained to the same subject matter and derived from  adopted  purpose and intent the planned development review process established in this article is intended to implement zoning amendment requests for planned developments consistent with the citys comprehensive plan and zoning regulations the procedures will provide efficient review of zoning amendment requests for the planned development district with particular attention to levels of service established in the citys comprehensive plan and design and performance criteria established by the city to guide development exh a 102411 applicability the procedures contained in this article are applicable to all zoning amendment requests for the planned development zoning district it shall be unlawful for any person to construct erect or alter a building or structure or to develop change or improve land or to change the use for which an approved final development plan is required by this article except in accordance with an approved final development plan exh a 102411 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges and expenses for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any planned development application exh a 102411 planned development application procedures i preapplication conference before submitting an application the applicant shall schedule a preapplication conference with the development review committee to review the proposed development the applicant shall obtain a copy of the preapplication form from the community development department the city shall provide written comments to the applicant prior to the development review committee preapplication meeting the preapplication process serves as an opportunity to examine ideas and share information between the city of maitland and an applicant for a potential development project in a conceptual application format the comments and information provided by the city do not constitute a waiver of any requirements contained in the citys land development   but are meant to assist in the preparation of the application for formal submittal a preapplication conference must be held no more than six 6 months prior to filing an application for planned development following the preapplication conference the applicant may submit an application for a planned development which consists of a development plan submittal as well as a zoning amendment the applicant shall submit the application and supplemental materials to the community development department in quantities designated by the city applicants are encouraged to meet with neighborhoods and surrounding property ownersresidents prior to formal submittal of an application for planned development to discuss plans for the property that will be subject to the pd zoning and to be able to understand and respond to any valid concerns via design modifications the application for planned development provides two 2 options to proceed application process they are option 1 and option 2 the option 1 application for planned development provides the opportunity to proceed planned development review process and obtain rezoning and development plan approval but does not require final development plan level information such as final engineering and final storm water calculations during this stage of the application process selecting option 1 will not result in a waiver of any requirement stated within the land development   rather it allows the information to be submitted as part of the site plan review process following city council approval of the planned development application after the city council has approved the planned development application the applicant must submit an application for site plan review pursuant to section 7583ii of the maitland city to the development review committee for an administrative review the site plan review process will require submittal of final engineering and final storm water calculations as well as other detailed application materials necessary to complete the citys technical review of the application and obtain final site plan approval the option 2 process allows the applicant to choose to submit final development plan application review materials including items such as final engineering and sealed and engineered final storm water calculations listed in section 7556 of the maitland city does not require the site plan review submittal because final development plan site plan review materials are included in this review both option 1 and option 2 will require the public hearing and public notification processes outlined in section 7553iii of the maitland city ii sufficiency review for zoning amendment and planned development all applications for a zoning amendment to a planned development district shall be submitted to the zoning administrator applications must be submitted no later than  noon at least forty 40 days prior to the first or 3rd thursday of any month the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be processed iii notice of planning and zoning commission hearing after receipt of a complete petition the city shall give notice in a newspaper of general circulation as defined in florida statutes at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the planning and zoning commission public hearing date on which the petition is to be heard notice shall be posted on the property subject to the petition and in two 2 public places as well as the city web site notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property the distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point on the boundary of the property subject to the planned development zoning amendment petition nearest to the point of the boundary of any surrounding property notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addressed to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax roll in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a a statement that the planned development zoning district classification has been requested for the property  b the legal description of the property subject to the petition and a general location map to correspond with the legal description of the property as noted on the hearing notice this does not mandate publication of the location map in the newspaper noted above unless otherwise required by florida statutes c the name of the owners of the property subject to the petition  d that a public hearing will be held by the planning and zoning commission  e the date time and location of the hearing  f advise that the public is invited to attend the hearing and make comment orally or in writing  and g the location and times during which an interested party may inspect the petition iv planning and zoning commission public hearing the planning and zoning commission public hearing shall be held on the first or third thursday of the month any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney to discuss andor comment on the petition following the public hearing the planning and zoning commission has the option to a provide an additional review of the application by the planning and zoning commission to finalize its review comments  or b forward its comments to the city council without further review by the planning and zoning commission in either case before any recommendation is forwarded to city council the planning and zoning commission shall make a written finding certifying consistency with the comprehensive development plan and finding that satisfactory provision and arrangements have been made concerning the factors itemized for development review committee review the written finding shall also certify compliance with the specific rules governing planned developments as may be applicable to the application under review a if the planning and zoning commission chooses to review the application again  it shall declare at the public hearing that the application shall be returned following the development review committees action on the application after its review is complete the planning and zoning commission shall forward a recommendation to the city council including any conditions and findings for approval approval with modifications or denial of the application b the planning and zoning commission may choose to provide a recommendation directly to the city council in such cases the planning and zoning commission shall forward instructions to the development review committee regarding the development of detailed conditions to include in the findings and recommendation being forwarded to the city council the development review committee will then finalize the recommendation for consideration by the city council unless the development review committee recommendation is contrary to that of the planning and zoning commission recommendation in this case the development review committee shall return the recommendation to the planning and zoning commission for finalization v review by development review committee following a public hearing by the planning and zoning commission the development review committee shall review the petition and any testimony that was made at the hearing and shall provide reasonable assistance to the applicant to bring the project in compliance with the land development other applicable regulations and agreements the applicant may continue to work with development review committee until such time that the development review committee determines the proposal is consistent with all applicable regulations and the item is ready to be placed on the next practical planning and zoning commission or city council agenda if the streamline approach is taken pursuant to 7553iv should the applicant determine they no longer desire to work with development review committee to resolve the items the applicant may choose to proceed to the next required planning and zoning commission or city council meeting where staff shall advise of the applicants decision to proceed without completing modifications required by development review committee in all cases the development review committee will generate and forward a written recommendation that will accompany the petition to the next step of the review process the development review committee shall make a recommendation for approval approval with conditions or denial of the proposed petition the development review committee shall formulate its recommendation and make findings with regard to the following factors a ingress and egress to property and proposed structures thereon with particular reference to automotive and pedestrian safety connectivity and convenience traffic flow and control and access in case of fire or catastrophe  b offstreet parking and loading areas where required with particular attention to the items in a above  c the economic noise glare or odor effects of the proposed development on the city as a whole and on the surrounding properties  d refuse and service areas with particular reference to the items in a and b above  e screening and buffering with reference to type dimensions and character  f signs if any and proposed exterior lighting with reference to glare traffic safety economic effects and compatibility and harmony with properties in the area  g required yards and other open space  h general compatibility with adjacent properties and other property in the surrounding area  i whether there is compliance with the applicable ordinances and regulations for the proposed development  where compliance is not achieved whether the development adversely impacts adjacent and surrounding properties and unduly burdens city operations and facilities  j whether the proposed development will lower the applicable levels of service below the levels adopted in the citys comprehensive development plan and whether the proposed development is phased to be constructed at a time when the adopted service levels are met  k whether the time frames proposed for development are consistent with requirements of the comprehensive plan and other applicable regulations  l whether the phase of development in question can exist as an independent unit capable of creating an environment of substantial desirability and stability  m whether there is substantial compliance with the purpose and intent of the planned development district  n reserved o whether offsite credits incentives proposed if any have been satisfactorily addressed if applicable  p whether mobility strategies for a transportation concurrency exception area tcea are required and have been satisfactorily addressed if applicable  q whether the existing or proposed utility services and transportation systems are adequate for the proposed development  whether all adopted levels of service have been or will be adequately met  and r whether the proposed development plan is consistent with the comprehensive development plan s within the packwood district of downtown maitland a development project of multifamily dwellings apartments condominiums and townhomes    mixed use projects with residential uses on the ground floor  and projects including livework units as defined in section 2121iiih2  shall also meet the following criteria 1 for projects with frontage on major commercial street type i  us 1792 orlando avenue and horatio avenue east of orlando avenue and street type ii secondary commercial streets for horatio avenue between orlando avenue and maitland avenue and for independence lane identified in no less than fifty 50 percent of the ground floor square footage of a building or development site shall be allocated to retail office andor other commercial uses parking garages and any residential accessory uses such as leasing offices clubhouses and exercise room facilities shall not be considered commercial uses for the purposes of this section for any allocation less than fifty 50 percent of the ground floor square footage of a building or development site approval may only be granted based upon evidence that an allocation of fifty 50 percent or greater of the ground floor square footage as retail office andor other commercial uses would not be viable use within the development and evidence that the proposed allocation of residential uses will further the objectives and purposes of the packwood district described in section 2121 and section 233 of the maitland city in no case shall ground floor commercial square footage be approved at less than twentyfive 25 percent of a building or development site buildings fronting the above streets shall have a minimum clear height measured slab to slab of fourteen 14 feet for the ground floor other floors shall have a minimum clear height of nine 9 feet 2 for any allocation less than twentyfive 25 percent of the ground floor square footage of a building or development site for projects without frontage on orlando avenue horatio avenue or independence lane approval shall only evidence that the proposed allocation of residential uses will further the objectives and purposes of the packwood district described in section 2121 and section 232 of the maitland city t within and exercise rooms facilities shall not be considered commercial uses for the purposes of this section 1 for any allocation of less than twentyfive 25 percent of the ground floor square footage of a building or development site approval shall only be granted based upon evidence that an allocation of twentyfive 25 or greater of the ground floor square footage as retail office andor other
