in section 7553 vs2 and vt1 above shall present evidence that the project furthers the purpose of sections 2121 pd planned development district and 232 downtown maitland special district purpose and intent vi recommendation by planning and zoning commission the planning and zoning commission shall make its written recommendation to the city council unless item ivb above has been selected as part of its recommendation to the city council the planning and zoning commission shall make a written finding certifying consistency with the comprehensive development plan and that satisfactory provision and arrangement has been made concerning the factors itemized for review by the development review committee in v above vii city council hearing and review upon consideration of the recommendations of the planning and zoning commission and the development review committee the city council may elect to introduce an ordinance to effect the zoning amendment for the subject property and set a public hearing date for the proposed ordinance if the request involves less than five 5 percent of the total land area of the city the city council shall hold one 1 public hearing with official notice on the matter if the request involves more than five 5 percent of the total land area of the city the council shall hold two 2 public hearings on the matter the public hearing and notices shall be consistent with requirements of the florida statutes viii city council decision at a regularly scheduled meeting following the introduction of the ordinance to effect the zoning amendment the city council shall hold a public hearing and may adopt the ordinance to effect the zoning amendment and may accept or accept with modifications or reject the final development plan if the city council rejects the final development plan it shall also reject the rezoning ordinance action by the city council to approve or to approve with conditions or to deny an application shall be deemed final any person aggrieved by action of the city council may seek recourse to the courts as provided by the laws of florida ix failure of city council to act if a planning and zoning commission recommendation for change is not acted upon by the city council within ninety 90 days of the date of its receipt by city council the petition upon which the recommendation is based shall be deemed to have been denied x limitations whenever the city council has by amendment changed the zoning classification of property the planning and zoning commission shall not consider any petition for rezoning of any part or all of the same property for a period of one 1 year from the effective date of the amendatory ordinance whenever the city council has denied a petition the city council shall not a consider any further petition for the same rezoning of any part or all of the same property for a period of one 1 year from the date of such action  the time limits of this subsection may be waived by the affirmative vote of four 4 members of the city council when such action is deemed necessary to prevent injustice or to facilitate the proper development of the city xi if an applicant utilized option 1 following approval of the planned development applicationzoning amendment the applicant must submit an application for site plan review by the development review committee pursuant to the citys land development site plan application is an administrative review and will follow the submittal requirements outlined in section 75 83ii of the maitland city site plan reviews in conjunction with the site plan review process the development review committee shall make these additional findings with regard to the following factors a whether there is substantial compliance with the preliminary development plan and pd ordinance  b whether the phase of development in question can exist as an independent unit capable of creating an environment of substantial desirability and stability  c whether the existing or proposed utility services and transportation systems are adequate for the proposed development  whether all adopted levels of service have been or will be adequately met  and that any accompanying engineering plans have been approved by the city  and d whether the proposed site plan is consistent with the comprehensive development plan if an applicant utilized option 2 following approval of the planned development applicationzoning amendment ordinance an applicant may proceed to the site permitting and building permitting processes of the city of maitland exh a 102411   41116    81417    92517  administration of building permits the building official shall approve all permits for site preparation buildings and structures in the area covered by the approved planned development final development plan application and to insure conformity with the approved application and with all other applicable ordinances and regulations after approval of an application the modification or alteration of any buildings structures or land areas shall be in substantial accordance with the approved application and development plan exh a 102411 revision of development plan minor changes to an approved planned development application and final development plan may be permitted after review and approval by the community development director provided the changes are substantially consistent with the purposes and intent of the approved planned development and final development plan and provided that they conform to all other applicable city ordinances and regulations changes are considered minor if they include the following a realignment of an internal roadway or curb cut to improve traffic flow turn movements or other safety considerations b relocate parking or retention areas within the site to increase percolation or reduce runoff from the site over and above the approved site plan c add or delete less than five 5 percent of the structural square footage of the project d relocate the orientation of the footprint of a building provided it maintains the same distance from the existing singlefamily development e decrease density height intensity or building coverage f realignment of an approved wall fence or hedge to avoid existing trees or attempt to resolve a problem peculiar to the site g amend sign package provided it does not increase in sign area by more than ten 10 percent h addition of a childrens play area including construction of a fence or wall for security of the play area the community development director may at his sole discretion pass any of the items a h onto the development review committee for their consideration all changes not specifically listed in this section may be considered by and may be approved by the development review committee as a minor change if determined to be substantially consistent with the approved development plan and development order and provided that the proposed changes do not result in a substantial deviation from the approved development plan and development order substantial deviation shall mean a change to an accepted overall development plan and development order which creates a reasonable likelihood of adverse impact to any portion of the project devoted to a specific use or to adjacent properties any decision rendered by the development review committee may be appealed to the city council within thirty 30 days of the date that the decision is rendered however following consideration of the proposed revision should the development review committee determine the change does not qualify as a minor revision then the revisions shall be forwarded to the planning and zoning commission and city council for final approval exh a 102411 planned development application extension for a period of up to one 1 year three hundred sixtyfive 365 days when the city council deems such action is necessary to prevent injustice or to facilitate the proper development of the city at its discretion and for good cause the city council may extend for one 1 additional year the period for beginning construction if the approved final development plan lapses under this provision the zoning administrator shall notify the property owner of the lapse of approval for the preliminary development plan and the final development plan and inform the property owner that resubmission under the procedure outlined for this district will be necessary exh a 102411   62716  559  reserved article viii  rightofwayutility easement abandonment purpose and intent the procedures established in this article are intended to provide for an orderly and efficient review of public easements or rightsofway which are desired for various reasons to be closed vacated or abandoned the procedures ensure coordination with utility needs and public interests and consistency with florida statutes  42291 applicability the procedures in this article are applicable to any person firm or entity including a governmental entity other than the city seeking to close vacate or abandon an easement or rightofway in the city  42291 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges and expenses for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application  42291 application procedures i sufficiency review all applications for a rightofway abandonment or utility easement vacation in the city shall be submitted to the public works director the public works director will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted should the applicant fail to submit all information as required within five 5 days the application will not be considered complete and will not be accepted ii review and recommendation by the development review committee after receipt of a complete petition the development review committee shall review the petition based on existing and future needs of the city and shall make a recommendation to the city council for approval approval with conditions or denial of the petition iii city council decision upon consideration of the recommendations of the development review committee the city council may elect to introduce an ordinance to effect the petition public hearings and notices shall be consistent with requirements of florida statutes application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the rightofwayutility easement abandonment application in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the public works director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following a completed application form for rightofwayutility abandonment a completed application form for rightofwayutility abandonment with the name address and telephone number of applicants property owners and agents statement indicating request and appropriate signatures if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the public works department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw application must be submitted in writing to the public works department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c applicant authorization if the applicant or agent is other than the property owner the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization from the property owner d supplemental information 1 vicinity map drawn to a noted scale and showing a the location of the proposed easement or rightofway  b relationships to surrounding streets  and c existing zoning and land use on the site and surrounding areas within five hundred 500 feet 2 copy of plat or deed showing portion thereof for which vacation is sought 3 legal description of street alley or easement to be closed or vacated 4 letters of approval from all utility companies electric gas cable and telephone and if under administration of orange county or the state letters of approval from appropriate jurisdictions  42291 secs 75657569  reserved article ix  road access to state roads purpose and intent the florida legislature has passed 33518 florida statutes the state highway system access management act which expresses the legislative intent that local governments assert an active role in cooperation with the florida department of transportation in planning and controlling access to the florida state highway system in addition the state highway system access management act authorizes local governments to require access permits from persons seeking to install additional connections to the state highway system within such local governments jurisdiction including the responsibility to develop accesspermitting standards and to grant or deny access permit applications therefore the city has determined that municipal regulation of connections to the public streets roads and other rightsofway within the city would greatly promote the public welfare and safety assist in coordinating land use planning decisions and aid in reducing the citys traffic congestion problem  42291 applicability any person firm or entity including a governmental entity other than the city seeking to connect alter or improve access to the state highway system within the city must first apply for and receive an access permit from the city such access permit shall be in addition to any permit required by the florida department of transportation dot as a prerequisite to connection to the state highway system and receipt of an access permit from the city neither relieves the recipient from the necessity to obtain a permit from dot nor guarantees the right to connect to the state highway system  42291 schedule of fees the application shall be accompanied by payment to the city of an application fee of one hundred dollars $10000 until this fee has been paid no action shall be taken on any application  42291 application procedure and requirements i any person firm or entity including a governmental entity other than the city seeking to connect alter or improve access to the state highway system within the city must first file an application for access permit with the public works director such application in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the public works director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following a completed application form for access permit a completed application form for access permit with the name address and telephone number of applicants property owners and agents statement indicating request and appropriate signatures if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the public works department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw application must be submitted in writing to the public works department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c applicant authorization if the applicant or agent is other than the property owner the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization from the property owner d supplemental information 1 legal description or street address of the parcel of land on which the improvement is proposed to be placed as well as a statement of all persons owning any legal or beneficial rights in such land 2 vicinity map a scaled sketch of the proposed improvement when completed accurately depicting dimensions elevations grade angle of intersection with rightofway and any curbs gutters sidewalks gates existing and proposed signals and traffic control signage or other associated improvements 3 construction details a statement as to what construction materials will be used in the improvement including an estimate of the duration of such construction 4 level of service data and analysis a statement as to what type of vehicular use the improvement will be put including estimates of average and peak vehicle trips per day over such improvement an assessment of the resulting effects on the level of service for the roadway and the two 2 closest intersections and the increase if any to average or peak hour vehicle trips per day over the road to which the improvement gives access ii for the purpose of administering this section the word improvements shall mean any roadway which is a part of the state highway system within the city whether or not publicly dedicated for any purpose related to widening or repairing existing access this definition is intended to include all improvements of every kind to roadways and adjacent real property which could in any way affect traffic volumes on the state highway system within the city and should be read broadly so as to effectuate that intent iii following submission of the application for access permit the director of public works director shall have a period of not more than ninety 90 days for staff review of the proposed connection should the department of public works the department determine that a longer review period is required to thoroughly assess the probable impact of the proposed connection upon the city the director shall notify the applicant at least fourteen 14 business days before the expiration of the aforementioned ninetyday period that extended review will be necessary the department shall evaluate the proposed connection in light of its probable effects upon the state highway system traffic flow and vehicular congestion public safety quality of life and the natural environment within the city iv the following are hereby adopted as minimum standards for the department to use in evaluating access permit applications and the department is hereby authorized to adopt such further standards as it finds necessary to achieve the ends expressed in section 7572 above a the standards contained in the comprehensive plan for the city b the standards contained in the dot manual policy and guidelines for vehicular connections to the state highway system c the standards contained in florida administrative j for measuring traffic volume  specifically level of service as defined in fac rule 9j3e and peak hour vehicle trips by which such levels of service are computed the department shall deny a permit for any improvement which the department estimates will result in either 1 a tenpercent or greater increase in average or peak vehicle trips per day or 2 reduction of the level of service of the roadway to which an applicant desires to make an improvement v if the director finds that the proposed access will meet the requirements of this article he shall issue a permit therefor the director is hereby authorized and empowered to revoke any permit issued by him pursuant to this article upon the failure of the holder thereof to comply with any provision of the article any decision or action made or taken by the director pursuant to this article may be appealed in writing to the city council within thirty 30 days after any such decision or action  42291 secs 75747579  reserved article x  site plan and permitted conditional use review process footnotes  7  editors note exh a adopted oct 24 201 repealed former art x  75807589 in its entirety and enacted new provisions as herein set out former art x pertained to the site plan review process and derived from     72  cross reference comprehensive development plan generally  1213 et seq purpose and intent the site plan and permitted conditional use review processes established in this article are intended to implement the requirements of the citys comprehensive development plan this process will provide an efficient review process for nonresidential development multiple family development mixeduse development and redevelopment the purpose is to implement the orderly review of applications for development and redevelopment proposed in the city with particular attention to levels of service established in the comprehensive development plan design and performance criteria established by the city for special and overlay districts eg downtown maitland maitland west side overlay maitland avenue corridor special district cultural corridor horatio avenue special district and compliance with the specific rules governing permitted conditional uses designated in the maitland city exh a 102411 applicability i the site plan review procedures contained within this article are applicable to a all projects which involve the construction of any facility other than singlefamily dwellings as a principal use or major appurtenances thereto eg private swimming pool yard fence etc or duplex residential units b all redevelopment projects which add to the total square footage of a structure eg nonresidential multiplefamily or mixed use development c all projects which require the site plan review process due to location within a special district or overlay district such as 1 downtown maitland permitted use no design waivers  2 downtown maitland permitted use with design waivers  3 downtown maitland conditional use with or without design waivers  4 maitland west side overlay with no design or development plan waivers or exceptions  5 maitland avenue corridor special district with frontage on maitland avenue  6 cultural corridor district including a change of use  7 horatio avenue corridor  8 applications for developments for which a development agreement da has been approved by the city of maitland and the site plan review process is required by the da d floating zone  publicsemi public uses  principal uses ii the permitted conditional use review procedures contained in this article are applicable to projects a which contain or are proposed to contain a use designated as a permitted conditional use for the applicable district  or b which involve exceptions to maitland west side overlaydevelopment standards c which increase downtown maitland densityintensity within transit oriented district a toda andor incentivesbonuses an approved site plan or permitted conditional use approved respective processes is required prior to the issuance of any permits it shall be unlawful for any person to construct erect or alter a building or structure or to develop change or improve land for which a site plan or permitted conditional use is required by this article except in accordance with an approved site plan or permitted conditional use where there are conflicts and discrepancies with other city policies ordinances or regulations the more restrictive requirements shall govern exh a 102411 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges expenses and a collection process for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application exh a 102411 application procedure i preapplication and filing procedures a preapplication conference before submitting an application the applicant shall schedule a preapplication conference with the development review committee to review the proposed development the applicant shall obtain a copy of the preapplication form from the community development department the city shall provide written comments to the applicant prior to the development review committee preapplication meeting the preapplication process serves as an opportunity to examine ideas and share information between the city of maitland and an applicant for a potential development project in a conceptual application format the comments and information provided by the city do not constitute a waiver of any requirements contained in the citys land development   but are meant to assist in the preparation of the application for formal submittal a preapplication conference must be held no more than six 6 months prior to filing an application following the preapplication conference the applicant may submit an application for processing by the city the applicant shall submit the application and supplemental materials to the community development department in quantities designated by the city applicants are encouraged to meet with neighborhoods and surrounding property ownersresidents prior to formal submittal of an application to discuss plans for the property and to be able to understand and respond to any valid concerns b application filed and sufficiency review applications for site plan or permitted conditional use approval shall be submitted to the zoning administrator or designee applications must be submitted at least forty 40 days prior to the first or third thursday of any month the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be processed ii development review committee reviewadministrative site plan review and decision process a the administrative site plan review process shall be required for development applications that 1 involve the construction of any facility other than singlefamily dwellings as a principal use or major appurtenances thereto eg private swimming pool yard fence etc or duplex residential units 2 add to the total square footage of a structure eg nonresidential multiplefamily or mixed use development 3 are located within a special district or an overlay district for example a downtown maitland permitted use with no design waivers b maitland west side with no exceptions or development plan waivers 4 involve projects for which a development agreement has been approved by the city of maitland unless specified otherwise within the da b following its review of the application for development the development review committee shall approve approve with changes or deny the application such action shall be taken within twentyone 21 days of the date the application is determined sufficient by the zoning administrator all development review committee decisions and recommendations shall be written certifying consistency with the comprehensive development plan and compliance with the specific rules and specific criteria governing the special or overlay district as applicable and addressing whether or not satisfactory provision and arrangement has been made concerning the following 1 ingress and egress to property and proposed structures thereon with particular reference to automotive and pedestrian safety and convenience traffic flow and control and access in case of fire or catastrophe  2 offstreet parking and loading areas where required with particular attention to the items in 1 above and the economic noise glare or odor effects on adjoining properties and properties generally in the zoning district  3 refuse and service areas with particular reference to the items in 1 and 2 above  4 utilities with reference to locations availability and compatibility  5 screening and buffering with reference to type dimensions and character  6 signs if any and proposed exterior lighting with reference to glare traffic safety economic effects and compatibility and harmony with properties in the district  7 required yards and other open space  8 general compatibility with adjacent properties and other property in the surrounding area  9 whether there is compliance with the applicable ordinances and regulations for the proposed development  10 whether the proposed development will lower the applicable levels of service below the levels adopted in the citys comprehensive development plan and whether the proposed development is phased to be constructed at a time when the adopted service levels are met  11 incentives and development bonuses requested if applicable  12 offsite credits requested if applicable 13 mobility strategies if applicable for a transportation concurrency exception area d the criteria listed in paragraph b above shall be applicable to all development review committee reviews specified within this article e any person or persons or any board taxpayer department or bureau of the city jointly or severally aggrieved by any decision of the development review committee may petition the city council for review of the decision the petition must be filed with the community development department within thirty 30 days of the determination of the commission iii planning and zoning commission review and decision process for projects within a special district or overlay district involving design or development plan waivers and applicable for areas such as those further described in a f below the planning and zoning commission shall hold a public hearing for development applications where design or development plan waivers are requested and where the project is located within special district or overlay districts designated in the comprehensive development plan any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney such applications include such as a maitland avenue corridor with frontage on maitland avenue b cultural corridor including a change of use c horatio avenue corridor d downtown maitland permitted use with design waivers e downtown maitland conditional use with or without design waivers f floating zone publicsemi publicprincipal uses g multiple family residentialnew development notice of planning and zoning commission hearing the city shall give notice in a newspaper of general circulation as defined in florida statutes at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the planning and zoning commission public hearing date on which the petition is to be heard notice shall be posted on the property subject to the application and in two 2 public places as well as the city web site notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property the distance shall be measured by a straight line from the boundary of the property subject to the application nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addressed to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax roll in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a a statement that a site plan or permitted conditional use has been requested  b the legal description of the property subject to the petition  and a general location map to correspond with the legal description of the property as noted on the hearing notice this does not mandate publication of the location map in the newspaper noted above unless otherwise required by the florida statutes  c the name of the owners of the property subject to the petition  d notification that a public hearing will be held by the planning and zoning commission  e the date time and location of the hearing  f advice that the public is invited to attend the hearing and make comment orally or in writing  and g the location and times during which an interested party may inspect the petition following the public hearing the planning and zoning commission shall provide instructions to the development review committee for consideration in their review of the processed application the development review committee shall review the petition and any public testimony that was made at the hearing and shall provide reasonable assistance to the applicant to bring the project in compliance with the land development other applicable regulations and agreements the applicant may continue to work with development review committee until such time that the development review committee determines the proposal is consistent with all applicable regulations and the item is ready to be placed on the next practical planning and zoning commission or city council agenda if the streamline approach is taken pursuant to 7583iv should the applicant determine they no longer desire to work with development review committee to resolve the items the applicant may choose to proceed to the next required planning and zoning commission or city council meeting where staff shall advise of the applicants decision to proceed without completing modifications required by development review committee in all cases the development review committee will generate and forward a written recommendation that will accompany the petition to the next step of the review process upon completing its review of the application the development review committee shall recommend approval approval with changes or denial of the application in doing so the development review committee shall formulate its recommendation and make findings with regard to the criteria outlined in subsection iib above upon consideration of the recommendations of the development review committee the planning and zoning commission may approve approve with conditions or deny the request in doing so the planning and zoning commission shall make a written finding certifying consistency with the comprehensive development plan and finding that satisfactory provision and arrangement has been made concerning the factors itemized for review by the development review committee referenced in subsection iib above the written finding shall also certify compliance with the specific rules and specific criteria governing the special or overlay district or downtown maitland conditional use any person or persons or any board taxpayer department or bureau of the city jointly or severally aggrieved by any decision of the commission may petition the city council for review of the decision the petition must be filed with the community development department within thirty 30 days of the determination of the commission iv city council review and decision process for a permitted conditional use exceptions to maitland west side development standards and for increases in downtown maitland densityintensity within transit oriented district a toda andor incentivesbonuses for applications which involve the application types designated below the planning and zoning commission shall hold a public hearing on the first or third thursday of the month the hearing notification process shall be as written in iii notice of planning and zoning commission hearing above a permitted conditional use except for downtown maitland conditional use b exceptions to maitland west side development standards c downtown maitland projects within toda requesting density or intensity bonuses and those developments seeking to utilize incentives involving financial contributions made by the developerapplicant land donations land swaps land dedications use of cityowned lands or financial obligations or continuing maintenance by the city  any allocation or rebate of tax increment financing tif monies anything requiring approval of other governmental agencies those requiring or subject to an interlocal agreement those involving an amendment to an existing resolution or ordinance or impacting the citys capital improvement program shall be processed pursuant to subsection iv  or shall pursue a da with final site plan review consistent with the process listed within subsection ii 4 within this chapter following the public hearing the planning and zoning commission has the option to a provide an additional review of the application by the planning and zoning commission to finalize its review comments  or b forward its comments to the city council without further review by the planning and zoning commission in any case before any recommendation is forwarded to city council the planning and zoning commission shall make a written finding certifying consistency with the comprehensive development plan and finding that satisfactory provision and arrangement have been made concerning the factors itemized for development review committee review the written finding shall also certify compliance with the specific rules governing individual permitted conditional uses and specific criteria required in a special or overlay district as applicable to the application under review a if the planning and zoning commission chooses to review the application again  it shall declare at the public hearing that the application shall be returned to them following the development review committees action on the application after its review is complete the planning and zoning commission shall forward a recommendation to the city council including any conditions and findings for approval approval with modifications or denial of the application b the planning and zoning commission may choose to provide a recommendation directly to the city council in such cases the planning and zoning commission shall forward instructions to the development review committee regarding the development of detailed conditions to include in the findings and recommendation being forwarded to the city council the development review committee will then finalize the recommendation for consideration by the city council unless the development review committee recommendation is contrary to that of the planning and zoning commission recommendation in this case the development review committee shall return the recommendation to the planning and zoning commission for finalization city council decision upon consideration of the recommendation of the planning and zoning commission the city council may approve approve with conditions andor modifications or deny the request if required by florida statutes the city council shall hold a public hearings prior to making a final decision action by the city council to approve or to approve with conditions or to deny an application shall be deemed final any person aggrieved by action of the city council may seek recourse to the courts as provided by the laws of florida exh a 102411   administration of building permits the building official shall approve all permits for site preparation buildings and structures in the area covered by the approved site plan to insure conformity with the approved plan and with all other applicable ordinances and regulations after approval site plan or permitted conditional use processes the modification or alteration of any buildings structures or land areas shall be in substantial accordance with those approvals exh a 102411 revisions minor changes to an approved site plan permitted conditional use or exception to maitland west side may be permitted after review and approval by the community development director provided the changes are substantially consistent with the purposes and intent of the approved site plan or permitted conditional use and provided that they conform to all other applicable ordinances and regulations changes are considered minor if they include the following a realignment of an internal roadway or curb cut to improve traffic flow turn movements or other safety considerations b relocate parking or pond within the site to increase percolation or reduce runoff from the site over and above the approved site plan c add or delete less than five 5 percent of the structural square footage of the project d relocate the orientation of the footprint of a building provided it maintains the same distance from the existing singlefamily residential development e decrease density height intensity or building coverage f realignment of an approved wall fence or hedge to avoid existing trees or attempt to resolve a problem peculiar to the site g amend sign package provided it does not increase in sign area by more than ten 10 percent h addition of a childrens play area including construction of a fence or wall for security of the play area the community development director may at his sole discretion pass any of the items a h onto the development review committee for their consideration all changes not specifically listed in this section may be considered by and may be approved by the development review committee as a minor changes if determined to be substantially consistent with the approved development plan and development order and provided that the proposed changes do not result in a substantial deviation from the approved development plan and development order substantial deviation shall mean a change to an accepted overall development plan and development order which creates a reasonable likelihood of adverse impact to any portion of the project devoted to a specific use or to adjacent properties any decision rendered by the development review committee may be appealed to the city council within thirty 30 days of the date that the decision is rendered should the development review committee determine that a proposed change is not substantially consistent with the approved development order the development review committee in its sole discretion may choose to forward a revision to the planning and zoning commission for review the development review committees determination to forward a revision to the planning and zoning commission may be based on a finding of inconsistency with approved design standards or specifications incompatibility with the cdp substantial deviation from the approved plan or for any other reason determined by the development review committee to require planning and zoning commission review any decision rendered by the planning and zoning commission may be appealed to the city council within thirty 30 days of the date that the decision is rendered exh a 102411 application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the application in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the community development director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following a completed application form for review a completed application form with the name address and telephone number of applicant property owner and agent statement indicating request and appropriate signatures if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw application must be submitted in writing to the community development department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c list of property owners for uses required for board reviews the names and mailing addresses of all property owners of real property within five hundred 500 feet of outer perimeter of subject property taken from most recent tax rolls in orange or seminole counties the fivehundred 500 foot distance shall be measured by a straight line from the boundary of the subject property nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof d applicant authorization if the applicant or agent is other than the property owner the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization from the property owner e supplemental information 1 vicinity map drawn to a noted scale and showing a the location of the property subject to the petition  b relationships to surrounding streets  and c existing zoning and land use on the site and surrounding areas within five hundred 500 feet 2 site plan drawn to a noted scale and to include a boundary survey and the legal description of the property prepared by a surveyor registered by the state of florida under a surveyors seal with the date of certification not in excess of one year provide gross and net land area which may be provided on a separate sheet b street address if applicable  c north arrow and noted scale  d required yard and setback information  e required offstreet parking detail number and location loading areas service and refuse areas  f the layout of bikeways and pedestrian ways  g locations of ingressegress to property existing and proposed  h open space provide total acreage for open space  provide a description of what areas have been counted in the calculation  i recreation areas if applicable  j permeable surface area describe and provide total in text form as well  k existing and proposed buildings located on site and indicate structural height and square footage  indicate floor area ratios in text form  l width pavement type and laneage of all adjacent rightsofway  m accessible parking including details location and accessible route to building with elevations  n location and proposed dimension of sidewalks and walkways and connections to facilities in adjacent developments  o any proposed streets alleys and access easements and include any connections to adjacent propertyies  p internal traffic circulation patterns  q access to all new buildings by firerescue apparatus shall be as required by applicable sections of the florida fire prevention current edition and city fire   r turning radii for fire engines shall be twenty 20 inside and forty 40 outside diameter  turning radii for ladder or aerial trucks shall be twentyfive 25 inside and fifty 50 outside in accordance far for downtown maitland if applicable 3 grading concept planutility service plan to include a proposed contour lines or pointspot elevations  and extending twentyfive 25 feet beyond the property fire hydrants service plans to include runoff retainage c existing utilities on or adjacent to the site including connection details d note finished floor elevation and perimeter e plans to include footprint of existing and proposed site improvements for evaluating the grading and drainage systems all plans are to be drawn at a scale of one 1 inch equals one hundred 100 feet or greater 4 fire flow a type of construction for the proposed facility per the florida building   b total square footage  c whether the building is protected with fire sprinklers  d the minimum required fire flow per building shall be provided by the fire marshal  e engineered hydraulic calculations shall be accomplished to prove the required fire flow is available the minimum acceptable design pressure shall not be less than twentyfive 25 psi for these calculations f the hydraulic calculations shall be submitted to the fire marshal for review and acceptance 5 landscape plan pursuant to landscape treescape streetscape the landscape plan shall be drawn at a noted scale of at least 1   30 and be signed and sealed by a landscape architect a proposed landscape areas including berms and buffers reference andor preservation management process if applicable  f irrigation plan note gpdusage  g an arrow indicating north  h plan must include screening and buffering reference type dimensions and character and interior parking and service areas 6 topography plan indicating existing contours at onefoot intervals based on us geodetic datum and extending twentyfive 25 feet beyond the property boundaries all sides including structural heights proposed building materials list and color renderings 9 existing building uses if any and intended use of each building or portion thereof 10 level of service data and analysis data illustrating that all adopted levels of service affecting the property are met or if any service levels are not met schedule of improvements which will be provided to ensure that all service levels are met  and a detailed analysis of parking requirements including time of use and function to support request data shall include but not limited to traffic stormwater drainage
