concurrency exception area tcea should an item listed under the category of supplemental information in e above be determined by the community development director or designee as not applicable to a particular application the items may be waived without affecting the sufficiency of the application exh a 102411 review time limitations if construction of the buildings as determined by the building officials application of the florida building has not begun within two 2 years following approval of a site plan according to this procedure or if the building permit for construction of the buildings has become void any time after the twoyear time period has expired the approval of the site plan and use designated therein shall lapse if approval of the site plan lapses under this section resubmission of a site plan is required and is subject to all review and approval processes regardless of any previous approvals acquired the building official shall notify the property owner of the lapse of approval and inform the property owner that resubmission under the site plan or permitted conditional use review procedures will be necessary upon request of the applicant for whom the site plan or permitted conditional use was granted the city council may waive the time limitation and grant a time extension for a maximum period of one 1 year three hundred sixtyfive 365 days when the city council deems such action is necessary to prevent injustice or to facilitate the proper development of the city exh a 102411   62716  reconstruction a building or structure or land feature that is totally or substantially destroyed may be reconstructed only in compliance with a site plan approved process or amendment of an approved site plan or permitted conditional using procedures outlined within this article exh a 102411 scale of plans except as otherwise provided in this article all plans under this article are to be drawn with a uniform scale and at a scale of one 1 inch equals one hundred 100 feet or greater exh a 102411 article xi  subdivision process footnotes  8  editors note exh a adopted oct 24 201 amended former art xi  759075100 in its entirety to read as herein set out former art xi pertained to the same subject matter and derived from      cross reference subdivision of land generally ch 16 purpose and intent land subdivision is the first step in community development once land has been subdivided into streets lots and blocks and publicly recorded the correction of defects is costly and difficult subdivided land sooner or later becomes a public responsibility in that roads drainage and utilities must be maintained and various customary municipal services must be provided the welfare of the entire city is directly affected by land subdivision it is to the interest of all taxpayers and citizens the developer and future residents that subdivisions be conceived designed and developed in accordance with sound practice and appropriate standards the intent and purpose of these regulations is to provide for the harmonious development of the city  to secure a coordinated layout and adequate provision for traffic  and to secure adequate provision for light air recreation potable water flood prevention drainage sewers and other sanitary facilities and city services in addition to the minimum requirements for construction of such improvements as roads and drainage compliance with the intent of these regulations requires that good design be practiced in subdivision planning valuable and scenic natural features conserved and adequate open space be made available for public use subdivision design should be adapted to the peculiarities and opportunities of the site should utilize contemporary imaginative design and should avoid monotonous repetition of a wasteful pattern of gridiron layouts and long straight minor or collector streets size shape and orientation of lots and blocks should be carefully considered with relation to future use of the various lots to be created it is intended that this article shall be construed liberally in the favor of the city exh a 102411 applicability the regulations established in this article shall apply to all lands presently within the limits of the city and to any lands which may in the future be annexed to and be made a part of the city no land shall be subdivided unless such subdivision conforms to the provisions of this article and all other applicable regulations in the city in order to subdivide land and file a plat thereon except merely to record the boundaries of an ownership all requirements as set out in this article shall be met and the procedures as herein set forth shall be followed more specifically anyone seeking the division of land into two 2 or more lots in the city shall be required to follow the procedures established by this article the sale or exchange of small parcels of land to or between adjoining property owners where such sale or exchange does not create additional lots shall not be considered a subdivision of land required to adhere to these procedures exh a 102411 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges expenses and a collection process for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application exh a 102411 subdivision application procedures preapplication conference before submitting an application an applicant for subdivision approval shall schedule a preapplication conference with the development review committee to review the proposed development the applicant shall obtain a copy of the preapplication form from the community development department the city shall provide written comments to the applicant prior to the development review committee preapplication meeting the preapplication process serves as an opportunity to examine ideas and share information between the city of maitland and an applicant for a potential subdivision in a conceptual application format the comments and information provided by the city shall not be considered to constitute a waiver of any requirements contained in the citys land development are meant to assist in the preparation of the application for formal submittal a preapplication conference must be held no more than six 6 months prior to filing an application for planned development following the preapplication conference the applicant may submit an application for a subdivision plat as applicable in this article the applicant shall submit the application and supplemental materials to the community development department in quantities designated by the city applicants are encouraged to meet with neighborhoods and surrounding property ownersresidents to discuss plans for the property that will be subject to the subdivision plat application to be able to understand and respond to any valid concerns applicants may apply for subdivision plat and planned development pd approval at the same time in which case the city may undertake concurrent review of both applications applicants choosing the option1 pd process shall follow the preliminary and final subdivision processes described within section 7593 unless submitting a lot split or minor subdivision plat in which case the applicant shall follow those processes accordingly applicants selecting option 2pd outlined in section 7553 shall follow the process listed in section 7595 minor subdivision approval if the proposed subdivision is to be a large one and the developer plans to construct it in phases the nature and extent of such phases shall be clearly delineated and the developer must show the full extent of his development and submit for the entire development plans and data as required by this article preliminary subdivision plan i sufficiency review generally all applications shall be submitted to the zoning administrator applications must be submitted at least forty 40 days prior to the first or third thursday of any month in which the petitioner desires the application to be heard the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted ii notice of planning and zoning commission hearing after receipt of a complete petition the city shall give notice in a newspaper of general circulation as defined in florida statutes at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the planning and zoning commission public hearing date on which the petition is to be heard notice shall be posted on the property subject to the preliminary subdivision plat application and in two 2 public places as well as the city web site notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property the distance shall be measured by a straight line from the boundary of the property subject to the application to the nearest to the point of the boundary of any surrounding property notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addressed to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax roll in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a a statement that a preliminary subdivision plan has been requested  b a legal description of the property prepared by a surveyor registered by the state under a surveyors seal  and a general location map to correspond with the legal description of the property as noted on the hearing notice this does not mandate publication of the location map in the newspaper noted above unless otherwise required by florida statutes c the name of the owners of the property subject to the petition  d a statement that a public hearing will be held by the planning and zoning commission  e the date time and location of the hearing  f advice that the public is invited to attend the hearing and make comment orally or in writing  and g the location and times during which an interested party may inspect the petition iii planning and zoning commission public hearing the planning and zoning commission public hearing shall be held on the first or third thursday of the month any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney to address the commission regarding the subdivision following the public hearing the planning and zoning commission has the option to a provide an additional review of the application by the planning and zoning commission to finalize its review comments  or b forward its comments to the city council without further review by the planning and zoning commission in either case before any recommendation is forwarded to city council the planning and zoning commission shall make a written finding certifying consistency with the comprehensive development plan and finding that satisfactory provision and arrangement have been made concerning the factors itemized for development review committee review the written finding shall also certify compliance with the specific rules governing subdivision platsplan as may be applicable to the application under review a if the planning and zoning commission chooses to review the application again  it shall declare at the public hearing that the application shall be returned following the development review committees action on the application after its review is complete the planning and zoning commission shall forward a recommendation to the city council including any conditions and findings for approval approval with modifications or denial of the application b the planning and zoning commission may choose to provide a recommendation directly to the city council in such cases the planning and zoning commission shall forward instructions to the development review committee regarding the development of detailed conditions to include in the findings and recommendation being forwarded to the city council the development review committee will then finalize the recommendation for consideration by the city council unless the development review committee recommendation is contrary to that of the planning and zoning commission recommendation in this case the development review committee shall return the recommendation to the planning and zoning commission for finalization iv review by development review committee following a public hearing by the planning and zoning commission the development review committee shall review the petition and any public hearing testimony andor any planning and zoning comments or directions and shall provide reasonable assistance to the applicant that the project complies with the land development other applicable regulations and agreements the applicant may continue to work with development review committee until such time that the development review committee determines the proposal is consistent with all applicable regulations and the item is ready to be placed on the next practical planning and zoning commission or city council agenda if the streamline approach is taken pursuant to 7593iii should the applicant determine they no longer desire to work with development review committee to resolve the items the applicant may choose to proceed to the next required planning and zoning commission or city council meeting where staff shall advise of the applicants decision to proceed without completing modifications required by development review committee in all cases the development review committee will generate and forward a written recommendation that will accompany the petition to the next step of the review process the development review committee shall make a recommendation for approval approval with conditions or denial of the proposed petition the development review committee shall formulate its recommendation and make findings with regard to the following factors a whether the proposed subdivision is in compliance with the applicable ordinances and regulations for the property on which it is proposed  b whether the proposed subdivision will lower the applicable levels of service below the levels adopted in the citys comprehensive plan and whether the proposed development is phased to be constructed at a time when the adopted service levels are met  c whether existing or proposed utility services and transportation systems are adequate for the proposed development  whether all adopted levels of service have been or will be adequately met  and that any accompanying engineering plans have been approved by the city  and d whether the proposed subdivision plan is consistent with the comprehensive development plan v recommendation by planning and zoning commission the planning and zoning commission shall receive and review the development review committees findings and recommendation unless iiib has been chosen by the planning and zoning commission the planning and zoning commission shall recommend approval of the preliminary plan and other supplementary materials as presented or shall recommend approval with modifications or shall recommend denial of the preliminary plan and required improvements city council decision at a regularly scheduled meeting the city council shall receive and review the planning and zoning commission recommendation and shall accept accept with modifications or reject the preliminary subdivision plan failure to comply with the provisions of these regulations and other applicable statutes and ordinances shall be cause for refusing to approve the preliminary plan action by the city council to approve or to approve with conditions or to deny an application shall be deemed final any person aggrieved by action of the city council may seek recourse to the courts as provided by the laws of florida acceptance of the preliminary plan and other required supplementary material shall not be construed as acceptance of the final plat rather it shall be deemed an expression of acceptance of the layout submitted and preliminary engineering and planning on the preliminary plan as a guide to the preparations of the final plat vi time limit for submission of final subdivision plat the final subdivision plat and supplementary material must be submitted within twelve 12 months after approval of the preliminary plat in accordance with the requirements of this article and all other applicable regulations otherwise such approval shall become null and void unless an extension of time is applied for in writing and granted by the city council the final plat shall conform substantially to the preliminary plat as approved final subdivision plat vii sufficiency review for final subdivision plat all applications for a final subdivision plat shall be submitted to the zoning administrator the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted for processing viii development review committee review and determination of conformity  after receipt of a complete petition the development review committee shall review the petition and shall make a determination of conformity and make findings regarding the following a whether there is substantial conformity with the preliminary subdivision plan approval  b whether existing or proposed utility services and transportation systems are adequate for the proposed development  whether all adopted levels of service have been or will be adequately met  and that any accompanying engineering plans have been approved by the city  and c whether the proposed final subdivision plat is consistent with the comprehensive development plan exh a 102411   determination of substantial conformity for final plat and revisions to construction drawings a final plat will be considered in substantial conformity to the approved preliminary plan and construction drawings if it reflects the preliminary plan and modifications approved by the planning and zoning commission and city council minor changes to an approved preliminary plan andor construction drawings may be permitted after review and approval by the community development director or designee and may be considered in substantial conformity as well provided the changes are consistent with the comprehensive plan and conform to all other applicable ordinances and regulations minor changes may include the following a realignment of an internal roadway or curb cut to improve traffic flow turn movements or other safety considerations b relocate parking or retention areas within the site to increase percolation or reduce runoff from the site over and above the approved site plan c add or delete less than five 5 percent of the square footage of any lot for the project or add or delete less than five 5 percent of street frontage or lot width for any lot of the project d decrease density height intensity or permeable surface coverage e realignment of an approved wall or fence to avoid existing trees or attempt to resolve a problem peculiar to the site f relocate easements or utilities to provide more effective service levels g amend sign package provided it does not increase in sign area by more than ten 10 percent the community development director may at his sole discretion pass any of the items a g onto the development review committee for their consideration all changes not specifically listed in this section may be considered and approved by the development review committee as a minor changes if determined by the development review committee in a regularly scheduled meeting to be substantially consistent with the approved preliminary subdivision plan development order any decision rendered by the development review committee may be appealed to the city council within thirty 30 days of the date that the decision is rendered if the development review committee determines that the plat does not meet all requirements the applicant may submit within sixty 60 days a revised final plat to address the concerns of the drc and meet the requirements without an additional fee for review thereafter resubmittals will require an additional final plat fee deadlines may be extended by the development review committee upon receipt of a written request prior to expiration of the sixtyday resubmittal time frame all changes determined to be major changes must be approved specified for a preliminary subdivision plan process if the plat complies with all requirements it shall be presented to the city council within thirty 30 days of determination of compliance i city council acceptance of final plat at a regularly scheduled meeting the city council shall accept or reject the final subdivision plat failure to comply with the provisions of these regulations and other applicable statutes and ordinances shall be cause for refusing to accept the final plat ii time limit for recordation and improvements for construction and installation of municipal improvements and prior to recording of the final at by the city the developer shall provide a surety bond to the city issued by a bonding company from the united states treasurys list of approved bonding companies or such other guarantee acceptable to the city that all required work shall be completed in full accordance with the final plat the approved construction plans and all conditions attached thereto approval of the final plat among other things shall be contingent upon presentation of the bond or other guarantee acceptable to the city prior to recording of the plat construction and installation of municipal improvements shall not commence prior to receipt of this bond or other guarantee by the city such bond referred to as the performance bond shall be in the amount equal to one hundred ten 110 percent of the sum of engineering and construction cost including landfill as determined by the construction contract proposal submitted by a properly licensed contractor and confirmed by the city director of public works all required work shall be completed and ready for acceptance by the city within a period of twentyfour 24 months from the date of acceptance of the final plat by city council at its meeting outlined in i above one 1 twelvemonth extension may be granted at the discretion of the city council in order to obtain the extension the developer shall request it in writing via a letter sent to the zoning administrator at least thirty 30 days prior to the expiration of the plat approval the performance bond or other guarantee shall remain in force and effect until such time as all required improvements have been accepted by the city should the developer fail to provide the necessary bond within the required time period and the plat not be recorded the plat approval shall be null and void iii required improvements approval of the final plat shall be subject to the subdivider having submitted to the city plans and specifications for all improvements required by the city these plans and specifications being approved by the appropriate city officials prior to commencement of construction and receipt of an acceptable performance bond a professional engineer registered by the state shall design the required improvements after required improvements have been constructed such engineer shall submit certification to the city that the improvements have been constructed according to the approved plans and specifications upon completion of all work under bond the developer shall submit to the city manager or designee a statement certified and sealed by a professional engineer registered in the state stating that the work has been entirely completed and that it conforms in all respects to the final plat and plans for required improvements and to the specifications set by these regulations upon receipt of this certificate of completion the director of public works shall make a final inspection of each of the contract operations on the site if the work conforms to all plans and specifications the city manager shall so inform the city council in writing and recommend acceptance by the city city council action accepting the improvements shall constitute authority for release of the developers performance bond in the event the developer has not completed the construction of all improvements within the authorized time limitations the citys director of finance shall when so directed by the city manager notify the surety company or such other organization furnishing the bond or its equivalent of pending default prior to release of the performance bond the developer shall provide a surety bond issued by a bonding company from the united states treasury list of approved bonding companies or such other guarantee acceptable to the city in an amount equal to ten 10 percent of the sum of the engineering and construction costs such bond referred to as the maintenance bond shall guarantee that all required improvements dedicated to the city have been properly constructed and are guaranteed for a period of one 1 year exh a 102411 minor subdivision approval where property abuts an existing standard street and no new improvements for water sewer or drainage are required and where the proposed subdivision contains four 4 or fewer commercial lots having common access to existing public roads or ten 10 or fewer residential lots the community development director with the concurrence of the public works director may waive the requirement for a preliminary subdivision plan approval and permit the applicant to proceed to a final subdivision plat approval if the preliminary subdivision plan approval is waived the processing for the final subdivision plat approval shall be the same as the preliminary plan process eg the planning and zoning commission shall hold a public hearing with public hearing notice as outlined in the preliminary subdivision plan process etc the applicant must submit any materials as part of the final subdivision plat as may be required by the zoning administrator in addition to the required material noted in this article to administer the process and clarify the application before the applicant may be considered sufficient and complete exh a 102411 lot splits where property meets the requirements outlined above for a minor subdivision the proposed subdivision is for two 2 lots and the property has never been subdivided prior to the application the community development director with the concurrence of the public works director may waive the requirement for preliminary subdivision plan approval and final subdivision plat approval the lot split would be required to be approved by the development review committee within twentyone 21 days of a completed application as outlined in this article using the same sufficiency review process time frames as required for the preliminary plat approval exh a 102411 modifications for largescale developments the standards and requirements of these regulations may be modified by the planning and zoning commission in the case of a plan and a program for a complete community or a neighborhood unit which in the judgment of the planning and zoning commission provided adequate public spaces and improvements for the circulation recreation light air and service needs of the tract when fully developed and populated which will provide such covenants or other legal provisions as will ensure conformity to and achievement of the city plan for development and which will ensure that such development will not constitute an economic and tax burden on the city in granting modification the planning and zoning commission may require such conditions as will in its judgment secure substantially the objectives of the standards and requirements as modified exh a 102411 issuance of building permits prior to final approval prior to acceptance of the subdivision improvements as set forth in section 7594iii an action which constitutes authority for release of the developers performance bond or other acceptable guarantee the building official may recommend issuance of building permits for construction of buildings or structures or parts thereof within the subdivision provided a the city manager and community development director approve the recommendation  b the city has received certification from the proper health authorities of the water and sewage systems to assure availability and approval for required connections thereto  and c the director of public works and the fire chief are satisfied as to the accessibility by emergency vehicles of the subdivision site and individual lots for which any building permits are requested issuance of building permits under this provision and prior to acceptance of the subdivision improvements by the city council does not express or by implication constitute final approval of any work required under this article nor does it constitute expressed or implied authority to release the developers performance bond or other acceptable guarantee no building structure or part thereof shall be occupied nor shall any certificate of occupancy be issued for the same within the subdivision unless and until formal acceptance of all required improvements have been given by the city council and the maintenance bond or other acceptable guarantee as provided for in this article has been received by the city exh a 102411 selling buying land in reference to unapproved plat prohibited any person who being the owner or agent of the owner of any land located within the city thereafter transfers or sells such land or any part thereof by reference to a plat showing a subdivision of such land before such plat has been approved by the city council and recorded in the office of the clerk of the circuit court of orange county florida and any person to whom such transfer or sale is made shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be punished accordingly and the metes and bounds description in the instrument of transfer or other document used in the process of selling or transferring shall not exempt the transaction from constituting an offense hereunder exh a 102411 application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the lot split and subdivision applications in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the community development director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following 1 lot splits a completed application form for lot splits a completed application form for a lot split with the name address and telephone number of applicants property owners and agents request for the lot split and appropriate signatures shall be submitted if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw the application must be submitted in writing to the community development department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c applicant authorization if the applicant or agent is other than the property owner the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization from the property owner d supplemental information 1 vicinity map drawn to a noted scale showing a the location of the proposed lot split  b relationships to surrounding streets  and c existing zoning and land use on the site and surrounding areas within five hundred 500 feet 2 plat map suitable for recording which shows or is accompanied by the following information a tract boundaries with appropriate dimensions  lot split to be referenced to nearest section corner b boundary survey and the legal description of the property prepared by a surveyor registered by the state under a surveyors seal the date of certification shall not be in excess of one 1 year provide gross and net land area which may be provided on a separate sheet c certification by the registered surveyor attesting to the accuracy of the survey and that the permanent reference monuments have been established according to law d location and description of all permanent reference monuments e drawn at a scale of at least one 1 inch   one hundred 100 feet f north arrow noted scale graphic scale date and basis of bearing desire true bearing g the accurate outline of all property which is to be dedicated reserved or proposed for public use including stormwater drainage courses and easements and all property that may be reserved by covenants in deeds for the common use of the property owners in the subdivision with the purposes indicated thereon h all existing water courses stormwater drainage ditches and bodies of water marshes rock outcrop buildings transmission lines sewers bridges culverts and drain pipes water mains county boundary lines city limit lines and public utility easements 3 should the plat involve a planned development or other legal instrument that provides for the inclusion of private facilityies such as but not limited to bikeways and pedestrian ways pedestrian lighting street lighting stormwater drainage areas wall and fences entry features lift stations infrastructure any of which may be located within areas designated as easements tracts or other areas designated as private must clearly reflect the responsibilities for construction maintenance and replacement on the record plat easements such as conservation easements shall also clearly denote maintenance responsibilities on the record plat 2 preliminary subdivision plan  a completed application form for preliminary subdivision plan  a completed application form for a preliminary subdivision plan with the name address and telephone number of applicants property owners and agents and appropriate signatures if fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c list of property owners the names and mailing addresses of all property owners of real property within five hundred 500 feet of outer perimeter of subject property taken from most recent tax rolls in orange or seminole counties the fivehundredfoot distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point of the boundary of the subject property nearest to the point of the boundary of any surrounding property d applicant authorization if the applicant or agent is other than the property owner the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization from the property owner e engineers name the name of registered engineers if applicable responsible for the plan and supporting data f supplemental information 1 vicinity map drawn to a noted scale and showing a the location of the proposed subdivision  b relationships to surrounding streets  and c existing zoning and land use on the site and surrounding areas within five hundred 500 feet 2 plan showing the following information information can be shown on one or more sheets with a uniform scale the plan shall include the following a north arrow noted scale graphic scale date and basis of bearing desire true bearing b key plan showing location of tract in reference to other areas of the city not necessarily to scale c proposed subdivision name or identifying title which shall not duplicate or closely approximate the name of any other subdivision in orange county and name of recorded owner d boundary survey and the legal description of the property prepared by a surveyor registered by the state of florida under a surveyors seal the date of certification shall not be in excess of one year provide gross and net land area which may be provided on a separate sheet e all existing streets and alleys on or adjacent to the tract including name and rightofway width f all existing property lines buildings transmission lines sewers bridges culverts and drain pipes water mains county boundary lines city limit lines and any public utility easements items to be demolished shall be noted g plat of adjacent subdivisions if any and recordation date and typical lot size adjacent unplatted land shall be indicated by the words not platted h location name where applicable and width of any proposed streets alleys rightsofway easements and purpose of easements  proposed lot lines with dimensions  lot numbers and block designations indicate traffic controls and any mass transit facilities to be provided andor mobility enhancements or strategies proposed if any i the location of all property which is to be dedicated reserved or proposed for public use including stormwater drainage and easements and all property that may be reserved by covenants in deeds for the common use of the property owners in the subdivision and recreation areas if applicable j general location of potential public improvements such as highways or other major improvements planned by public authorities for future construction on or near the tract if applicable k general conditions on tract including all existing water courses stormwater drainage ditches and bodies of water wetlands isolated preservable trees one 1 foot or more in diameter and other significant features l indicate whether development will be a gated community m building envelopes shall be illustrated on the proposed lots n indicate proposed gross and net density for residential development if applicable 3 grading concept planutility service plan to include a general location size and description of stormwater drainage facilities including retaining walls and elevation or grade changes in excess of two feet sewage collection and water distribution systems including location of any proposed or existing fire hydrants  b statements concerning stormwater distribution method of water supply and waste disposal all conforming to city specification  c all other existing service location lines if available on or adjacent to site tract  and d the topographic information must delineate the mean high water elevations for each water body and the onehundredyear flood elevations throughout the site if applicable jurisdictional wetland lines shall be illustrated 4 fire service a general location and provision of fire service facilities such as hydrant locations and water main sizes  b turning radii for fire engines shall be 20 feet inside and 40 feet outside  turning radii for ladder or aerial trucks shall be 25 feet inside and 50 feet outside in accordance with manufacturers specifications  c roadways shall be designed to support the imposed loads of fire apparatus and shall be provided with an all weather driving surface  and d deadend fire department access roads in excess of 150 feet in length shall be provided with approved provisions for the fire apparatus to turn around 5 tree survey for applications with property one 1 acre or larger drawn at the same scale as the preliminary subdivision plan a map of existing trees indicating caliper and character and including all threatened endangered or species of special concern and all preservable trees six 6 inches or more in diameter 6 schematic landscape plan indicating a proposed street tree locations and additional landscaping to be provided if applicable  b reference general plant list  and c existing vegetation to be preserved 7 legal instruments drafts of protective covenants whereby the developer proposes to regulate land use in the subdivision and otherwise protect the proposed development 8 level of service data and analysis data addressing adopted levels of service and an analysis of parking requirements including time of use to support request data shall include but not limited to preliminary assessment of traffic impact and trip generation study stormwater drainage water sewer and parks  and in a format acceptable to the community development director 9 soils soils classification map demonstrating soils on site soil analysis or geotechnical report by a professional soils expert shall be furnished upon request at or immediately after the preapplication meeting 10 wildlife inventory an inventory of wildlife species on site including species categorized as endangered threatened or of special concern status a description of techniques and practices proposed to protect endangered threatened or species of special concern status should an item listed under the category of supplemental information above be determined by the community development director or designee as not applicable to a particular application the items may be waived upon request of the applicant and authorization by the city without affecting the sufficiency of the application 3 final subdivision plat a completed application form for final subdivision plat a completed application form for final subdivision and charges as set from time to time c applicant authorization if the applicant or agent is other than the property owner the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization from the property owner d engineers name the name of registered engineers if applicable responsible for the plat and supporting data e plat suitable for recordation the plat shall be clearly and legibly drawn in a format as required for filing for record in orange county in accordance with the design standards and provisions of florida statutes f supplemental information 1 plat plan requirements where necessary the plat may be on several sheets accompanied by an index sheet showing the entire subdivision for large subdivisions the final plat may be submitted for approval or acceptance progressively subdivision name or identifying title and name of recorded owner c boundary survey and the legal description of the property prepared by a surveyor registered in the state of florida under a surveyors seal the date of certification shall not be in excess of one year provide gross and net land area which may be provided on a separate sheet d subdivision to be referenced to nearest section corner distances to be accurate to hundredths of a foot and angles to the nearest second h the exact layout including street and alley lines and rightsofway  street names bearings and widths including width along the liens of any obliquely intersecting street  lengths of arcs and radii points of curvature and chord and length bearings  points of tangency or nontangency intersects  all easements owned by or rightsofway provided for public utilities  all lot lines with dimensions in feet and hundredths and with bearings of angles if other than right angles to the street and alley lines all street names consecutive numerical order and blocks to be lettered in alphabetical order k the accurate outline of all property which is to be dedicated reserved or proposed for public use including stormwater drainage courses and easements and all property that may be reserved by covenants in deeds for the common use of the property owners in the subdivision with the purposes indicated thereon the mean the plat which authorizes the city to have the right of entry perpetuity to reconstruct repair inspect and maintain all facilities on or in a dedicated rightofway which may have been constructed or installed for the public good and welfare and which may be included any or all of the following streets alleys gutters curbs sidewalks street signs and posts parks and parkways  water lines sanitary notary public o dedications providing to the city the right to clear trees brush or any other impediment to reconstruction maintenance inspection or repair of the abovelisted facilities and providing prohibition against all others from planting constructing or placing any object on the dedicated rightofway without the explicit written permission of the director of public works of the city 2 on a united states coast and geodetic survey datum plane likewise locations and elevations of all walls fences and entrance features proposed for the subdivision to be maintained by the property typical sections and illumination data for lighting proposed 3 subsurface conditions on the tract  location and results of tests made to ascertain subsurface soil rock and groundwater conditions noted scale and signed and sealed by a landscape architect the landscape plan shall at a minimum clearly identify the following a proposed street tree locations and additional landscaping to be provided if applicable reference species type dimensions at planting  b existing vegetation to be preserved reference species type and dimensions  c relocation andor preservation if applicable 5 protective covenants if any in form of recording all covenants are nondiscriminatory in regard to race color or creed 6 taxlien information provide evidence supporting that all taxes and improvement liens against the subject plats have been paid or discharged 7 level of service data and analysis data illustrating that all adopted levels of service affecting the property are met or if any service levels are not met schedule of improvements which will be provided to ensure that all service levels are met 8 analysis of the citys ability to provide adequate public services to the land proposed to be subdivided eg police fire garbage etc 9 should the plat involve a planned development or other legal instrument that provides for the inclusion of private facilityies such as but not limited to bikeways and pedestrian ways pedestrian lighting streetlighting stormwater drainage areas wall and fences entry features lift stations infrastructure any of which may be located within areas designated as easements tracts or other areas designated as private must clearly reflect the responsibilities for construction maintenance and replacement on the record plat easements such as conservation easements shall also clearly denote maintenance responsibilities on the record plat exh a 102411 secs 7510175109  reserved article xii  variances footnotes  9  editors note exh a adopted  amended former art xii  7511075115 in its entirety to read as herein set out former art xii pertained to the same subject matter and derived from  adopted  cross reference board of zoning adjustment  472 et seq purpose and intent the procedures established in this article are intended to provide for adequate review of the terms of the zoning code to ensure that the terms of the zoning code will not be contrary to the public interest where owing to special conditions a literal enforcement of its provisions would result in unnecessary hardship exh a 102411 applicability the procedures contained in this article are applicable to all requests for waiver of one 1 or more provisions of the zoning code by any person or agency which owns the real property subject to the provisions of the code from which a waiver is requested under no circumstances shall the board of zoning adjustment grant a variance to allow a use not permissible under the terms of this zoning code in the district involved or any use expressly or by implication prohibited by the terms of this zoning code in such district exh a 102411 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges and expenses for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application the fees for a variance are not intended to prohibit legitimate applications exh a 102411 application procedures i sufficiency review all applications for a variance under this article shall be submitted to the zoning administrator applications must be submitted at least forty 40 days prior to the fourth thursday of any month the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted should the applicant fail to submit all information as required within five 5 working days the application will not be considered complete and will not be processed if complete the zoning administrator shall transmit to the board all application materials and any records deemed by the zoning administrator to be pertinent to the request ii notice of board of zoning adjustment hearing after receipt of a complete petition the city shall give notice in a newspaper of general circulation as defined in florida statutes at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the board of zoning adjustment public hearing date on which the petition is to be heard a notice shall be posted on the property subject to the variance request and in two 2 public places as well as the city web site and notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to all property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property all at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the board of zoning adjustment public hearing the distance for mailing notices shall be measured by a straight line from the point on the boundary of the property subject to the appeal nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addressed to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax roll in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a the name of the appellant  b the location of the property if applicable  and a general location map to correspond with the legal description of the property as noted on the hearing notice this does not mandate publication of the location map in the newspaper noted above unless otherwise required by florida statutes c the action requested  and d the date time and location of the public hearing iii board of zoning adjustment public hearing the board of zoning adjustment public hearing shall be held on the fourth thursday of the month for which the completed application was received or if the fourth thursday is a holiday on which the board cannot meet or if a quorum is not achieved within sixty 60 days of receipt of an application any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney the board of zoning adjustment may grant or deny the application for a variance before the board may grant a petition for a variance the board must conclude that all of the following requirements have been met for the application a that special conditions and circumstances exist which are peculiar to the land structure or building involved and which are not applicable to other lands structures or buildings in the same district  b that literal interpretation of the provisions of this zoning code would deprive the applicant of rights commonly enjoyed by other properties in the same district under the terms of this zoning code  c that the special conditions and circumstances do not result from the actions of the applicant  and d that granting the variance requested will not confer on the applicant any special privilege that is denied by this zoning code to other lands structures or buildings in the same district no nonconforming use of neighboring lands structures or buildings in the same district and no permitted use of lands structures or buildings in other district shall be considered grounds for the issuance of a variance the board of zoning adjustment shall further make a finding that the reasons set forth in the application justify the granting of the variance that will make possible the reasonable use of the land building or structure the board of zoning adjustment shall further make a finding that the granting of the variance a will be in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this zoning code  b is consistent with the comprehensive development plan  and c will not be injurious to the neighborhood or otherwise detrimental to the public welfare in granting any variance the board of zoning adjustment may prescribe appropriate specific written conditions and safeguards in conformity with the zoning code exh a 102411 time limit on approval and denial a variance is valid for a period of two 2 years seven hundred thirty 730 days from the date of granting to the time a building permit is obtained any further consideration for a variance on the same property shall require the filing of a new petition when such time limitation is exceeded violation of such conditions and safeguards when made a part of the terms under which the variance is granted shall be deemed a violation of the zoning code should a variance application be denied the city shall not consider an application for variance on the same property for a period of one 1 year three hundred sixtyfive 365 days from the date of the denial exh a 102411 application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the variance application in conjunction with properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the community development director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following a completed application form for variance a completed application form for variance with the name address and telephone number of applicant property owner and agent request for variance and appropriate signatures if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw application must be submitted in writing to the community development department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c list of property owners the names and mailing addresses of all property owners of real property within five hundred 500 feet of outer perimeter of subject property taken from most recent tax rolls in orange or seminole counties the fivehundredfoot distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point of the boundary of the subject property nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof d applicant authorization if the applicant or agent is other than the property owner the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization from the property owner e supplemental information 1 vicinity map showing location of site in relation to surrounding streets 2 site plan drawn to a noted scale and to include a the legal description of the property  b street address if applicable  c north arrow and noted scale  d required yard and set back information  e existing and proposed buildings located on site and indicate structural height and square footage  indicate floor area  and f plan dimensions adequately shown 3 written informational statements a information that special conditions and circumstances exist which are peculiar to the land structure or building involved and which are not applicable to other lands structures or buildings in the same district b information that literal interpretation of the provisions of the zoning code would deprive the applicant of rights commonly enjoyed by other properties in the same district under the terms of the zoning code c information that the special conditions and circumstances do not result from the actions of the applicant d information that granting the variance requested will not confer on the applicant any special privilege that is denied by the zoning code to other lands structures or buildings in the same district no nonconforming use of neighboring lands structures or buildings in the same district and no permitted use of lands structures or buildings in other districts shall be considered grounds for the issuance of a variance exh a 102411 secs 7511675119  reserved article xiii  vested rights footnotes  10  editors note exh a adopted  amended former art xiii  7512075124 in its entirety which pertained to the same subject matter and derived from   purpose and intent upon application and after review as provided herein the city council may grant as a special permit an exception to the otherwise applicable provisions of the most currently effective city comprehensive development plan or any land development regulation in the city special permit shall be a development order for a specific type level nature density intensity or other form of development of a specifically described parcel of land the special permit is not transferable in whole or in part to any other parcel of land or to any other person corporation or other legal entity the special permit may be granted whenever the city council finds that the applicant has demonstrated pursuant to the standards set forth in this article that the applicant has a preexisting vested right to commence and complete a specific level type nature density intensity or other form of development the special permit may be granted with or without conditions as the evidence shall indicate to the city council may be appropriate exh a 102411 applicability any person partnership corporation or other legal entity having an ownership interest in a parcel of land may file an application for a special permit determining the applicants right to commence and complete a specific type level nature intensity density or other form of development on that parcel of land has vested any person partnership corporation or other legal entity claiming a vested right to commence and complete any type level nature intensity or other form of development of a specific parcel of land who does not file an application for determination under this section within two 2 years of the effective date of the amendatory ordinance that rezones or changes the land use of the property or otherwise materially and adversely affects the applicants parcel of land or portion thereof so as to prohibit the nature type level intensity density or other form of development in whole or in part shall be deemed to have waived the right to seek such a determination exh a 102411 schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges expenses and a collection process for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application exh a 102411 application procedure i sufficiency review applications for vested rights shall be submitted to the zoning administrator or designee applications must be submitted at least forty 40 days prior to the first or third thursday of any month in which the petitioner desires the application to be heard the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted should the applicant fail to submit all information as required within five 5 working days the application will not be considered complete and will not be processed ii notice of planning and zoning commission hearing after receipt of a complete petition the city shall give notice in a newspaper of general circulation as defined in florida statutes at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the planning and zoning commission public hearing date on which the petition is to be heard notice shall be posted on the property subject to the vested rights application and in two public places as well as the city web site notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property the distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point on the boundary of the property subject to the vested rights application nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addressed to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax roll in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a a statement that an application for vested rights has been received  b the legal description of the property subject to the petition  and a general location map to correspond with the legal description of the property as noted on the hearing notice if applicable this does not mandate publication of the location map in the newspaper noted above unless otherwise required by the florida statutes c the name of the owners of the property subject to the petition  d that a public hearing will be held by the planning and zoning commission  e the date time and location of the hearing  f that the public is invited to attend the hearing and make comment orally or in writing  g the location and times during which an interested party may inspect the vested rights special permit application iii planning and zoning commission public hearing the planning and zoning commission public hearing shall be held on the first or third thursday of the month any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney iv review by development review committee following a public hearing by the planning and zoning commission the development review committee shall review the petition and any public hearing testimony and shall make a recommendation to the planning and zoning commission for approval approval with conditions or denial of the proposed petition the development review committee shall formulate its recommendation and make findings with regard to the following factors a whether there has been an act or omission to act by the city  b what city official acted or omitted to act and the personnel rank job duties or official position of such official  c whether the city official acted or omitted to act within the course and scope of his personnel rank job duties and official position  d the nature of the act committed and date thereof or the nature of the omission to act and approximate date thereof  e whether the applicant made a substantial change in position or has an investmentbacked expectation based upon the citys act or omission to act  f the nature of the applicants change in position or investmentbacked expectation including expenditure of money or obligation to incur expenditures acts committed which represent a change in position and dates thereof  g good faith of the applicant in substantially changing his position or the incurring of extensive obligations and expenses based upon the citys actions or omissions to act  h any acts of the applicant and the dates thereof associated with physical improvements on the land in question such as grading dedication of land to the city or any other governmental entity payment of fees such as impact fees installation of utility infrastructure or public improvements or for the design or specific buildings and improvements to be constructed on the site  i the extent to which the applicant has secured building permits for and commenced or completed the construction of subdivision improvements and buildings upon part but not all of the development that was contemplated to extend over a period of months or years  j whether the applicant prior to or on the date of notice of a change in a land development regulation has made contractual commitments to complete structures and deliver title thereto or occupancy thereof and the dates of and amounts of money involved in such commitment  k whether prior to or on the date of notice of change in a land development regulation for the currently effective comprehensive development plan or applicable section thereof or any other land development regulation the applicant incurred financial obligations to a lending institution which despite a thorough review of alternative solutions the applicant will be unable to meet or which it would be inequitable and unjust to require the applicant to meet unless he is permitted to proceed with the previously permitted type nature level density intensity or other form of development  l whether enforcement of the terms of the currently effective comprehensive development plan or any land development regulation will expose the applicant to substantial monetary liability to third persons or will leave the applicant completely unable after thorough review of alternative solutions to earn a reasonable return on his investment in the property  m whether the applicant has a vested right to commence and complete a proposed development or portion of a proposed development on all or a portion of the applicants property  n whether the applicant owned an interest in the parcel of land proposed to be developed on the date of notice of a change in a regulation and that the specific nature type level density intensity or other form of development proposed for the parcel of land was lawful and permitted at that time  o that the applicant has continuously owned the parcel of land since the date of notice of change in a land development regulation until the date of the public hearing before the city council on the special permit application  and p any other information relevant to discerning the applicants claim to vested rights to develop his real property in a particular manner that may be pertinent under florida or federal law including the existence of an imminent peril to the public health safety welfare economic prosperity general order aesthetics or appearance which should preclude according the applicant his vested rights special permit v recommendation by planning and zoning commission within fortyfive 45 days after the planning and zoning commissions public hearing the planning and zoning commission shall review the development review committees findings and recommendation and shall make a recommendation to the city council for approval approval with conditions or denial of the vested rights request if the recommendation of the planning and zoning commission is for denial the minutes shall state the reasons of the planning and zoning commission for denial before any vested rights recommendation is forwarded to city council the planning and zoning commission shall make a written finding certifying compliance with the specific rules governing vested rights a finding of consistency with the comprehensive development plan and that satisfactory provision and arrangement has been made concerning the factors itemized for review by the development review committee in iv above the land development regulation commission shall file its written findings of fact and recommendations with the zoning administrator the city clerk and serving same by regular first class united states mail postage prepaid on the applicant and each person who has previously requested a copy of the findings of fact and recommendations of the land development regulation commission such findings of fact and recommendations shall be advisory in nature vi city council decision within thirty 30 days of the date the land development regulation commission has filed its findings of fact and recommendations with the zoning administrator the city council shall hold a public hearing on the application for a special permit at least fifteen 15 days notice of the date time and place of such hearing shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation within fortyfive 45 days after the public hearing on the application for the special permit the city council shall file its written findings of fact and order with the city clerk a copy to the zoning administrator and serving of same by regular first class united states mail postage prepaid on the applicant and each person who has previously requested a copy of the findings of fact and order of the city council the order shall contain a final written determination consisting of findings of fact and an order issuing a special permit issuing the special permit with conditions or denying the special permit application the right of the applicant to commence or complete construction of development or of a type level nature density intensity or other form of development on his parcel of land or a portion thereof is vested if the applicant can demonstrate to the satisfaction of the city by substantial competent evidence that a the currently effective city comprehensive development plan or portion thereof or other land development regulation complained of by the applicant as being counter to the applicants vested right to commence and complete construction of a certain level type nature density intensity or other form of development has a material and adverse effect upon the applicants vested right to develop the subject parcel of land  b by application of the considerations set out in section 75123iv hereof the applicant in good faith and based upon some act or omission of the city has made such substantial change in position or has an investmentbacked expectation that would make it inequitable and unjust to destroy the right of the applicant to commence and complete a certain level type nature density intensity or other form of development upon all or a portion of the applicants land  and c requiring the applicants property be developed in accordance with the current effective city comprehensive development plan or city land development regulation restrictions will considering the substantial change in position of the applicant or the creation of an investment backed expectation prior to or on the date on which the currently effective city comprehensive development plan or relevant land development regulation was subject to a notice of change in land development regulation deprive the applicant of a reasonable rate of return on his investment or substantial change in position or otherwise unjustly deprive the applicant of its vested rights in determining the reasonableness of the projected rate of return the following categories of expenditures shall not be included in the calculation of the applicants investment 1 expenditures for professional services that are unrelated to the design or construction of the improvements for the level type nature density intensity or other form of development proposed to be vested  2 expenditures for taxes except for any increases in tax expenditures which result from issuance of a development order which would now be contrary to the currently existing city comprehensive development plan or relevant land development regulation  3 expenditures which the applicant has allocated to the particular proposed development but which the applicant would have been obligated to incur as an ordinary and necessary business expense for example employees salaries equipment rental chattel mortgage payments had the plan for the particular development not been formulated or a development order not been issued for the type level nature density intensity or other form of development now claimed by the applicant to be vested  d the fact that the property has been or is in a zoning or comprehensive planning district or classification under the currently effective city comprehensive development plan or any development regulation or any prior city comprehensive development plan or zoning ordinance of the city shall not in and of itself establish that an applicants right to commence and complete construction of a certain level type nature density intensity or other form of development has been vested if it is determined that there is imminent peril to the public health safety welfare general order economic prosperity aesthetics or appearance or that the public cost outweighs the applicants vested rights the permit may be denied vii judicial review any person corporation partnership or other legal entity aggrieved by a determination to deny grant with conditions a vested rights special permit may file a petition for writ of certiorari in the circuit court seeking review such petition must be filed within thirty 30 days after the date of rendition of the final order of the city council and pursuant to the requirements of the florida rules of appellate procedure exh a 102411 application requirements to be considered sufficient and complete the vested rights application consisting of properly identified exhibits and supporting materials must be supplied in quantities as specified by the community development director on the application and shall clearly indicate the following a completed application form for vested rights a completed application form for vested rights with the name address and telephone number of applicants property owners and agents statement indicating request and appropriate signatures if ownership of any part of or all of the real property subject to the petition shall change during the pendency of the petition the petitioning owner who has conveyed such parcel of real property shall be required to immediately advise the community development department in writing any desire to amend or withdraw the application must be submitted in writing to the community development department b fees the payment of all appropriate processing fees and charges as set from time to time c applicant authorization if the applicant or agent is other than the property owner the applicant shall provide a notarized letter of authorization from the property owner the applicant shall also provide the name address and telephone number of any attorney who is or will be representing the applicant d supplemental information 1 title a title opinion of a florida attorney abstract of title or other evidence demonstrating property ownership interests in the real property described in the application which opinion abstract or other evidence of ownership is acceptable to the city and covers a period from the day of the date of notice of a change in a land development regulation until at least two 2 weeks prior to the date of application for a special permit together with a description of the extent and quality of ownership of the real property during such period 2 boundary survey and legal description prepared by a surveyor registered by the state of florida under a surveyors seal for the parcel of land upon which the applicant claims to have vested development rights 3 affidavit under penalty of perjury executed by the applicant before a notary public attesting to the truth accuracy and veracity of the application and all attachments thereto 4 recital of the facts a concise and complete recital of the facts including dates of expenditures or obligation to expend funds dollar amounts the nature of expenditures or obligation to expend funds and other factors which are claimed to support the claim to a vested right to commence and complete a specific level type nature density intensity or other form of development 5 additional information relevant to the standards and factors in this section as the zoning administrator may specify exh a 102411 secs 7512575129  reserved article xiv  zoning amendments footnotes  11  editors note exh a adopted oct 24 201 amended former art xiv  7513075134 in its entirety to read as herein set out former art xiv pertained to the same subject matter and derived from  adopted  cross reference zoning regulation ch 21 purpose and intent the review process established in this article is intended to implement zoning amendment requests consistent with the citys comprehensive plan and other applicable regulations the procedures will provide efficient review of zoning amendment request with particular attention to levels of service established in the citys comprehensive plan and design and performance criteria established by the city to guide development exh a 102411 applicability the procedures contained in this article are applicable to all amendment requests to the zoning code or zoning district boundaries except for requests to rezone property to the planned development district zoning text and map amendments may be proposed by the city council the planning and zoning commission acting as the local planning agency and land development regulations commission or any department or agency of the city using this process but not required to submit all application requirements listed in this article a zoning map amendment may be proposed by any individual corporation partnership or agency other than the city which request is required to adhere to all requirements of this article proposals for zoning text amendments shall be processed administratively and only upon concurrence of and direction by a majority vote of the city council for zoning map amendments if the area is not contiguous to the same district as being requested the area must contain at least fifty thousand 50000 square feet of lot area and have at least two hundred 200 feet of street frontage to be considered in this process exh a 102411   schedule of fees the city council shall establish by resolution a schedule of fees charges and expenses for administering this article until all applicable fees charges and expenses have been paid no action shall be taken on any application exh a 102411 application procedures i sufficiency review all applications for a zoning amendment in the city shall be submitted to the zoning administrator applications must be submitted at least forty 40 days prior to the first or third thursday of any month the zoning administrator will review the application for sufficiency and completeness of information within five 5 working days after submission if corrections are requested the applicant shall have five 5 working days to make all requested changes incomplete applications will not be accepted should the applicant fail to submit all information as required within five 5 working days the application will not be considered complete and will not be processed ii notice of planning and zoning commission hearing after receipt of a complete petition the city shall give notice in a newspaper of general circulation as defined in florida statutes at least fifteen 15 days in advance of the planning and zoning commission public hearing date on which the petition is to be heard notice shall be posted on the property subject to the petition except for city initiated zoning amendments notices shall also be posted in two 2 public places as well as the city web site except for cityinitiated petitions notice shall be sent by first class regular united states mail to property owners within five hundred 500 feet of the subject property the distance shall be measured by a straight line from the point on the boundary of the property subject to the planned development zoning amendment petition nearest to the point of the boundary of any property within five hundred 500 feet thereof notice shall be deemed to have been delivered when deposited in the united states mail postage prepaid thereon and addressed to the property owner whose name is shown on the most current tax roll in orange county or seminole county all notices referenced in the above paragraph shall include a a statement that a zoning district classification amendment has been requested for the property if applicable  b the legal description of the property subject to the petition if applicable  and a general location map to correspond with the legal description of the property as noted on the hearing notice this does not mandate publication of the location map in the newspaper
