with the first billing in september 2018 secs 20632071  reserved division 3  wastes regulated or prohibited discharge of unpolluted wastes a no person shall discharge or cause to be discharged any storm water surface water groundwater roof runoff subsurface drainage uncontaminated cooling water or unpolluted industrial process waters to any sanitary sewer b storm water and all other unpolluted drainage shall be discharged to such sewers as are specifically designated as combined sewers or storm sewers or to a natural outlet approved by the public works director industrial cooling water or unpolluted process waters may be discharged on approval of the public works director to a storm sewer combined sewer or natural outlet 1 wastes prohibited generally no person shall discharge or cause to be discharged any of the following described waters or wastes to any public sewers a any gasoline benzene naphtha fuel oil or other flammable or explosive liquid solid or gas b any waters or wastes containing toxic or poisonous solids liquids or gases in sufficient quantity either singly or by interaction with other wastes to injure or interfere with any sewage treatment process constitute a hazard to humans or animals create a public nuisance or create any hazard in the receiving waters of the sewage treatment plant including but not limited to cyanides in excess of two mgl as cn in the wastes as discharged to the public sewer c any waters or wastes having a ph lower than five and fivetenths 55 or having any other corrosive property capable of causing damage or hazard to structures equipment and personnel of the sewage works d solids or viscous substances in quantities or of such size capable of causing obstruction to the flow in sewers or other interference with the proper operation of the sewage works such as but not limited to ashes cinders sand mud straw shavings metal glass rags feathers tar plastics wood unground garbage whole blood paunch manure hair and fleshings entrails and paper dishes cups milk containers etc either whole or ground by garbage grinders 1 wastes prohibited on order of director of public works no person shall discharge or cause to be discharged the following described substances materials waters or wastes if it appears likely in the opinion of the public works director that such wastes can harm either the sewers sewage treatment process or equipment have an adverse effect on the receiving stream or can otherwise endanger life limb public property or constitute a nuisance in forming his opinion as to the acceptability of these wastes the public works director will give consideration to such factors as the quantities of subject wastes in relation to flows and velocities in the sewers materials of construction of the sewers nature of the sewage treatment process capacity of the sewage treatment plant degree of treatability of wastes in the sewage treatment plant and other pertinent factors the substances prohibited are a any liquid or vapor having a temperature higher than one hundred fifty degrees 150 fahrenheit sixtyfive degrees 65 centigrade b any water or waste containing fats wax grease or oils whether emulsified or not in excess of one hundred 100 mgl or containing substances which may solidify or become viscous at temperatures between thirtytwo degrees 32 and one hundred fifty degrees 150 fahrenheit zero degrees 0 and sixtyfive degrees 65 centigrade c any garbage that has not been properly shredded the installation and operation of any garbage grinder equipped with a motor of threefourth 34 horsepower 076 hp metric or greater shall be subject to review and approval of the public works director d any waters or wastes containing strong acid iron pickling wastes or concentrated plating solutions whether neutralized or not e any waters or wastes containing toxic or poisonous substances in concentrations such as to constitute a hazard to humans or animals or to interfere with any sewage treatment process or create any hazard in the receiving waters of the sewage treatment plant the limits fixed herein may be used as a guide in design and plant control but may be altered by the director in the event of a cumulative overload on a particular drainage basin or sewage treatment plant fixed upper limits for constituents milligrams per liter 1 cadmium  50 2 chromium  30 3 copper  30 4 cyanide  00 5 nickel  01 6 silver  50 7 tin  50 8 zinc  30 9 phenol  05 f any waters or wastes containing phenols or other taste or odorproducing substances in such concentrations exceeding limits which may be established by the public works director as necessary after treatment of the composite sewage to meet the requirements of the state federal or other public agencies of jurisdiction for such discharge to the receiving waters g any radioactive wastes or isotopes of such halflife or concentration as may be exceed limits established by the public works director in compliance with applicable state or federal regulations h any waters or wastes having a ph in excess of nine and fivetenths 95 i materials which exert or cause 1 unusual concentrations of inert suspended solids such as but not limited to fullers earth lime slurries and lime residues or of dissolved solids such as but not limited to sodium chloride and sodium sulfate 2 excessive discoloration such as but not limited to dye wastes and vegetable tanning solutions 3 unusual bod chemical oxygen demand or chlorine requirements in such quantities as to constitute a significant load on the sewage treatment works 4 unusual volume of flow or concentration of wastes constituting slugs as defined herein j waters or wastes containing substances including nonbiodegradable detergents which are not amenable to treatment or reduction by the sewage treatment processes employed or are amenable to treatment only to such degree that the sewage treatment plant effluent cannot meet the requirements of other agencies having jurisdiction over discharge to the receiving waters 1 alternatives available to public works director if any waters or wastes are discharged or are proposed to be discharged to the public sewers which waters contain the substances or possess the characteristics enumerated in section 2074 and which in the judgment of the public works director may have a deleterious effect upon the sewage works processes equipment or receiving waters or which otherwise create a hazard to life or constitute a public nuisance the public works director may a reject the wastes  b require pretreatment to an acceptable condition for discharge to the public sewers  c require control over the quantities and rates of discharges  d require payment to cover the added cost of handling and treating the wastes not covered by existing taxes or sewer charges under the provisions of section 2081 1 approval of requirements for special equipment if the public works director permits the pretreatment or equalization of waste flows the design and installation of the plants and equipment shall be subject to the review and approval of the public works director and subject to the requirements of all applicable codes ordinances and laws 1 maintenance of special equipment where preliminary treatment or flowequalizing facilities are provided for any waters or wastes they shall be maintained continuously in satisfactory and effective operation by the owner at his expense 1 authority to require interceptors grease oil and sand interceptors shall be provided when in the opinion of the public works director they are necessary for the proper handling of liquid wastes containing grease in excessive amounts or any flammable wastes sand or other harmful ingredients  except that such interceptors shall not be required for private living quarters or dwelling units all interceptors shall be of a type and capacity approved by the public works director and shall be located as to be readily and easily accessible for cleaning and inspection 1 control manhole and other facilities may be required when required by the public works director the owner of any property serviced by a building sewer carrying industrial wastes shall install a suitable control manhole together with such necessary meters and other appurtenances in the building sewer to facilitate observation sampling and measurement of the wastes such manhole when required shall be accessibly and safely located and shall be constructed in accordance with plans approved by the public works director the manhole shall be installed by the owner at his expense and shall be maintained by him so as to be safe and accessible at all times 1 methods for measurements test and analyses all measurements tests and analysis of the characteristics of waters and wastes to which reference is made in this article shall be determined in accordance with the latest edition of standard methods for the examination of water and wastewater published by the american public health association and shall be determined at the control manhole provided or upon suitable samples taken at the control manhole in the event that no special manhole has been required the control manhole shall be considered to be the nearest downstream manhole in the public sewer to the point at which the building sewer is connected sampling shall be carried out by customarily accepted methods to reflect the effect of constituents upon the sewage works and to determine the existence of hazards to life limb and property the particular analysis involved will determine whether a grab sample or samples should be taken normally but not always bod and suspended solids analyses are obtained from twentyfour 24 hour composites of all outfalls whereas ph determinations are from periodic grab samples  special agreements for industrial wastes authorized no statement contained in this division shall be construed as preventing any special agreement or arrangement between the city and any industrial concern whereby an industrial waste or unusual strength or character may be accepted by the city for treatment subject to payment therefor by the industrial concern 1 compliance with federal and state pretreatment programs to control discharge from industrial users all discharges from any industrial users into the wastewater treatment system within the boundaries of the city of maitland are subject to the requirements set out in 40 cfr 403 and the florida department of environmental protection regulation 62625 fac as from time to time may be amended and said regulations are incorporated herein by reference  3899 secs 20832085  reserved article iv  water conservation for landscape irrigation footnotes  2  editors note  adopted oct 26 200 repealed former art iv  20922096 in its entirety and enacted new provisions as herein set out former art iv pertained to water conservation rules and derived from  111494   113 32700 intent and purpose it is the intent and purpose of this article to implement procedures that promote water conservation efficient landscape irrigation  102609 definitions for the purpose of this article the following terms phrases words and their derivatives shall have the meaning given herein when not inconsistent with the context words used in the present tense include the future words in the plural include the singular and words in the singular include the plural address means the house number of a physical location of a specific property this includes rural route numbers but excludes post office box numbers if a lot number in a mobile home park or similar community is used by the us postal service to determine a delivery location the lot number shall be the propertys address an even numbered address means an address ending in the numbers 0 2 4 6 8 or the letters am an odd numbered address means an address ending in the numbers 1 3 5 7 9 or the letters nz district means the st johns river water management district landscape irrigation means the outside watering of plants in a landscape such as shrubbery trees lawns grass ground covers plants vines gardens and other such flora that are situated in such diverse locations as residential areas public commercial and industrial establishments and public medians and rightsofway landscape irrigation does not include agricultural crops nursery plants cemeteries golf course greens tees fairways primary roughs and vegetation associated with recreational areas such as playgrounds football baseball and soccer fields nonresidential landscape irrigation means the irrigation of landscape not included within the definition of residential landscape irrigation such as that associated with public commercial and industrial property including commercial or transient housing units hotel and motel units and public medians and rightsofway no address refers to areas such as common areas in a subdivision landscaping in a park rightsofway and other areas included in the definition of landscape that do not have an address person means any person firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind residential landscape irrigation means the irrigation of landscape associated with any housing unit having sanitary and kitchen facilities designed to accommodate one or more residents including multiple housing units and mobile homes  102609 landscape irrigation schedules a when daylight savings time is in effect landscape irrigation shall occur only in accordance with the following irrigation schedule 1 residential landscape irrigation at odd numbered addresses or no address may occur only on wednesday and saturday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 2 residential landscape irrigation at even numbered addresses may occur only on thursday and sunday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 3 nonresidential landscape irrigation may occur only on tuesday and friday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 4 no more than threequarters 34 inch of water may be applied per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs and in no event shall irrigation occur for more than one 1 hour per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs b when eastern standard time is in effect landscape irrigation shall occur only in accordance with the following irrigation schedule 1 residential landscape irrigation at odd numbered addresses or no address may occur only on saturday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 2 residential landscape irrigation at even numbered addresses may occur only on sunday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 3 nonresidential landscape irrigation may occur only on tuesday and shall not occur between  am and  pm  and 4 no more than threequarters 34 inch of water may be applied per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs and in no event shall irrigation occur for more than one 1 hour per irrigation zone on each day that irrigation occurs c all landscape irrigation shall be limited in amount to only that necessary to meet landscape needs  102609 exceptions to the landscape irrigation schedules landscape irrigation shall be subject to the following irrigation schedule exceptions 1 irrigation using a microspray microjet drip or bubbler irrigation system is allowed anytime 2 irrigation of new landscape is allowed at any time of day on any day for the initial thirty 30 days after installation and every other day for the next thirty 30 days for a total of one sixtyday period provided that the irrigation is limited to the minimum amount necessary for such landscape establishment 3 watering in of chemicals including insecticides pesticides fertilizers fungicides and herbicides when required by law the manufacturer or best management practices is allowed at any time of day on any day within twentyfour 24 hours of application watering in of chemicals shall not exceed onequarter 14 inch of water per application except as otherwise required by law the manufacturer or best management practices 4 irrigation systems may be operated at any time of day on any day for maintenance and repair purposes not to exceed twenty 20 minutes per hour per zone 5 irrigation using a handheld hose equipped with an automatic shutoff nozzle is allowed at any time of day on any day 6 discharge of water from a watertoair airconditioning unit or other waterdependent cooling system is not limited 7 the use of water from a reclaimed water system is allowed anytime for the purpose of this paragraph a reclaimed water system includes systems in which the primary source is reclaimed water which may or may not be supplemented from another source during peak demand periods 8 the use of recycled water from wet detention treatment ponds for irrigation is allowed anytime provided the ponds are not augmented from any ground or offsite surface water or public supply sources  102609 additional requirement any person who irrigates landscape with an automatic lawn sprinkler system installed after  shall install maintain and operate a rain sensor device or switch that overrides the irrigation system when adequate rainfall has occurred  102609 variance from specific day of the week limitations a variance from the specific landscape irrigation days or day set forth in section 2088 may be granted if strict application of the scheduled days or day would lead to unreasonable or unfair results in particular instances provided that the applicant demonstrates with particularity that compliance with the scheduled days or day will result in a substantial economic health or other hardship on the applicant requesting the variance or those served by the applicant where a contiguous property is divided into different zones a variance may be granted hereunder so that each zone may be irrigated on different days or day than other zones of the property however in no event shall a variance allow a single zone to be irrigated more than two days per week during daylight savings time or more than one day per week during eastern standard time  102609 application of ordinance the provisions of this article shall apply to each person located within the city of maitland florida  102609 enforcement officials the city manager may delegate enforcement responsibility for this ordinance to the code enforcement department or any other department of the city  102609 penalties a violation of any provision of this article shall be subject to the following penalties first violation written warning second violation $5000 subsequent violations fine not to exceed $10000 b all fines shall be paid to the city of maitland within thirty 30 days of receipt of the notice notice of the offense and fine may be given in accordance with code enforcement procedures of or of of the ordinances failure to timely pay the fines shall result in a code enforcement action being brought by the city against the violator 3 one 1 week seven 7 days after the date of the first violation with a written warning each day in violation of this article shall constitute a separate offense in addition to the civil sanctions contained herein the city may take any other appropriate legal action including but not limited to injunctive action to enforce the provisions of this article  102609 secs 2095 2096  reserved article v  stormwater management discharge of polluting matter in natural waters prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to knowingly directly or indirectly drain deposit place or otherwise discharge into any natural waters receiving waters outlets streets or stormwater management systems within the city or to cause or permit to be drained deposited placed or otherwise discharged into such natural waters receiving waters outlets streets or stormwater management systems any organic or inorganic matter which causes pollution nothing herein shall preclude the drainage of irrigation water swimming pools andor spas for maintenance purposes pollution matter includes but is not limited to the following a chemicals and petroleum products including but not limited to oil gasoline grease paints soaps detergents laundry waste steam cleaning waste degreasers solvents antifreeze other automotive products acids alkalis dyes toxic or poisonous solids or liquids pesticides herbicides or fertilizers chemically treated cooling water or continuous commercial or mechanical direct discharge of heated water b solid waste pet waste wastewater sanitary sewerage animal carcasses recreational vehicle wastes c lawn clippings leaves branches silt construction materials block concrete bricks etc heavy solids that may obstruct the flow of stormwater in the citys storm systems or the direct dumping of soil  9897   8904 correction and discontinuance of prohibited discharge a the public works director may order the correction of any unsafe nonconforming or unauthorized condition which is in violation of any provision of this code or regulation adopted hereunder the public works director may also order the discontinuance of any activity causing such condition b whenever the public works director orders the correction or discontinuance of any condition or activity on any premises pursuant to this chapter the public works director shall notify the owner or other person responsible for such condition or activity in writing and shall state the nature of the violation direct the person to correct or discontinue the condition or activity and provide a reasonable time limit for the satisfactory correction thereof the offender shall within the time period stated in such notice permanently cease or correct all violations failure to comply with such order shall constitute a violation of the provisions of this chapter  9897 emergency conditions requiring immediate action notwithstanding any other provisions of this chapter whenever the public works director determines that conditions or activities exist requiring immediate action to protect the public health safety or welfare he or his designee is authorized to enter with written notice at all reasonable times in or upon any property for the purpose of testing inspecting investigating measuring sampling and correcting such emergency conditions the public works director or his designee may order verbally followed in writing the immediate discontinuance of any activity which causes or tends to cause the emergency condition failure to comply with such order within a reasonable time limit shall constitute a separate violation of this chapter  9897 liability for pollution abatement any person responsible for illicit pollutant discharge into any natural waters receiving waters outlets or stormwater management system and who fails to correct any prohibited condition or discontinue any prohibited activity at the public works directors order shall be responsible to pay the necessary expenses incurred by the city in carrying out the pollution abatement including any expenses incurred in testing measuring sampling collecting removing containing treating and disposing of the pollutant materials  9897 flooding  liability floods from stormwater runoff may occasionally occur which exceed the capacity of stormwater management systems or facilities constructed operated or maintained by the city this article shall not be construed or interpreted to mean that property will always or at any time be free from stormwater flooding or flood damage or that drainage facilities have been effectively constructed operated or maintained nor shall this article create any liability on the part of or cause of action against the city or any official or employee thereof for any flood damage that may result from such storms or the runoff thereof nor does this article purport to reduce the need or the necessity for flood insurance by individual property owners  9897 injunctive relief prohibiting discharge the public works director or his designee may immediately upon discovering an ongoing or potential discharge of pollutants into the citys natural waters receiving waters outlets or stormwater management systems in violation of this article shall give verbal or written notice to the owner of the property or other legally responsible party indicating the nature of such violation and directing appropriate action to effect correction of existing deficiencies failure of the owner or other legally responsible party to make directed corrections shall constitute a violation of this article in addition to other remedies provided for herein the city shall have a right to injunctive relief from a court of competent jurisdiction and to receive an award of all attorneys fees and costs in regard thereto  9897 notice  correction of violations a any person who knowingly violates any of the provisions of this article shall be punished as provided in section 18 of the maitland city every day on which such person continues to violate the provisions of this article after having been notified of such violation shall constitute a separate offense b any person who knowingly causes or allows an unauthorized discharge or who otherwise violates the provisions of this article may be required to appear before the special magistrate of the city for enforcement proceedings pursuant to sections 4710 procedures  and 4711 general functions  powers and duties of the maitland c the remedies and penalties provided in this article are not exclusive and the city may seek whatever other remedies are authorized by state law or in equity against any person who violates the provisions of this article  9997  res no 52008  1 2 51208 appeal procedure any person aggrieved by a determination of the public works director or his designee that such person is in violation of this article shall have the right to an appeal as provided in section 6519 of the maitland  9897 article vi  emergency water conservation regulations intent purpose and application the intent and purpose of this to protect the water resources of the city of maitland from the harmful affects of overutilization during periods of water shortage and allocate available water supplies by assisting the st johns river water management district in the implementation of its water shortage plan the provisions of this apply to all persons using the water resources within the city of maitland whether from public or privately owned water utility systems private wells or private connections with surface water bodies reclaimed water sources are exempted from this i 31201 definitions for the purpose of this following terms phrases words and their derivatives shall have the meaning given herein when not inconsistent with the context words used in the present tense include the future words in the plural include the singular and words in the singular include the plural the word shall is always mandatory and not merely directory district is the st johns river water management district person is any person firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind water resource means any and all water on or beneath the surface of the ground including natural or artificial water courses lakes ponds or diffused surface water and water percolating standing or flowing beneath the surface of the ground reclaimed water sources are not included in this definition water shortage condition is when sufficient water is not available to meet present or anticipated needs of persons using the water resource or when conditions are such as to require temporary reduction in total water usage within a particular area to protect the water resource from serious harm a water shortage usually occurs due to drought water shortage emergency means that situation when the powers which can be exercised under part ii of florida administrative are not sufficient to protect the public health safety or welfare or the health of animals fish or aquatic life or a public water supply or commercial industrial agricultural recreational or other reasonable uses i 31201 amendments to water shortage plan florida administration as same may be amended from time to time is incorporated herein by reference as a part of the maitland city st johns river water management districts amended order declaring a severe water shortage within lake marion orange polk seminole and volusia counties dated  is attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference as part of the maitland city as same may be amended from time to time i 31201 declaration of water shortage  water shortage emergency the declaration of a water shortage or water shortage emergency within all or any part of the city of maitland by the st johns river water management district shall invoke the provisions of this such declaration all water use restrictions or other measures adopted by the district applicable to the city of maitland shall be subject to enforcement action pursuant to this violation of the provisions of florida administrative the amended order attached to this incorporated herein by reference or any subsequent order issued pursuant to florida administrative shall be a violation of this i 31201 enforcement every police officer or deputy sheriff having jurisdiction in the area governed by this in connection with all other duties imposed by law diligently enforce the provisions of this employees of the public works department the fire department and inspectors also have the duty and are hereby authorized to enforce the provisions of this shall have the power to issue written warning notices andor citations under this addition the city manager may also delegate enforcement responsibility for this other departments of the city of maitland pursuant to florida statutes i 31201 penalties a any person violating any provision of this be subject to the following penalties 1 first offense written warning 2 second offense $5000 fine 3 third offense $12500 fine 4 fourth offense $47500 fine 5 subsequent violations fine not to exceed $50000 b each day in violation of this constitute a separate offense officials charged with the responsibility of enforcing this provide violators with no more than one 1 written warning in addition to the fines contained herein the city may take any other appropriate legal action including but not limited to injunctive action to enforce the provisions of this c the fines shall be applied to any violators water bill and any person violating the provisions of this also be responsible for reimbursing the city for any attorneys fees and costs incurred in correcting the violation i 31201 secs 2011120130  reserved article vii  stormwater environmental utility system footnotes  3  cross reference stormwater management  2097 et seq findings and creation of stormwater environmental utility a the city does hereby establish a stormwater environmental utility and charges it with responsibility for the planning administration construction operation and maintenance of the citys stormwater system for lake water quality management for implementation of the maitland stormwater lakes management plan for the education of citizens on these activities and for lake interconnects water quality management b the city council finds that those elements of the stormwater system which provide for the collection treatment and disposal of stormwater are of benefit and provide services to all real property within the incorporated city limits including property not presently or directly served by the system the benefits include the provision of adequate systems of collection conveyance detention treatment and release of stormwater  the reduction of hazard to property resulting from stormwater runoff and flooding  improvement in general health safety and welfare of flooding  and improvement to the water quality in the storm and surface water system and its receiving waters  82508 powers the city manager or designee shall direct the stormwater environmental utility his or her powers include 1 with the advice and assistance of the lakes advisory board preparation of recommendations to the council for all measures needed to implement this article including ordinance amendments  and adoption of such rules forms and procedures consistent with this ordinance as are necessary or desirable for the administration of the utility  2 administration of the planning design acquisition construction maintenance and operation of the utility system including capital improvements designated in the stormwaterlakes management plan slmp or the citys comprehensive plan  3 compliance with all conditions of permits or regulatory approvals held by the city stormwater system  and enforcement of this ordinance and the conditions of all cityissued permits or development orders with respect to the design construction maintenance and operation of the utility system its connections and discharges including but not limited to the volume quality and velocity of the stormwater retained detained or conveyed  4 inspection of private stormwater management systems and facilities as necessary to determine the compliance of such systems with this article and any regulations adopted under this article  5 advice to the city council and other city departments on matters relating to the utility  6 preparation and periodic revision of a comprehensive drainage plan for adoption by the city council  7 analysis of the cost of services and benefits provided by the system and provision of an annual recommendation to the city council for a structure of fees charges and fines for the utility  and 8 performance of other duties related to the stormwater environmental utility that are assigned by city council  82508 definitions and construction for the purpose of this article words used in the singular shall include the plural and the plural shall include the singular words used in the present tense shall include the future tense the word shall is mandatory and not discretionary the word may is permissive words not specifically defined here have the meaning given them in the same context by state or federal law if no such law applies the common and ordinary meaning as defined in the latest edition or addendum of websters new international dictionary shall apply the following specific definitions apply capital contribution means a payment to the city of cash or other consideration toward the construction or expansion of a regional stormwater management facility or other capital facility of the utility as set forth in an approved agreement for development or other approved development order city means city of maitland a florida municipal corporation the words the city or this city are synonymous city manager means the officer so defined by the city charter council means the city council of the city condominium means a residential condominium created by a declaration of condominium pursuant to florida statutes or a residential cooperative established pursuant to florida statutes condominium residential unit parcel means a developed parcel constituting one residential condominium unit developed parcel means any tax parcel that includes impervious area director means the city manager or the managers designee as stormwater environmental utility director dor code means the applicable uniform property use code established in rule 12d florida administrative use by county property appraisers eru means equivalent residential unit an eru is the basic unit of assessment of stormwater utility fees derived from the unmitigated stormwater runoff expected to be discharged to facilities of the utility from a single family residential unit of two thousand five hundred thirtytwo 2532 square feet of impervious area eru value means the ratio of impervious area of a developed parcel to the impervious area of one eru eru values are assigned by class grouping to all developed parcels other than general parcels exempt property means public rightsofway public streets public alleys and public sidewalks public parks and conservation areas and easements dedicated to the public fiscal year means the period commencing on october 1 of each year and continuing next succeeding september 30 or such other period as may be prescribed by laws as the fiscal year for the city general parcel means a developed parcel that is not otherwise classified as a small medium or large single family parcel or a condominium residential unit parcel general parcel includes but is not limited to all commercial developed parcels and all other developed parcels having an impervious area greater than four thousand five hundred 4500 square feet government property means property owned by the united states of america the state of florida a county a special district a municipal corporation or any of their respective government agencies or political subdivisions impervious area means hard surfaced areas which either prevent or severely restrict the entry of stormwater into the soil mantle or cause stormwater to run off the surface in greater quantities or at an increased rate of flow in comparison to that which was present under natural conditions prior to development impervious areas include but are not limited to rooftops concrete sidewalks walkways patio areas driveways parking lots storage areas and other surfaces which similarly impact the natural infiltration or runoff patterns which existed prior to development surfaces that are not impervious areas include but are not limited to grassed areas mulched areas without liners pervious asphalt and pervious concrete large single family parcel means a single family parcel with an impervious area greater than two thousand nine hundred ninetyfour 2994 square feet and less than or equal to four thousand five hundred 4500 square feet medium single family parcel means a single family parcel with an impervious area greater than two thousand one hundred sixtysix 2166 square feet and less than or equal to two thousand nine hundred ninetyfour 2994 square feet mitigation credit means for any developed parcel a number between 00 and 10 representing a reduction in the stormwater runoff otherwise expected to be generated by such parcel which is attributable to privately maintained stormwater management facilities the mitigation credit for each developed parcel shall be determined in accordance with the mitigation credit policy mitigation credit factor means the figure computed by subtracting the mitigation credit from 100 mitigation credit policy means the policy approved by resolution of the city council the initial policy is attached as appendix a the policy may hereafter from time to time be amended by a subsequent resolution editors note appendix a is not set out herein but is available in the office of the city clerk nonresidential developed area means any general parcel that is not exempt property property appraiser means the property appraiser for orange county florida single family parcel means a single family parcel as classified by the property appraiser under the dor code having an impervious area less than or equal to four thousand five hundred 4500 square feet small single family parcel means a single family parcel with an impervious area of two thousand one hundred sixtysix 2166 square feet or less state means the state of florida stormwater means the flow of surface water which results from and which occurs immediately following a rainfall event stormwater environmental utility means the utility established by this article stormwater environmental utility director means the city manager or designee stormwater fee means a periodic fee collectible from each benefited property in the stormwater service area and dedicated to fund stormwater management services stormwater fee roll means the stormwater utility roll maintained by the city for the purpose of the levy and collection of the stormwater environmental utility fee stormwater management facility means any facility approved by the city manager or designee that provides public benefit by retaining or detaining stormwater on site stormwater management services means a management and administration of the citys stormwater management program  b stormwater program engineering  c basin planning including capital improvement plan development  d operating and maintaining the citys capital facilities for stormwater management including extraordinary maintenance and repair  e billing and collection of stormwater fees including customer information services  f reserves for replacement and repair  and g legal engineering and other consultant services stormwater service area means all real property within the city stormwater service cost means the estimated amount for any fiscal year of all expenditures and reasonable reserves that are properly attributable to stormwater management services provided within the stormwater service area under generally accepted accounting principles including without limiting the generality of the foregoing reimbursement to the city for any moneys advanced for stormwater management services and interest on any interfund or intrafund loan for such a purpose tax parcel means a parcel of property other than government property to which the property appraiser has assigned a distinct ad valorem property tax identification number tax roll means the real property ad valorem tax assessment roll maintained by the property appraiser for the purpose of the levy and collection of ad valorem taxes  82508 operating budget the city shall adopt an operating budget for the stormwater environmental utility not later than the first day of each fiscal year the operating budget shall set forth for such fiscal year the estimated collectible revenues of the utility and the estimated costs for planning administration construction and capital improvements operations and maintenance extension and replacement and debt service  82508 stormwater fee a fee established a stormwater fee is hereby imposed on each and every developed parcel other than exempt property payable as provided in subsection 20135d the stormwater fee shall be a monthly or annual service charge the frequency being determined by the provisions of subsection 20135d b computation on or before september 15 of each year the city council shall by resolution establish the stormwater fee for one eru for the ensuing fiscal year the stormwater fee shall be not more than the amount determined by dividing the budgeted cost for the citys stormwater environmental utility services for planning administration construction capital improvements operations and maintenance extension and replacement and debt service by the sum of the eru values of all developed parcels within the city the fee for each parcel shall be determined by multiplying the stormwater fee for one eru by the eru value of the parcel and multiplying the product by the mitigation credit factor fee for 1 eru  eru value  mitigation credit factor the city council may fund less than all of the proposed operating budget for the stormwater environmental utility with stormwater fees by appropriating funds from any other lawful source c stormwater fee roll within ten 10 days after adoption of the ordinance from which this article derives and thereafter on or before august 1 of each year the city manager or designee shall prepare a stormwater fee roll containing each tax parcel subject to a stormwater fee and the eru value calculated in the manner provided in section 20136 and mitigation credit factor assigned to that parcel as of the preceding january 1 where a developed parcel has multiple assigned utility accounts the roll shall subdivide the developed parcel by account  and 1 shall apportion the eru value of the parcel among the utility accounts by assigning to each account the impervious area attributable to the improvements exclusively served by that account  and 2 shall apportion any remaining impervious area such as parking lot or driveway which serves two 2 or more accounts between or among such accounts by the proportion of their respective amounts of exclusively occupied impervious area a copy of the stormwater fee roll and of the current and any proposed resolutions of the city council establishing the eru rate and mitigation credit factors shall be maintained on file in the office of the city manager or designee as a public record d method of collection 1 the finance department shall bill the stormwater fee for those developed parcels utilizing other city utilities to the utility account holder on a monthly basis as a separate item on the citys bill for all other city utilities 2 the finance department shall bill the stormwater fee for multiple utility accounts within a single developed parcel monthly to each utility account holder on a prorated basis in accordance with subsection 20135c and as a separate item on the citys bill for all other city utilities 3 the finance department shall bill the stormwater fee for those developed parcels having no other utility accounts no less often than annually as directed by the city manager or designee 4 the stormwater fee for those properties utilizing other city utilities is part of a consolidated statement for utility customers payable by a single payment in the event that a partial payment is received the payment shall be applied prorata to each utility service billed on the consolidated statement in the proportion that an individual utility service bears to the total consolidated statement of all current charges for all utility services unless otherwise approved by the city council 5 all bills for stormwater fees shall become due and payable in accordance with the citys rules and regulations of the finance department pertaining to the collection of the fees 6 the city shall be entitled to recover all reasonable attorneys fees and costs incurred in collecting delinquent stormwater fees any charge due hereunder which is not paid when due may be recovered in an action at law by the city in addition to any other remedies or penalties provided by this or any other ordinance of the city or general law failure of any user of city utilities within the city to pay said charges promptly when due shall subject such user to possible discontinuance of other utility services and the city manager or designee is hereby empowered and directed to enforce this provision as to any and all delinquent users e appeal of calculation of stormwater fees any owner of a developed parcel which is subject to payment of a stormwater utility fee who contests the calculation of the stormwater fee for that parcel as shown in the stormwater fee roll may appeal such determination to the city manager or designee any appeal must be filed in writing not later than fortyfive 45 days after receipt of the first utility billing of the fiscal year and may include a survey prepared by a registered surveyor showing dwelling units total property area impervious area or nonresidential developed area and any such other information that the appellant may deem appropriate the city manager or designee may request additional information from the appealing party based upon the information provided by the utility and appealing party the city manager or designee shall make a final calculation of the applicable stormwater fee the city manager or designee shall notify the parties in writing of the decision within sixty 60 days of submittal any decision of the city manager or designee may be further appealed to the city council by filing written notice with the city clerk within thirty 30 days of the city managers decision the decision of the city council shall be final upon finality the city manager or designee shall make any necessary reductions to the stormwater fee roll in respect of the affected parcel or parcels and shall make any appropriate refunds of fees already paid in the current fiscal year  82508 determination of eru values a classification of developed parcels each developed parcel located within the stormwater service area shall be classified on the stormwater fee roll as a singlefamily parcel residential condominium parcel or general parcel b small single family parcels the council hereby finds and determines as follows 1 small single family residence parcels constitute a significant proportion of all parcels located with the stormwater service area and the cost of measuring or verifying the impervious area for each individual small single family residence greatly exceeds any benefit to be derived from individual measurement or verification 2 the eru value of all small single family residence parcels is on average seventy 70 percent of that of a medium single family residence parcel and accordingly all small single family residence parcels are assigned an eru value of 07 c medium single family parcels the council hereby finds and determines as follows 1 medium single family residence parcels constitute a significant proportion of all parcels located with the stormwater service area and represent the most typical size singlefamily residence within the stormwater service area the cost of measuring or verifying the impervious area for each individual medium single family residence greatly exceeds any benefit to be derived from individual measurement or verification 2 all medium single family residence parcels are assigned an eru value of 10 d large single family parcels the council hereby finds and determines as follows 1 large single family residence parcels constitute a significant proportion of all parcels located with the stormwater service area the cost of measuring or verifying the impervious area for each individual large single family residence greatly exceeds any benefit to be derived from individual measurement or verification 2 the eru value of all large single family residence parcels is on average one hundred forty 140 percent of that of a medium single family residence parcel and accordingly all large single family residence parcels are assigned an eru value of 14 e residential condominium parcels the council hereby finds and determines as follows 1 a residential condominium is part of an identifiable class of real property ownership comprised of condominium residential unit parcels to which there may be an appurtenant undivided share in condominium common area parcels when the allocable share of common area of residential condominium parcels is considered the average impervious area for each condominium unit is found to be within the range of such areas for small single family residence parcels and is assigned an eru value of 07 2 the classification of any new or modified condominium as small single family residential is subject to redetermination by the city manager or designee subject to the right of the condominium association to appeal to the council in the manner provided in subsection 20135e if as a result of such a redetermination the actual impervious area of such new or modified residential condominium prorated among the units of the condominium is found to be more than one hundred 100 percent of an eru 2532 square feet then the condominium units shall be assigned an eru value of 10 effective as of january 1 of the year following such redetermination 3 in determining the mitigation credit factor for residential condominium parcels any part of the impervious area of the condominium that is directly connected to the citys stormwater management system without onsite detention shall be subject to the stormwater utility fee without credit for mitigation f general parcels the eru value of each general parcel shall be determined by 1 dividing the impervious area of the general parcel by one eru 2532 square feet and 2 multiplying the result by the appropriate mitigation credit factor in determining the mitigation credit factor for general parcels any part of the impervious area of the parcel that is directly connected to the citys stormwater management system without onsite detention shall be subject to the stormwater utility fee without credit for mitigation g mitigation credit policy for private stormwater management facilities 1 the council recognizes the benefits provided by privately maintained stormwater management facilities developed parcels which provide private stormwater management facilities should be credited to the extent that such facilities advance the goals and objectives established from time to time in the stormwaterlakes management plan and the citys comprehensive plan the council hereby approves the initial mitigation credit policy attached as appendix a the policy may be modified by resolution of the city council at any time to conform to revisions in such goals and objectives  provided that such modification shall not apply retroactively to credits previously established under a preexisting credit policy 2 in order to receive a mitigation credit for which a developed parcel is eligible the property owner or user shall provide the city manager or designee with supporting documentation such documentation may include as built drawings unless they have been previously provided of the stormwater management facility sealed by a floridaregistered professional engineer a certification from a floridaregistered professional engineer as to the standards of retention and detention achieved by the facility an operating permit for the stormwater management facility from the appropriate regional water management district or such other reasonable requirements as may be necessary to demonstrate the relief of city stormwater facilities or advancement of the goals and objectives of the stormwaterlakes management plan and the citys comprehensive plan 3 no mitigation credit shall be applied to the stormwater fee for service provided to a developed parcel by a stormwater management facility constructed or maintained with public funds nevertheless a mitigation credit shall be available for stormwater utility service provided to a developed parcel by an approved and permitted regional stormwater management facility if and to the extent that the utilitys costs of capital construction or debt amortization are reduced because the developer of the property provided a capital contribution to the regional facility in lieu of constructing onsite facilities  82508 program responsibility the city manager or designee shall administer the stormwater environmental utility system created by this ordinance the city manager or designee shall keep an accurate record of all persons using the services and facilities of said stormwater management system of the city and make changes in accordance with the rates and charges established in this article  82508 stormwater environmental utility fund a special revenue fund a stormwater management fund is established into which all revenues from user fees connection charges grants or other funding sources of the stormwater environmental utility shall be deposited and from which all planning construction operation education administration and maintenance expenditures related to the citys stormwater management utility shall be paid accounting and reporting procedures shall be consistent with state law and reported to the city council by the city manager at least annually it is the intent of the city council that this fund be established as a special revenue fund rather than an enterprise fund b limitation on expenditures expenditures for activities that are not related to the citys stormwater environmental utility shall not be permitted from the fund except for a prorated charge for general city government services as is in effect for other city utility funds  82508 zoning footnotes  1  editors note the provisions of ch 21 derived from  adopted nov 26 199  4 of which provides as follows that all ordinances or resolutions or parts
