known as the zoning city of maitland florida ii relationship to comprehensive development plan the foregoing regulations and requirements set forth herein have been established in accordance with the comprehensive development plan of the city of maitland florida this chapter provides regulations to implement goals policies and objectives of the comprehensive development plan and shall always be subject to the provisions of the comprehensive development plan iii zoning code standards held to be a minimum in interpretation and application the provisions of the zoning code shall be viewed as minimum requirements adopted for promotion of the public health safety welfare economic order and aesthetics iv prosecution under previous zoning code any prosecution arising from a violation of any ordinance repealed by this zoning code which prosecution was pending at the time this zoning code becomes effective or any prosecution which may be started within one 1 year after the effective date of this zoning code in consequence of any violation of any ordinance repealed herein which violation was committed prior to the effective date of this zoning code shall be tried and determined exactly as if such ordinance had not been repealed v official zoning map the city is hereby divided into zones or districts as shown on the official zoning map which together with all explanatory matter thereon is hereby adopted by reference and declared to be a part of this chapter the official zoning map shall be identified by the signature of the mayor attested by the city clerk and bearing the seal of the city under the following words this is to certify that this is the official zoning map referred to in section 211 of the maitland city  together with the date of the adoption of if in accordance with the provisions of law changes are made in district boundaries or any other matter portrayed on the official zoning map such changes shall be entered on the official zoning map promptly after the amendment has been approved by the city council with an entry on the official zoning map as follows on date  by official action of the city council the following changes were made in the official zoning map brief description of nature of changes which entry shall be signed by the mayor and attested by the city clerk immediately upon its passage the city clerk shall post a copy of the amending ordinance beside the official zoning map until such time as the change in the official zoning map in the manner set out shall have been made the change in the official zoning map shall be made promptly and upon such change having been made the copy of the amending ordinance shall be immediately removed from beside the official zoning map no changes of any nature shall be made in the official zoning map or matter shown thereon except in conformity with the procedures set forth in this zoning code any unauthorized change of whatever kind by any person or persons shall be considered a violation of this zoning code and punishable as provided under of this reference procedures  478 et seq regardless of the existence of purported copies of the official zoning map which may from time to time be made or published the official zoning map which shall be located in the vault located in city hall shall be the final authority as to the current zoning status of land and water areas buildings and other structures in the city vi replacement of official zoning map in the event that the official zoning map becomes damaged destroyed lost or difficult to interpret because of the nature or number of changes and additions the city council may by ordinance adopt a new official zoning map which shall supersede the prior official zoning map the new official zoning map may correct drafting or other errors or omissions in the prior official zoning map but no such correction shall have the effect of amending the original official zoning map the new official zoning map shall be identified by the signature of the mayor attested by the city clerk and bearing the seal of the city under the following words this is to certify that this official zoning map supersedes and replaces the official zoning map adopted on date  as part of of the city of maitland florida unless the prior official zoning map has been lost or has been totally destroyed the prior map or any significant parts thereof remaining shall be preserved together with all available records pertaining to its adoption or amendment  112690   32700 rules for interpretation of district boundaries where uncertainty exists as to the boundaries of districts as shown on the official zoning map the following rules shall apply a boundaries indicated as approximately following the centerlines of streets highways or alleys shall be construed to follow such centerlines  b boundaries indicated as approximately following platted lot lines shall be construed as following such lot lines  c boundaries indicated as approximately following city limits shall be construed as following such city limits  d boundaries indicated as following railroad lines shall be construed to be midway between the main tracks  e boundaries indicated as following shorelines shall be construed to follow such shorelines and in the event of change in the shoreline shall be construed as moving with the actual shoreline  boundaries indicated as approximately following the center lines of streams canals lakes or other bodies of water shall be construed to follow such centerlines  f boundaries indicated as parallel to or extensions of features indicated in subsections a e above shall be so construed distances not specifically indicated on the official zoning map shall be determined by the scale of the map g where physical or cultural features existing on the ground are at variance with those shown on the official zoning map or in other circumstances not covered by subsections a f above the board of zoning adjustment shall interpret the district boundaries h where a public road street or alley is officially vacated or abandoned the regulations applicable to the property to which it is reverted shall apply to such vacated or abandoned road street or alley  112690 application of district regulations except as hereinafter provided a no building structure or land shall hereafter be used or occupied and no building or structure or part thereof shall hereafter be erected constructed reconstructed moved or structurally altered unless in conformity with all of the regulations herein specified for the district in which it is located b no building or other structure shall hereafter be erected or altered 1 to exceed the allowed height  2 to exceed the allowed floorarea ratio  3 to provide a greater number of dwelling units than allowed herein  4 to occupy a greater percentage of lot area than allowed herein  5 to have narrower or smaller rear yards front yards side yards or other open spaces than herein required  or in any other manner contrary to the provisions of this zoning code  6 to provide a lesser separation of buildings or structures or portion of buildings or structures than required herein c no part of a yard or other open space or offstreet parking or loading space required about or in connection with any building for the purpose of complying with this chapter shall be included as part of a yard open space or offstreet parking or loading space similarly required for any other building d no yard or lot existing at the time of passage of the zoning code shall be reduced in size or area below the minimum requirements set forth herein yards or lots created after the effective date of this zoning code shall meet at least the minimum requirements established by this zoning code e within each district the regulations set by this zoning code shall be minimum regulations and shall apply uniformly to each class or kind of structure or land  112690 administration and enforcement i administration an administrative official hereby known as the zoning administrator shall administer enforce and interpret the zoning code in the performance of these duties the zoning administrator may request the assistance of authorized officers within the city and is thereby authorized to act or assistants a violation or alleged violation of the zoning code may be filed by any persons the complaint signed by the complainant may be submitted in writing to the zoning administrator or designee if the complaint is not transmitted in writing and signed by the complainant the alleged violation shall be investigated and validated prior to initiation of enforcement procedures all complaints received shall be recorded upon verification of the legitimacy of the complaint the zoning administrator shall forward a notice of zoning violation to the property owner of record as listed in the most current tax rolls from orange county it shall cite the section of the code which is allegedly violated and allow fifteen 15 days in which to comply with the code the fifteen 15 days shall be measured from the date of receipt of the certified letter at the conclusion of the fifteen 15 days a follow up report shall be forwarded to the code enforcement officer it shall at a minimum contain the zoning administrators interpretation of the code section violated a copy of the section of the code allegedly violated and any supplemental information which may assist in the disposition of the case ii penalties for violation violations of the provisions or failure to comply with any of the requirements therein including violations of conditions of approval resultant from a decision rendered by an established board commission or council shall be subject to code enforcement proceedings and penalties set forth in of the city owner or tenant of any building structure premises or part thereof and any architect building contractor agent or other person who commits participates in assists in or maintains such violation may individually be found guilty of a separate offense and suffer code enforcement proceedings and penalties set forth in nothing herein shall prevent the city from taking such other lawful action as is necessary to prevent or remedy any violation cross reference procedures  478 et seq iii building permits required no building or other structure shall be erected moved added to or structurally altered without a permit consistent with requirements established herein and issued by the building official any permit issued in error shall not confer any rights or privileges on the applicant to proceed with construction but the city shall have the right to revoke such permit in cases where a permit has been issued in error but where actual construction has begun according to the building officials application of the florida building city council shall determine the appropriate course of action  112690   62616  supplemental district regulations i nonconforming lots  nonconforming uses of land  nonconforming structures  nonconforming uses of structures and premises  nonconforming characteristics of uses a intent within the districts established by this zoning code or amendments that may later be adopted there may exist a lots b structures c uses of land and structures and d characteristics of use which were lawful before this zoning code was passed or amended but which would be prohibited regulated or restricted under the terms of this zoning code or future amendments it is the intent of this zoning code to permit these nonconformities to continue until they are removed but not to encourage their survival it is further the intent of this zoning code that nonconformities shall not be enlarged upon expanded or extended nor be used as grounds for adding other structures or uses prohibited elsewhere in the same district nonconforming uses are declared by this zoning code to be incompatible with permitted uses in the districts involved a nonconforming use of a structure a nonconforming use of land or a nonconforming use of structure and land in combination shall not be extended or enlarged after passage of this chapter by attachment on a building or premises of additional signs intended to be seen from off the premises or by the addition of other uses of a nature which would be prohibited generally in the district involved to avoid undue hardship nothing in this zoning code shall be deemed to require a change in the plans construction or designated use of any building on which actual construction was lawfully begun prior to the effective date of adoption or amendment of this zoning code however if construction of the buildings as determined by the building officials application of the florida building has not begun within one 1 year following approval of a site plan or the building permit for construction of the buildings has become void any approval of the site plan and uses designated therein shall terminate if the site plan lapses or building permit becomes void resubmission of a site plan or building permit is required and is subject to all review and approval processes regardless of any previous site plan or permit approvals acquired b nonconforming lots of record in any district in which dwellings are permitted a dwelling or dwellings and customary accessory buildings may be erected on any single lot that is of record as of  notwithstanding limitations imposed by other provisions of this zoning code this provision shall apply even though such lot fails to meet the requirements for area or width or both that are generally applicable in the district provided that yard dimensions and requirements other than those applying to area or width or both of the lot shall conform to the regulations for the district in which such lot is located variance of yard or other requirements not involving use shall be obtained only of the board of zoning adjustment such lot must have at least the same total square footage and lot width as originally platted as applied to the rs3 district notwithstanding limitations imposed by this section and other provisions of this zoning code should such lot be altered so that it no longer has at least the same total square footage and lot width as originally platted a dwelling and customary accessory buildings may be erected provided the lot was not altered after the effective date of the adoption of this zoning  and such lot must not be less than fortyfive 45 feet in width as applied to the rsd district notwithstanding limitations imposed by this section and other provisions of this zoning code should such lot be altered so that it no longer has at least the same total square footage and lot width as originally platted a dwelling or two family dwelling and customary accessory buildings may be erected on such lot provided the lot was not altered after the effective date of the adoption of this zoning code  and such lot must not be less than fortyeight 48 feet in width c nonconforming uses of land where at the time of passage of this zoning code lawful use of land exists which would not be permitted by the regulations imposed by this zoning code the use may be continued so long as it remains otherwise lawful provided 1 no such nonconforming use shall be enlarged or increased nor extended to occupy a greater area of land than was occupied at the effective date of adoption or amendment of this zoning code  2 no such nonconforming use shall be moved in whole or in part to any portion of the lot or parcel other than that occupied by such use at the effective date of adoption or amendment of this zoning code  3 if any such nonconforming use of land ceases for any reason for a period of more than one hundred eighty 180 days any subsequent use of such land shall conform to the regulations specified by this zoning code for the district in which such land is located 4 no additional structure not conforming to the requirements of this zoning code shall be erected in connection with such nonconforming use of land d nonconforming structures where a lawful structure exists at the effective date of adoption or amendment of this zoning code that could not be built under the terms of this code by reason of restrictions on area lot coverage height yards its location on the lot or other requirements concerning the structure such structure may be continued so long as it remains otherwise lawful subject to the following provisions 1 no such nonconforming structure may be enlarged or altered in a way which increases its nonconformity but any structure or portion thereof may be altered to decrease its nonconformity  2 should such nonconforming structure or nonconforming portion of structure be destroyed by any means to an extent of more than fifty 50 percent of the assessed value of the structure or nonconforming portion of the structure at time of destruction the nonconforming structure or nonconforming portion of structure shall not be reconstructed except in conformity with the provisions of this zoning code 3 should such structure or portion of such structure be destroyed by any means to an extent less than fifty 50 percent of its assessed value it may be restored only upon application to the board of zoning adjustment 4 should such structure be moved for any reason for any distance whatever it shall thereafter conform to the regulations for the district in which it is located after it is moved 5 preexisting fences made nonconforming due to annexation by the city shall be permitted to be repaired or replaced in part or in whole provided the repair or replacement does not increase the nonconformity with respect to height or setback and subject to section 216ii visibility at intersections e nonconforming uses of structures or of structures and premises in combination if a lawful use of a structure and premises in combination exists at the effective date of adoption or amendment of this zoning code that would not be allowed in the district under the terms of this zoning code the lawful use may be continued as long as it remains otherwise lawful subject to the following provisions 1 no existing structure devoted to a use not permitted by this zoning code in the district in which it is located shall be enlarged extended constructed reconstructed moved or structurally altered except in changing the use of the structure to a use permitted in the district in which it is located  2 any nonconforming use may be extended throughout any parts of a building which were manifestly arranged or designed for such use at the time of adoption or amendment of this zoning code but no such use shall be extended to occupy any land outside such building  3 any structure or structure and land in combination in or on which a nonconforming use is superseded by a permitted use shall thereafter conform to the regulations for the district and the nonconforming use may not thereafter be resumed  4 when a nonconforming use of a structure or structure and premises in combination is discontinued or abandoned for one hundred eighty 180 consecutive days except when government action impedes access to the premises the structure or structure and premises in combination shall not thereafter be used except in conformance with the regulations of the district in which it is located  5 where nonconforming use status applies to a structure and premises in combination removal or destruction of the structure shall eliminate the nonconforming status of the land destruction for the purpose of this subsection is defined as damage to an extent of more than fifty 50 percent of the assessed value of the structure at time of destruction f repairs and maintenance on any nonconforming structure or portion of a structure containing a nonconforming use work may be done in any period of twelve 12 consecutive months on ordinary repairs or on repair or replacement of nonbearing walls fixtures wiring or plumbing to an extent not exceeding ten 10 percent of the current assessed value of the nonconforming structure or nonconforming portion of the structure as the case may be provided that the cubic content existing when it became nonconforming shall not be increased if a nonconforming structure or portion of a structure containing a nonconforming use becomes physically unsafe or unlawful due to lack or repairs and maintenance and is declared by any duly authorized official to be unsafe or unlawful by reason of physical condition it shall not thereafter be restored repaired or rebuilt except in conformity with the general regulations of the district in which it is located if a nonconforming structure or portion of a structure containing a nonconforming use becomes physically unsafe or unlawful for reasons other than lack of repairs or maintenance nothing in this zoning code shall be deemed to prevent the strengthening or restoring to a safe condition of such building or part thereof declared to be unsafe by any official charged with protecting the public safety provided however that where such unsafeness or unlawfulness is the result of damage from destruction the percentage of damage limitations as set out in this section shall apply where a building or structure is conforming as to location and use nothing in this zoning code shall be deemed to prevent the strengthening or restoring to a safe condition of such building or part thereof declared to be unsafe by any official charged with protecting the public safety g uses under permitted conditional use provisions not nonconforming uses any use which is permitted as a permitted conditional use in a district under the terms of this zoning code shall not be deemed a nonconforming use in such district ii visibility at intersections on a corner lot in any district nothing shall be erected placed planted or allowed to grow in such a manner as materially to impede vision which constitutes hazardous conditions for vehicular or pedestrian traffic between a height of two and onehalf 212 and ten feet 10 above the top of the curb of the intersection streets in the areas bounded by the street rightofway lines of such corner lots and a line joining points along said street rightofway lines twentyfive feet 25 from the point of the intersection on minor and collector streets and fifty feet 50 on arterial streets for winfield units 1 and 2 single family residential subdivisions annexed by no fence or wall shall be erected so as to encroach into the fifteenfoot 15 corner triangle at a street intersection cross reference traffic ch 18 iii fences and walls on any residentially zoned district fences walls and hedges erected or placed on all lots shall be in accordance with the following criteria a fences and walls may be erected placed and maintained at a height not exceeding eight feet 8 above the established grade level in any required side or rear yard fences and walls within a required front yard shall not exceed two and onehalf feet 212 in height above the established lot grade  112894 except for preexisting fences listed in section 215 5 for winfield units 1 and 2 single family residential subdivisions annexed by fences and walls are limited to a maximum height of four feet 4 within a required front yard and a maximum height of eight feet 8 within any required side or rear yard on any corner lot abutting the side of another lot no part of any fence located within twentyfive feet 25 of the common lot line shall be nearer the side street lot line than the required front yard of such abutting lot unless adjacent property owner sharing the common lot line provides notarized letter of approval and there are no site visibility concerns b in residential zoning districts notwithstanding other provisions in this zoning code fences and walls up to eight 8 feet in height may be erected placed and maintained in any required yard for security of a public park in conjunction with floating zone publicsemipublic uses of the zoning code nevertheless within any required front yard no solid fence or solid wall shall be located so as to constitute a hazardous obstruction of visibility between two and onehalf feet 212 and ten feet 10 in height to vehicular and pedestrian traffic  112894 c barbed wire or electrically charged fences shall not be erected in any residential district neither shall any wall fence or similar structure erected in any residential district contain any material or substance such as broken glass spikes nails barbs or similar materials designed to inflict pain or injury on any person or animal  112894 d in a residential zoning district on a flag lot construction of a fence or wall within the access portion of the lot is not permitted the access portion of a flag lot is that part of the lot which serves to meet the minimum frontage requirement on a public or private street but does not meet the minimum lot width requirements and functions primarily as a driveway to reach the remainder of lot or parcel of land see diagram yards on culdesac lots and flag lots definitions fence or wall construction on other than the access portion of the lot shall be in accordance with front side and rear yard requirements for residential zoning districts as noted above in commercial or office districts notwithstanding other provisions in this zoning code fences and walls up to eight feet 8 in height may be permitted in any required yard provided that no solid fence or solid wall within any required front yard shall constitute a hazardous obstruction of visibility between two and onehalf feet 212 and ten feet 10 in height to the vehicular and pedestrian traffic likewise in any nonresidential districts barbed wire may be incorporated in or used as a fence above the level of six feet 6 from the ground any barbed wire shall be placed so that it does not project outward over any street sidewalk public way or adjacent property finally in any district hedges may be placed planted or allowed to grow so as to form an opaque screen within any required front yard or within the access portion of a flag lot but shall not be permitted so as to constitute a hazardous obstruction of visibility between two and onehalf feet 212 and ten feet 10 in height to vehicular and pedestrian traffic  112894 iv parking of commercial vehicles within residential districts the parking of any vehicle greater than one 1 ton in nominal load rating is prohibited on the public streets or on or within privately owned driveways or property within any residentially zoned district except for loading or unloading purposes when rendering a service to the property furthermore this parking prohibition shall include all vehicles regardless of load rating which have more than six 6 weightbearing wheels or vehicles with trailer combinations which are designed intended or used for transportation of people chattel or goods and used for purposes other than for a private passenger vehicle or use finally this parking prohibition shall apply to all of the following vehicles regardless of load rating tow trucks any vehicle with a crane or jib attached any vehicle that is used commercially to transport insecticides pesticides poisons noxious gases septic tank residues flammable liquids or gases acids alkalies explosives or other dangerous substances or liquids recreational vehicles are also exempt from this parking provision but are subject to other applicable provisions of the reference limitations on trucks using certain streets within city limits  183  parking violations generally  1811 et seq  restrictions on parking trucks and other commercial vehicles  1821 et seq v accessory uses and structures residential districts accessory uses and structures shall not be located in required front or side yards nor located nearer than seven and onehalf 712 feet to a rear property line  provided however that accessory structures for the housing of persons such as guest houses and garage apartments shall not be located in any required yard on double frontage or corner lots in residential districts accessory uses and structures shall not be located in either of the front yards but may be located in one but not both required side yards however in no case shall they be located closer than seven and onehalf 712 feet to any side yard property line a air conditioner compressor units residential districts air conditioner compressor units in residential zoning districts shall not be located in any required yard and must be located no farther than three feet 3 from the principal structure which it serves however where as the effective date of an existing air conditioner compressor unit is within a required rear or side yard a replacement air conditioner compressor unit may be located in the same location in residential districts where a replacement unit is permitted in a required side or rear yard air conditioner compressor units closer than five feet 5 from any side or rear property line or within the required side or rear yard and higher than thirty inches 30 above ground level must comply with the following ari sound ratings in accordance with ari standard 27095 the ari standard was prepared by the airconditioning & refrigeration institute to establish a method of soundrating outdoor unitary equipment in terms of sound pressure levels unit size ari sound rating 4 ton units and under 80 decibels 80 bels or less between 4 and 5 ton units 84 decibels 84 bels or less 5 ton units or greater prohibited from required yards in residential districts for winfield units 1 and 2 singlefamily residential subdivisions annexed by replacement units shall be permitted in preexisting locations replacement units increased in size or relocated shall be subject to sound rating specifications listed above air conditioning units shall be screened with landscaping if located within any street side yard subject to no hazardous obstruction to visibility for vehicular or pedestrian traffic screening shall be implemented when an air conditioning unit is replaced and is increased in size or relocated nonresidential districts for properties located in nonresidential districts the air conditioner compressor unit chiller andor evaporator unit of a proposed buildingstructures air handler system shall not be located in any required yard screening for these units may be accomplished by a closed fence or wall which is at least six 6 feet high and is compatible with the principal building the height of the fence or wall may be required to be increased if the height of the proposed unit exceeds six 6 feet in height and is visible from adjacent property or adjacent rightofway likewise the fence or wall may be eliminated if screened by adjacent structures so as not to be visible from adjacent property or rightofway additional planting materials shall be provided so that no more than onethird  13  of the surface area of the closed fence or wall is visible from the street or adjacent properties within three 3 years of erection of the structure the screening may also be accomplished with a natural evergreen plant material which can be expected to reach six 6 feet or greater in height within two 2 years of planting any plant material used to fulfill these requirements shall be a minimum of four 4 feet in height when planted and there shall be no gap greater than two 2 feet between plant foliage access points to the units must also be screened with gates if it is visible from the road public rightofway or adjacent property landscape materials may be waived if the unit is placed on a roof so that it not visible from adjacent rightofway or property likewise trees may be required to achieve the necessary screening if the proposed unit is greater than six 6 feet high and is visible from adjacent rightofway or property all decisions on location and screening requirements shall be made by the city manager or designee with any appeal to the decision made to the planning and zoning commission within thirty 30 days of such decision as of the effective date of this ordinance where an existing air conditioner unit chiller andor evaporator unit is within a required rear or side yard a replacement unit may be located in the same location likewise where an existing air compressor unit chiller andor evaporator is being replaced the replacement unit is allowed to be installed in the preexisting location but may not be increased in size or height without meeting the other provisions of this section  91492   6898 b swimming pools available historical data a23   62865 cross reference swimming pools  5148 county creation and duties of orange county pollution control board  241 et seq orange county vi exceptions to height regulations the height limitations contained in the schedule of district regulations do not apply to spires belfries cupolas antennas water tanks ventilators chimneys or other appurtenances required to be placed on the roof and not intended for human occupancy this exception however does not allow penthouses mechanical or equipment room or air conditioning equipment to exceed the height limits  however the heights of these structures or appurtenances thereto shall not exceed any height limitations prescribed by the federal aviation agency if they are within the flightapproach zone of airports with regard to the height of earth stations the height limitations contained in the schedule of district regulations shall be superseded by section 215 xv of this chapter vii buildings to have access every building hereafter erected or moved shall be on a lot adjacent to a public street or with access to an approved private street and all structures shall be so located on lots as to provide safe and convenient access for servicing fire protection other emergency vehicles and required offstreet parking no dwelling shall be erected on a lot or portion of a lot which does not abut on at least one 1 public street or approved private street for at least twenty 20 feet viii parking storage or use of major recreational equipment for purposes of this zoning code major recreational equipment is defined as including boats houseboats trailers pickup campers or coaches designed to be mounted on automotive vehicles motor homes tent trailers cases or boxes used for transporting recreational equipment whether occupied by such equipment or not airplanes gliders and the like and similar vehicles or items a houseboat is defined as a barge or dwelling supported on the water by floats whether or not it includes a motor fitted for use as a dwelling or for leisurely cruising the parking of any major recreational equipment exceeding one hundred two 102 inches in width is prohibited in a residentially zoned district likewise the parking or storage of any airplane glider or houseboat regardless of size is prohibited in any residentially zoned district the parking prohibition in the above paragraph shall also be applicable to any major recreational equipment unless it complies with one 1 of the following 1 a boat is permitted to be docked in the water or in a boathouse or launch attached to a waterway a boat trailer is permitted to be parked on a launch attached to a waterway 2 any major recreational equipment may be parked or stored entirely within a garage or carport  or 3 any major recreational equipment currently registered in accordance with florida state law with a valid tag attached to equipment other than a boat and a valid sticker attached to a boat  and a if it is a boat greater than two hundred 200 pounds it must be operational and parked on a trailer on a paved or hardpacked driveway at least fifteen 15 feet from the edge of the pavement or road if unpaved  or b if other than a boat it must be parked behind the nearest portion of a building to the street  boats may be parked behind the nearest portion of a building to the street nevertheless any major recreational equipment may be parked anywhere on a residential premises for not to exceed fortyeight 48 hours during any given week while loading or unloading no such equipment shall be used for living sleeping or housekeeping purposes when parked or stored on a residential lot or in any location not approved for such use any major recreational equipment under twentyfour 24 feet in length that are used daily as a private passenger vehicle by a resident of the property are exempt from the provisions of this parking prohibition except that they must be parked at least fifteen 15 feet from the edge of the pavement or road if unpaved cross reference traffic generally ch 18 ix parking and storage of certain vehicles automotive vehicles or trailers of any kind or type which are not operable or are not properly licensed and registered shall not be parked or stored on any residentially zoned property other than in a completely enclosed building x mobile homes temporary structures and model homes a mobile home trailer or temporary structure may be used as a temporary construction office or shelter for materials or tools but not for residential purposes incident to construction on or development of the premises on which the same is located  such use shall be strictly limited to the time construction or development is actively under way in no event however shall the use continue more than six 6 months without the approval of the planning and zoning commission the planning and zoning commission shall under no circumstances grant a time extension unless an active permit is in force and the time extension does not exceed an additional six 6 months a modular home or home may be used only for office and sales purposes in an undeveloped subdivision where more than five 5 acres or ten 10 residential lots have been approved subdivision process and the subdivision comprises one hundred 100 per cent of the lots with access to the individual streets where direct access is to be obtained no existing homes in a subdivision or unplatted parcel with direct access to the same street as subdivision furthermore the modular home or home used as a temporary sales or office structure must not be located on a lot abutting an existing singlefamily residence in an adjacent developed subdivision or unplatted area finally the modular home or home used as a temporary structure as an office or sales use must meet the following criteria a that all model homes andor sales offices are maintained in a neat and orderly fashion at all times  b that such models or sales offices shall not be used for the purpose of negotiating or consummating sales concerning areas outside the subdivision  c that four 4 parking spaces onsite are provided for the sales or office structure  d that the structure complies with all building code requirements for utilities handicapped accessibility ability to withstand hurricaneforce winds and all other applicable regulations  e that only one 1 sales office is maintained in the office or sales structure  f that only one 1 sign pole or wall mounted and not to exceed four 4 square feet and no higher than five 5 feet above the ground shall be permitted on the same lot as the office or sales structure  g that the modular sales office is placed on a foundation  is painted or has a stained wooden exterior  has wooden skirting between the floor of the office and the ground on all sides  has a driveway and parking area of wooden mulch or rock  and landscaping between the parking area and the street consistent with the city landscaping code  h any model home must obtain a certificate of occupancy before a sales or office use may be initiated  i the office or sales use may occupy either the garage or part of the first floor of living area of the model home the total space used for office and sales purposes in a model home when part of the first floor of living area is being used may not exceed twenty 20 percent of the first floor living area exclusive of the area of any open porch or attached garage or similar space not suited or intended for occupancy as living quarters  and j the hours of operation for the sales office use shall be limited to between  am and  pm to obtain approval for the office and sales use the applicant must submit a written request for site plan review approval to the city zoning administrator at the time of final subdivision plat application within thirty 30 days of the effective date of annexation into the city or within sixty 60 days of the effective date of this chapter the application requirements shall be modified to exclude the analysis for transportation impacts if the subdivision application includes the additional analysis for the sales office use approval for modular homes as a sales or office use is limited to twelve 12 months with an extension of up to six 6 months permitted by the planning and zoning commission model homes may be permitted for a period not to exceed one 1 month for every two 2 homes approved in the subdivision with an extension of up to six 6 months permitted by the planning and zoning commission likewise should the use or structure at any time fail to meet one or more of the criteria stated in this section or any other applicable regulation the approval for the use shall be rescinded and the modular home removed or the model home use ceased xi yard encroachments every part of every required yard shall be open and unobstructed from the ground to the sky except as hereinafter provided or as otherwise permitted by this zoning code a sills may project not over twelve 12 inches into a required yard b chimneys fire places pilasters cornices and buttresses may project not over two 2 feet into a required yard c eaves may project not over three 3 feet into a required yard d fire escapes stairways and balconies shall not intrude into a required yard e except as provided in section 215ii nothing in this section shall be so construed as to prevent any type of landscaping or nonprofit gardening on any lot xii automobile service stations the following regulations shall apply to the location design construction operation and maintenance of automobile service stations and supplement all applicable city county and state requirements a an automobile service station lot shall be of adequate width and depth to meet all setback requirements but in no case shall a corner lot have less than one hundred fifty 150 feet of frontage on each street side and an interior lot shall have a minimum width of one hundred fifty 150 feet for lots with existing automobile service stations and which lots do not meet this requirement as of  redevelopment or expansion of an existing automobile service station shall be considered as a permitted conditional use for the property as part of the permitted conditional use process the city may require additional standards and improvements to ensure traffic safety and neighborhood quality b all lights and lighting on a filling station shall be so designed and arranged that no lighting shall illuminate any portion of neighboring residential lots c no gasoline pump shall be located within fifteen 15 feet of any street rightofway line  where a street setback line has been established no gasoline pump shall be located within fifteen 15 feet of such setback line d uses permissible at an automobile service station do not include body work straightening of frames or body parts painting or welding xiii alcoholic beverages the following regulation shall apply to the issuance of liquor licenses within the city a  location requirements  no vendor applying for an alcoholic beverage license for the sale of liquor as defined in the florida statutes for onpremises consumption shall be approved in any location that is within seven hundred and fifty feet 750 of any location for which any other such license has already been issued and is in force  or within one thousand feet 1000 of any established school or church all distances shall be measured from the nearest points of lot boundaries the provisions of this section shall not apply to those locations for which a license has already been issued and is still in force as of the date of adoption of this chapter the distance separation provisions of this section shall not apply to restaurant uses within nor when measured from applicable restaurant uses in the downtown maitland area as referenced on the future land use map seriesmap 1 of the 20012020 city of maitland comprehensive development plan as may be amended from time to time such restaurant shall have at least 51 percent of its gross revenue from the sale of food and nonalcoholic beverages and no liquor shall be sold after the hours of serving food have elapsed the consumption of liquor exterior to the restaurant in an area such as a patio shall be screened from view of educational institutions public or private and places of worship and religious institutions the visual screen shall be subject to the administrative site plan review process as outlined in of the city may include enhanced landscape buffers fencing and additional features to provide a visual barrier to the view corridors of the affected educational institutions and religious institutions and places of worship b violation of state law a violation of this subsection each and every violation of the laws of the state relating to the sale of alcoholic beverages is hereby specifically made a violation of this subsection and subject to the same penalties as provided by state law with the same force and effect as if the provisions of the laws were fully set forth herein cross reference similar provisions  31 32 xiv setback lines for the purpose of future street widening setback lines are established for certain streets as set out in this section all yards required by this zoning code shall be measured from such setback lines where no yard requirements are set out for a zoning district no portion of a structure appurtenances thereto sign canopy or parking area shall intrude streetward beyond the setback line except as specifically set out in this zoning code in addition there shall be no setback imposed for that portion of swoope avenue south of horatio avenue a in all commercial and industrial districts no building or other structure shall be erected within thirtyfive 35 feet of the centerline of any street where a greater setback has not been established as set out below or as established in the maitland west side standards section 231 there shall be no setback imposed for that portion of george avenue located between maitland avenue and us highway 17 and 92 in addition there shall be no setback imposed for that portion of swoope avenue south of horatio avenue b for orlando avenue us highways 17 and 92 park avenue and lake avenue the street line of reference maps as prepared by michaels engineering co of orlando florida and dated  are adopted by reference as part of this zoning code setback distances from street lines of reference shall be as follows 1 orlando avenue us highway 17 and 92 sixtyeight 68 feet 2 park avenue thirtyfive 35 feet 3 lake avenue forty 40 feet 4 maitland boulevard one hundred 100 feet except freestanding signs are permitted between the property line and setback line provided 1 other sign requirements are met  2 the owner is responsible for replacement costs should future widening be necessary  3 the signs permitted within the setback area are placed a minimum of twenty 20 feet inside the front property line  4 the signs do not exceed ten 10 feet in height as measured from the grade at the curb  5 the signs are not internally lit  and 6 the signs do not exceed a total of fifty 50 square feet in size for copy area 5 wymore road fortyfive 45 feet c in commercial and industrial districts offstreet parking is permitted in the area between the street line and the setback line  provided that 1 such offstreet parking shall not be counted in meeting the minimum offstreet parking requirements set out in the schedule of district regulations 2 the parking shall be so arranged as not to cause hazard to pedestrian or automotive traffic and 3 the district is not located within maitland west side xv satellite dishes unless otherwise provided for herein a satellite dish is a structure which shall be an accessory use to the primary or principal use upon a lot the following regulations shall apply to the location height design construction operation maintenance and existence of satellite dishes a permit required every person intending to install or materially reconstruct a satellite dish shall apply for a building permit from the city prior to the installation or commencement of work on said satellite dish b development standards all satellite dishes shall be located designed constructed treated and maintained in accordance with the following standards 1 location a residential districts in residential zoning districts no satellite dish shall be located on any lot closer to any public or private street than the rear of any principal structure on said lot further no satellite dish shall be located closer than fifteen 15 feet to any property line and may not be mounted or connected to any building all measurements shall be the horizontal distance between a property line and the nearest point of the dish antenna when actuated to its most horizontal position b nonresidential districts in nonresidential zoning districts no satellite dish shall be located on any lot closer to any public or private street than the nearest portion of any principal structure to the street further no satellite dish shall be located in any required yard all satellite dishes shall be placed at ground level  structures three 3 stories in height or greater however may mount a satellite dish on the roof provided it is largely obscured from view 2 aesthetics satellite dishes must be screened addition of architectural features or landscaping that is compatible and in harmony with the elements and characteristics of the lot upon which the satellite dish is located and more importantly with immediately adjacent lots and the neighborhood in which the satellite dish is to be located all satellite dishes shall be either black or a shade of green that blends with surrounding green landscaping or painted in a corresponding color so as to blend in with the surrounding vegetation or buildings no satellite dish shall be constructed without appropriate landscape or masonry screening so as to conceal said satellite dish from the view of any person from1 any public or private street  2 a public rightofway  or 3 adjoining lot except as stated herein placement of masonry or landscape forms of screening may be waived or reduced if the applicant can demonstrate to the city that to require screening as set forth herein would interfere with the reception of communications signals from orbiting satellites by the satellite dish in such instances the screening requirements may be waived or reduced but only to the extent that reception of communications signals is interfered by the screening requirements 3 satellite dish height  dish diameter a in residential zoning districts a satellite dish shall not exceed a height of seven 7 feet with the height measured from the ground to the nearest point of the dish antenna when actuated to its most horizontal position the maximum diameter permitted for any satellite dish shall be ten 10 feet b in nonresidential zoning districts a satellite dish shall not exceed a height of fourteen 14 feet the maximum diameter permitted for any satellite dish shall be thirteen 13 feet 4 limit on number of satellite dishes a in residential districts only one 1 such satellite dish shall be permitted on any lot in the city b in multifamily residential or any nonresidential zoning district more than one 1 satellite dish is permitted on any lot provided the said dishes are less than three 3 feet in diameter and less than four 4 feet in height for dishes larger than three 3 feet in diameter more than one 1 satellite dish may be approved by the planning and zoning commission in accordance with a modified site plan review process with application materials subject to the approval of the community development director before approval for multiple dishes may be granted it must be proven that 1 there is a need for more than one 1 dish to serve a commercial office or multifamily use 2 each such satellite dish shall be actively and electronically connected on a continuous basis for use as a receiver or transmitter of electronic signals 3 no satellite dish shall be linked physically or electronically to a receiver which is not located on the same lot as is the satellite dish except as approved site plan review process 4 said satellite dish must be adequately buffered from view as provided in section 215xvb2 5 the public health safety welfare interest and aesthetics will be adequately protected and not adversely affected by the installation of said satellite dish 6 conditions of approval may be imposed to mitigate any negative impact from the installation of the satellite dish the cost of such condition to the applicant shall be considered coequally with the public benefit to be deprived from said condition 5 mobile or portable satellite dishes for the purpose of this section a mobile satellite dish is any satellite dish that is mounted on wheels as used in this section portable satellite dish is any satellite dish not permanently attached to the ground and that may be carried or moved about mobile satellite dishes are included within the definition or portable satellite dishes portable satellite dishes shall comply with the provisions of section 215xvb6 no portable satellite dish shall be permitted within the city until a portable satellite dish permit has been obtained from the city written application shall be made to the building official and shall at a minimum include the name address and telephone listing of the lot owner the legal entity and individual in charge of or responsible for the portable satellite dish  identifying serial number or insignia of the portable satellite dish  time at which the portable satellite dish will first be placed upon the lot  and any other information which the city manager shall determine is required to be furnished to clarify the application or protect the health and safety of the citizens of maitland said portable satellite dish permit shall be valid for a period of twentyfour 24 hours which time period shall commence as of the hour at which the applicant intends to place the portable satellite dish on the property all as specified in the application form no portable satellite dish permit shall be issued for permission to install a portable satellite dish on any lot more than once in any calendar month no portable satellite dish permit shall be issued if a notice of any report made by the united states of america national weather service or its successor agency that a hurricane or other form of inclement weather having hurricane force winds or higher has been issued which might strike orange or seminole county 6 signs any satellite dish having symbols numbers or letters larger than one 1 inch in size thereon shall be subject to the sign regulations in the city of maitland city xvi drivelocated in the downtown maitland special district  within the downtown maitland special district area driveshall only be allowed as conditional uses approved use review and shall meet the following standards a purpose the purpose of the driveare to  ensure pedestrian safety  minimize impact upon neighboring residential uses  minimize environmental degradation including air noise and light pollution  fit the desired urban form  feature architectural consistency  minimize effects of ingressegress on moving traffic and pedestrians b location of drivedriveservice bays and windows shall not be visible from the public street c site design to ensure pedestrian safety the following standards shall be applied 1 access to driveshould be provided from side streets or existing service drives 2 drivethe area where vehicles stack up and wait for service shall be clearly marked on the site plan and striped 3 driveshould be integrated with the onsite circulation pattern and must be designed with pedestrian safety as the first priority 4 driveshall not be entered from or provide exit directly into a public rightofway the entrance to a driveshall be clearly marked and be located a minimum of 60 feet from the closest public rightofway 5 driveshall be designed so that pedestrians do not have to cross the stacking lane unless said stacking lanes are to be designed with a pedestrian crossing that is delineated by landscaping curbing and raised or decorative pavement to clearly delineate the pedestrian network 6 no more than two 2 driveshould be approved for any single facility 7 there shall be a minimum of four 4 stacking spaces per lane the spaces shall be minimum of twenty 20 feet in length and ten 10 feet in width except along curved segments where they shall be a minimum of twelve 12 feet in width 8 driveshall be located out of view from public streets at the rear or sides of the principal building 9 drivelanes shall be designed in a way that customers can exit the lane at any time before the drive10 drivedesignated bypass lanes if used shall not interfere with required loading and trash storage areas 11 no driveshall be approved with ingress or egress driveways within three hundred 300 feet of a signalized intersection unless a traffic analysis demonstrates that vehicles entering or leaving will not impair the efficiency or operation of the intersection the traffic analysis shall be approved by the citys traffic engineer and acceptable to the city in the citys sole discretion 12 the number and width of curb cuts from the public streets shall be approved by the citys traffic engineer and said number shall be minimized to reduce interruptions of pedestrian flow on the public sidewalk 13 no driveshall be approved within the geographic area bounded by highway 1792 on the east maitland avenue on the west horatio avenue on the north and packwood avenue on the south except by the city council and only if the driveis integrated into the overall project design and meets the intent of ensuring safe traffic circulation per section 23 and pedestrian activity and safety in the downtown 14 no drivein or driveor carwash facilities shall be permitted in the packwood district of the downtown maitland area as defined herein see attachment acra district map d impact on adjacent uses to minimize impact of driveon adjacent uses the following standards shall be met 1 to reduce the impact of noise and pollution drivewith windows and speakers shall not be located within one hundred 100 feet from any lot zoned for residential use 3 the sound coming out of the driveshall not exceed sixty 60 dba measured at adjacent residentially zoned lots 4 privacy walls landscaping or other mitigation measures may be required as necessary e building massing and design driveshall be designed to enhance and improve the visual presentation of principal buildings design and be compatible with the pedestrian scale of its surroundings 1 the design of drivewhether attached to or detached from the principal structure shall be compatible with the style materials and scale with the principal building 2 the provision of an exterior canopy or awning at the service window is encouraged 3 exterior driveshall have a design consistent with the architectural detail design elements and roof design of the primary structure f landscaping and buffering standards the design of drivethat are stand alone and not an integral part of the principal structure shall meet the requirements of the maitland landscape g conditional use review in addition to the requirements of of the city applications for drive shall meet the following criteria 1 purpose and intent the proposed drive is consistent with the purpose and intent of the downtown maitland redevelopment plan in particular the proposed use will need to be consistent with the character of the individual character districts identified in the plan 2 compatibility the proposed use as designed is compatible with the surrounding uses and the general desired character of the area height bulk scale intensity traffic noise drainage lighting and appearance 3 site parameters the site must be adequate in size and shape to accommodate the proposed use while meeting the parameters set forth herein 4 traffic the design and location of the facility will not contribute to increased congestion on public or private streets or alleys adjacent to the subject property traffic overflow from the stacking lane shall not spill out onto public streets or major aisles of any parking lot no ingress and egress points shall conflict with turning movements of street intersections 5 environment the design and location of the facility shall not in the discretion of the city manager or his designee unreasonably contribute to air pollution noise pollution and light pollution for the adjacent properties the applicant may at their own cost present expert reports in support of their application 6 additional criteria the city may impose additional requirements to ensure that any potential adverse effects will be mitigated xvii front yard parking on singlefamily and duplex lots parking of any motor vehicle wherein any portion of the motor vehicle is within the front yard on a singlefamily or duplex lot shall only be permitted upon a paved parking area as depicted on an approved site plan for the purpose of front yard parking a paved parking area means a legally permitted area by the city of maitland located adjacent to a curb cut providing vehicular access between a street and an offstreet parking area constructed of a nonerodible surface such as asphalt concrete pavers or four 4 inches of gravel with permanent border b motor vehicle means an automobile motorcycle truck trailer semitrailer truck tractor and semitrailer combination or any other vehicle operated on the roads of this state used to transport persons or property and propelled by power other than muscular power but the term does not include traction engines road rollers such vehicles run only upon a track bicycles or mopeds c for the purpose of this section front yard shall mean that part of a lot between the nearest wall of the residence and an adjoining street and shall extend the full width of the lot along the adjoining street d for the purpose of this section residence shall mean that portion of the principle structure that is fully enclosed as habitable space e for singlefamily and duplex dwelling units constructed prior to  without a paved parking area front yard vehicle parking shall only be allowed on an area defined by the community development department after application with proposed site plan by the residence owner the community development department shall approve the application if it defines an area appropriate for paved parking including nonpervious and other restrictions f where a singlefamily or duplex dwelling unit is without a paved parking area sufficient to contain two 2 standard fourwheeled automobiles frontyard parking of motor vehicles immediately adjacent to the paved parking area is permitted g in no instance shall frontyard parking be permitted on or over any portion of a public sidewalk or any water meter  112690   2 42291   3 71392   91492   91492   22894   112894   121294   121294   32795   12296   6898   8999   32700   52404   91304   12405   62705  no standards contained herein shall prevail b flexibility in design standards administrative deviations from the dimensional standards contained in this section may be requested per section 2322 no deviations from the density or intensity regulations may be considered c development density and intensity sites within the downtown maitland zoning district shall meet the following density and intensity requirements for the purpose of calculating density andor intensity within the downtown core area as defined in the comprehensive development plan a single development site may be on different sides of independence lane within the same block as long as all other eg height open space pervious area etc with or without approved incentives are met on each building site within the development site and conditional use approval is obtained matrix 2downtown maitland district requirements parcel size acres maximum site far maximum residential density maximum site far   <05 030 198 unit per acre 05  <200 120 36 unit per acre 200  <300 140 45 unit per acre 300+ 200 55 unit per acre unit per acre   dwelling unit per acre d minimum living area residential units shall have a minimum living area of five hundred 500 square feet e building height 1 buildings shall not exceed five 5 stories in height 2 the minimum required building height for buildings within the downtown core as defined in the comprehensive development plan shall be two 2 stories all other buildings may have a single story but a minimum building height of twentythree 23 feet building additions of less than two thousand 2000 square feet in the dmzd shall be exempt from this provision 3 for the purpose of this section building height shall be measured in stories however to ensure adequate floortoceiling height the ground floor of nonresidential uses shall have a minimum clear height measured from slab to slab of fourteen 14 feet other floors shall have a minimum clear height of nine 9 feet 4 compliance to floor height regulations shall only apply to new buildings or where the applicant is already proposing to modify the floor height of an existing building 5 roof structures above eave line can vary in height up to a maximum of fifteen 15 feet above eave line roof appurtenances are exempt from height regulations as provided in section 215vi 6 buildings shall provide a horizontal step back along the street to ensure that multiple storied building facades do not overwhelm the pedestrian orientation and scale of the downtown therefore all stories above the fourth story shall be stepped back a minimum of an additional ten 10 feet from the buildtoline or edge of arcadegallery if one 1 is provided this provision does not prevent developers from using step backs on other floors or along other streets as long as the step backs are only applied above the second story refer to section 216iif6 for compatibility standards adjacent to residential uses f setbacks 1 new development and redevelopment shall meet the following building setbacks for the purpose of this section front refers to all sides of the site facing a public rightofway and shall be measured from the edge of the sidewalk as shown in section 23 please refer to section 2324 to identify the street type  street type i eight 8 feet required buildtoline for block frontage continuity  street type ii eight 8 feet required buildtoline for block frontage continuity  street type iii eight 8 feet minimum to twenty 20 feet maximum note minor insets at the buildtoline of up to eight 8 feet in depth are permitted for the purpose of providing facade articulation and architectural interest  the insets added together shall not exceed fifty 50 percent of the length of the facade 2 whenever an arcade is proposed along the front of a building such arcade and floors above may under certain conditions extend in front of the buildtoline as provided for in sections 23 and 23 an arcade may extend over a sidewalk easement area for use for the public but in no event shall extend over public property the city and property owner shall execute an easement and maintenance agreement to address requirements necessary to protect the city and the public regarding use of the easement area 3 should the required setbackbuildtoline fall within a fdot rightofway it shall be shifted to the property line instead 4 see section 23 for development allowed within the setbackactivity area 5 except as provided in subsection iif6 and section 23e there shall be no minimum side or rear yard setbacks required however if a zero 0 foot side setback is not proposed there shall be a minimum ten 10 foot separation between the buildings on adjacent sites for fire safety there is a seven and onehalf 75 foot minimum building setback required from the railroad rightofway for maintenance 6 nonresidential and multifamily developments abutting a residential zoning district shall comply with the following requirements a buildings with three 3 stories or more in height on property abutting a residentially zoned district unless abutting a railroad rightofway shall provide an additional building setback of ten 10 feet for each floor above the equivalent of two 2 stories for that portion of the building facing the residential area developers may elect to apply the setback to the entire facade or just to those floors above the second story b nonresidential delivery and loading areas dumpsters and mechanical equipment shall be located away from property lines abutting residential areas see design requirements in section 23 c the planning and zoning commission and the city council may impose setbacks step backs andor perimeter buffer requirements in excess of the minimum required in other parts of this code to protect the privacy of existing abutting residentially zoned areas g open space development within the downtown maitland zoning district shall provide a minimum of fifteen 15 percent open space if after meeting the landscape requirements on the site the applicant is unable to provide the minimum required open space due to site constraints heshe may apply to the city to usecontribute to such community open space system as the city may establish from time to time or a private facility see section 23 for applicationapproval requirements h pervious area development within the downtown maitland zoning district shall provide a minimum of twenty 20 percent pervious area if after meeting the landscape requirements on the site the applicant is unable to provide the minimum required pervious area heshe may apply to the city to usecontribute to a common pervious space system as the city may establish from time to time or a private facility see section  for applicationapproval requirements i for properties with frontage on maitland avenue within the cultural corridor district except front yards on horatio avenue and lake sybelia drive the required front yard from the back edge of curb shall be as follows for a development with proposed onstreet parking the required front yard for the building shall include a 2foot transition zone and a 6foot sidewalk area for a total distance of 8 feet maximum from the back edge of curb areas for consideration of onstreet parking shall be as indicated on the typical sections of maitland avenue in the cultural corridor which are adopted as part of this ordinance all onstreet parking stalls shall be a minimum of 8 feet wide and 25 feet long the maximum length of consecutive parking stalls shall be a total length of 75 feet and shall have a planter island located at the terminus of each parking row street trees shall be planted in the planter islands to allow for sufficient area to create a maximum of three parking stalls between planter islands and spaced at a maximum distance of 81 feet where no onstreet parking is proposed the maximum required front yard for the building shall include a 2foot transition zone a 6foot sidewalk area and an 8foot parkway for a total distance of 16 feet from the back edge of curb typical sections for areas where no onstreet parking are proposed shall be as indicated on the typical sections of maitland avenue in the cultural corridor which are adopted as part of this ordinance street trees shall be planted within the 8 foot parkway and spaced at a maximum distance of 50 feet in all cases street trees shall provide a minimum clearance of 134 as they overhang a street in no case shall these design requirements permit a building to be located on the rightofway or within an easement should implementation of these design standards cause onstreet parking sidewalk or parkway placement to occur on private property rightofway dedication or easement dedication shall be required for purposes of this section of the zoning code back edge of curb shall be defined as the back edge of the existing curb on maitland avenue as well as existing curb on side streets in the areas affected by this zoning amendment should a curb not exist on a side street then the back edge of pavement shall be utilized in the same manner as the back edge of curb should redevelopment of a site occur in an area where a curb does not exist installation of a curb shall be required consistent with the streetscape design standard typical sections which are adopted as part of this ordinance parking lots and retention ponds shall be located to the side and rear of the properties to allow for placement of the building in such locations as to define the street edge 13 for lots with substandard width in adjacent or nearby residential properties shall meet the requirements of of the maitland ordinances except that no sign shall exceed five 5 feet in height measured from top of the sign to the ground architectural elements may be utilized on the face of the building to enhance building identity but shall not include wording and shall be neutral and noncontrasting color signage and architectural elements shall be generally consistent with the architectural character of the building it serves shall be residential in scale and character and compatible with surrounding residential properties such signage shall be subject to review and approval by the planning and zoning commission and the maitland city council no neon internally lit flashing motion animated changing or pole signs are permitted 3 hours of operation for the residentialscale retail and personal service uses shall be compatible with the residential character of the neighborhood but shall not extend beyond the hours of 7 am12 am unless otherwise approved by the city 4 performance standards shall ensure conformity and compatibility with surrounding uses and shall also include the following regulations concerning lighting noise vibration odor buffering etc a lighting project lighting shall adhere to the lighting regulations of the city of maitland lighting criteria shall include 1 a photometrics plan shall be submitted at the site plan approval stage 2 use of sharp cutoff type fixtures or dark skiestype lighting shall be provided to limit spread of light in outdoorparking areas and to minimize lighting spill over onto adjoining parcels  3 lighting on buildings shall incorporate wallpack type fixtures that direct light to the ground 4 light placement shall incorporate ceptd guidelines and standards to enhance safety b noise the project shall be designed to adhere to the applicable noisesound regulations of the city of maitland noise control shall include but not be limited to noise attenuation for equipment such as shielding of ac units and compressors  limiting nonresidential truck deliveries to certain hours  am to  pm unless otherwise approved by the city  controlling outdoor music provided at sitdown restaurants or similar uses to conform to city of maitland noise regulations and controlling  hours of operation to be compatible with surrounding uses and with the residential character of the neighborhood c vibrations the proposed project is to be a multifamily andor officeuse with support retail and commercial no storage or heavy equipment use or materials handling or related activities that would create vibrations out of character with the residential portions of the project to occur onsite d odor no activities shall be permitted that would create a consistent pattern of odor production that is incompatible with the residential character of the district including the emission of pollutants and offensive fumes or gases e buffering the proposed project shall at a minimum adhere to the city of maitlands landscape including buffering between adjacent uses and properties and internal uses 5 development on the site shall adhere to residential scale retail uses and service uses defined in section 2123 definitions of the maitland city elements of residential scale and character listed in section 2124 shall also be followed 6 projects within this zoning category may undergo the planned development pd process and depending on the character magnitude and location of the specific project the city may elect to apply development standards that ensure an application for permitted conditional use for a pharmacydrugstore may be approved approved with conditions or denied in addition to all other requirements and conditions the application shall comply with the following standards contained herein no permitted conditional use for a pharmacydrugstore shall be permitted unless the application has shown evidence its ability to comply with the following use specific criteria 1 pharmacydrugstore shall be licensed by the state of florida prior to operating 2 pharmacydrugstore shall not be located within five hundred feet 500 of the real property that comprises a public or private elementary middle or secondary school unless approved by the city formal public hearing process and the city determines that the location promotes the public health safety and general welfare of the community 3 pharmacydrugstore shall not be located closer than one thousand two hundred fifty feet 1250 of the real property that comprises an actively operating pharmacydrugstore unless approved by the city formal public hearing process and the city determines that the location promotes the public health safety and general welfare of the community 4
