office residential commercial district morc and derived from  112690   2 7891   111014    82718  a  cultural corridor district cc i general purpose and intent the cultural corridor district is established to implement the citys comprehensive plan which establishes the boundaries for the cultural corridor as a special district on the future land use map the district is intended to encourage a reasonable mix of cultural and ancillary uses with uniform design guidelines provided existing residential areas are preserved the regulations outlined in this district will attempt to encourage an appropriate mixture of culturalart historical municipal commercial office recreational and residential uses within the corridor boundaries emphasis in this area is placed on the compatibility of the uses and uniformity of site development regulated by vegetated landscape buffers enhanced pedestrian features sign regulations and design standards for curb cuts as well as consistency with other city regulations governing development any change of use or any structural changes resulting in a net increase in square footage will be required to submit an application for site plan review subject to a planning and zoning commission decision consistent with ii permitted principal uses and structures a neighborhood or miniparks b bird sanctuary c educational institutions public or private the location of any such institution after the effective date shall not preclude the ability of establishments selling liquor as defined in the florida statutes for onpremise consumption from locating within one thousand 1000 feet of an educational institution public or private subject to all other city d art gallery library museum and other similar cultural facilities e local government facility f places of worship religious institutions the location of any such institution after the effective date of shall not preclude the ability of establishments selling liquor as defined in the florida statutes for onpremise consumption from locating within one thousand 1000 feet of a place of worship or religious institution subject to all other city g community center h parking lot and transit uses i performance and film theaters j arts and crafts studios and shops and performing art studios in addition to a j above property which does not abut a residential land use district has no frontage on maitland avenue and which is within five hundred 500 feet of maitland avenue may have the following k professional and business offices including medical and dental clinics in addition to a k above property which does not abut a residential land use district and which has frontage on maitland avenue may have the following l coffee shops ice cream shops delicatessens and similar eating establishments but not drivein establishments m retail establishments cultural support facilities for wearing apparel and accessories toys sundries and notions books and stationery coins stamps jewelry including watch repair but not pawnshops art or antiques cameras or photographic supplies musical instruments florist or gift shop art and craft supplies and similar products n interior decorator or interior design studio including sale of related products incidental to design o travel agencies and financial institutions procedures and uses for the cultural corridor zoning district supersede any other procedures or uses outlined in this including those specified in section 2120 floating zones publicsemipublic uses the above uses are subject to the following limitations a sale preparation and storage shall be conducted within a completely enclosed building with allowances for the consumption of food and beverage items and minimal display of merchandise outside of the building  provided that such activity does not encroach public rightofway no more than twentyfive 25 percent of the enclosed floor space shall be devoted to storage b products shall be sold only at retail c each allowable eating establishment shall be limited to two thousand five hundred 2500 square feet in size iii minimum design guidelines the uses established in this section are required to meet the following minimum design guidelines a in addition to and above the requirements of the sign regulations no ground mounted or pole mounted sign shall exceed five 5 feet in height measured from the top of the sign to the ground or twentyfive 25 square feet in total area and shall be generally consistent with the architectural character of the building it serves no neon or internally lit signs are permitted total sign area for each site shall not exceed one 1 square foot for every linear foot of building facing the street all measurements for sign area shall be made from the outside perimeter of the sign structure b sidewalks both rightofway and internal and street trees shall be installed to be consistent with streetscape plan adopted in the cultural corridor master plan c lighting shall be installed so as not to create a glare on adjacent properties or streets and shall not exceed twenty 20 feet in height in addition adequate pedestrian lighting shall be provided for all internal pedestrian areas and all lighting including any groundmounted lighting and shall be uniform in style with the adopted lighting in the cultural corridor master plan d parking requirements for the cultural corridor zoning district  the parking requirements outlined in section 2122 of the city be reduced up to twenty 20 percent when a shared parking is established with another facility within five hundred 500 feet and where pedestrian access is provided  or b when a donor city parking facility is within five hundred 500 feet with pedestrian access  parking requirements outlined in section 2122 of the city be reduced by up to thirteen 13 percent for office use facilities that establish retailcultural service uses  parking requirements outlined in section 2122 of the city be reduced up to twenty 20 percent for bank properties converting to office or retailcultural service uses  up to ten 10 percent reduction in parking requirements as outlined in section 2122 of the city be granted for office and bank uses dedicating pedestrian easements consistent with the master plan  to help ensure that properties are brought up to design standards parking requirements may be allowed to be reduced by thirteen 13 to twenty 20 percent from the requirements established in section 2122 of the city a property owner makes the necessary site improvements to meet site design standards such as landscaping and streetscape improvements and to eliminate all nonconforming parking spaces and a sufficient public donor site is available to accommodate peak overflow periods the percentage range provides flexibility based on the proximity and size of donor parking facility and specific site conditions and property uses in order to qualify for any parking reduction all site design standards must be met e all applicable standards and regulations shall be met iv permitted accessory uses and structures permitted accessory uses and structures shall be uses and structures which a are customarily accessory and clearly incidental and subordinate to permitted or permissible uses and structures b are located on the same lot as the permitted or permissible use or structure or on a contiguous lot in the same ownership c do not involve operations or structures not in keeping with the character of this district d residential uses above the first floor on or first floors where gross square footage of residential use does not exceed twenty 20 percent of the gross floor area on site  and where living units have a minimum of five hundred 500 square feet v prohibited uses and structures prohibited uses and structures shall be a any use or structure not specifically provisionally or by reasonable implication permitted herein b warehousing or storage except in connection with a permitted or permissible use c offsite advertising d any use which is potentially dangerous noxious or offensive outside the property lines by reason of odor smoke noise glare fumes gas vibration threat of fire or explosion emission of particulate matter interference with radio or television reception radiation or likely for other reasons to be incompatible with the character of the comprehensive development plan for public and semipublic uses where infrastructure and traffic levels of service are adequate and where the use is compatible with surrounding uses then public or semipublic uses may be constructed according to design standards consistent with the citys comprehensive plan and regulations and consistent with any special criteria established to ensure compatibility with surrounding areas unlike other zones the uses are considered according to land use districts in the future land use map ii permitted principal use and structures a residential land use districts 1 neighborhood or miniparks 2 educational institutions public or private which have a gross square footage no greater than the minimum living area specifications according to the zoning district in which they are located where access is only to a local street or greater light does not spill over into residential areas and the property is not within one thousand 1000 feet of any established use for the sale of liquor as defined in the florida statutes for onpremises consumption of liquor 3 educational institutions public or private where access is only to collector street or greater light does not spill over into residential areas and the property is not within one thousand 1000 feet of any established use for the sale of liquor as defined in the florida statutes for onpremises consumption of liquor the distance separation provisions of this section shall not apply to uses within nor when measured from applicable uses in the downtown maitland area as referenced on process is required with final approval by the planning and zoning commission iii permitted accessory use and structures permitted accessory use and structures shall be a uses and structure which 1 contiguous lot in the same ownership  and 3 do not involve operations or structures not in keeping with the character of this district iv prohibited uses and structures prohibited uses and structures shall be a any use or structure which is not specifically provisionally or by reasonable implication permitted herein b nonmedical marijuana sales c cannabis farm v permitted conditional uses uses and structures which may be allowed permitted conditional use process a residential land use districts 1 community park 2 places of worship religious institutions where only access is collector road or greater classification roadway and the use is not within one thousand 1000 feet of any established use for the sale of liquor as defined in the florida statutes for onpremise consumption of liquor the distance separation provisions of this section shall not apply to uses within nor when measured from applicable uses in the downtown maitland area as referenced on the future land use map seriesmap 1 of the 20012020 city of maitland comprehensive development plan as may be amended from time to time where access is local street then the lot area for the entire development shall not exceed two hundred 200 percent of the minimum lot area for the respective zoning district 3 nursing home aclf extended care facility where density is consistent with zoning district 4 bird sanctuary 5 grief counseling center where the only access is roads or greater classification roadway and the minimum lot size is eighttenths 08 acres such center shall meet landscape buffer requirements which may be increased at the sole discretion of the city to adequately buffer adjacent residential properties buffers shall include a masonry wall compatible with the character of the adjacent residential property a minimum of six foot height adjacent to residential property architectural site plan and elevations together with photographs of adjacent residential uses shall be included for review of the city during the permitted conditional use application review process signage shall meet requirements of of the maitland ordinances except that no sign shall exceed five 5 feet in height measured from top of the sign to the ground architectural elements may be utilized on the face of the building to enhance building identity but shall not include wording and shall be a neutral and noncontrasting color signage and architectural elements shall be generally consistent with the architectural character of the building it serves shall be residential scale and character compatible with surrounding residential properties and are subject to review and approval by the planning and zoning commission and maitland city council no neon internally lit flashing motion animated changing or pole signs are permitted b nonresidential land use districts 1 community park 2 places of worship religious institutions not within one thousand 1000 feet of any established use for the sale of liquor as defined in the florida statutes for onpremise consumption of liquor the distance separation provisions of this section shall not apply to uses within nor when measured from applicable uses in the downtown facility 4 cemeteries memorial gardens crematoria 5 community center 6 county state or federal facility 7 hospital 8 institutional care facility 9 parking lot bus terminal and similar transit uses 10 college university vi design criteria a minimum lot area and lot width shall conform to the most stringent zoning district in which the proposed use is being developed or which it abuts b front side and rear yards shall conform to the requirements of the most stringent zoning district for each which the proposed use is being developed or abuts c maximum lot coverage permeable surface height and story requirements shall be consistent with the requirements of the applicable zoning district d all standards established by the comprehensive plan shall apply and be met by any proposed development the planned development process shall be required if the proposed development is greater than onehalf 12 acre in size and requests waiver of any service or design standards e where state agency design criteria are more stringent than the city requirement then these criteria may be required  112690   91304   121106   111014    82718  pd planned development district i generally it is the purpose of this district to permit planned developments which are intended a to encourage the development of land as planned communities and developments providing a variety of complementary and compatible residential commercial and industrial use or combination of uses b to allow diversification of uses structures and open spaces in a manner compatible with existing and permitted land use on abutting properties c to encourage flexible and creative concepts of site planning d to provide for an efficient use of land resulting in smaller networks of utilities and streets thereby lowering development and housing costs e to permit more effective adaptation of development to the natural soils vegetation and topography of an area f to preserve the natural amenities and environmental assets of the land by encouraging the preservation and improvement of scenic and functional open areas g to encourage an increase in the amount and useability of open space areas by permitting a more economical and concentrated use of building areas than would be possible subdivision practices h to insure that development will occur according to limitations of use design density coverage and phasing stipulated on an approved final development plan i to encourage large scale multipleuse planned developments which can aid the city in controlling the tempo and sequence of growth by maintaining a balance of land uses in conjunction with the growth of municipal facilities and services needed to serve the new population j to encourage economic viability within the packwood district of downtown maitland as the focal point of the downtown revitalization area including the citys town center the district is located generally from lake lily park north to sybelia avenue and is intended to create a pedestrianoriented mix of public and private spaces the combination of which will promote walkability and activation of the retail core area of the citys downtown k to revitalize the areas within the sawmill and waterhouse districts of downtown maitland as these districts serve as the northern and southern entries to downtown maitland and are intended to achieve the vision of an architecturally pleasing corridor with a mix of uses and safe walkable pedestrian access ii permitted uses each land use shall be complementary to and compatible with the project concept or theme for the total planned development district a residential units including singlefamily attached and detached dwellings towfamily dwellings and multiplefamily dwellings b churches schools community or club buildings and similar public and semipublic facilities c nonresidential uses including commercial or retail uses industrial uses offices clinics and professional uses provided the following criteria are met 1 the location is in appropriate relation to other land uses 2 the proposed uses are compatible with the goals and objectives of the citys comprehensive development plan iii development standards for planned development the development standards for planned development are as follows a relation to zoning districts an approved pd shall be considered to be a separate zoning district in which a final development plan approved for each phase establishes the restrictions regulations and district description according to which the development shall occur upon approval of the preliminary development plan the official zoning map shall be changed to indicate the area as pd each final development plan as approved by the city council shall be filed and maintained within the community development department with a copy to the building official b densityintensity the densityintensity based on gross residentialcommercial acreage permitted in each pd development shall be established by the city council upon recommendation of the planning and zoning commission the criteria for establishing the appropriate densityintensity includes existing surrounding densityintensity densityintensity permitted by the existing zoning classification adequacy of existing and proposed public facilities and services conformance with the adopted city comprehensive plan and site characteristics but in no case shall it exceed the maximum densityintensity of the most denseintense zoning district in the appropriate land use district c dimensional bulk and height restrictions the location of all proposed building sites shall be as shown on the final section plat or site plan subject to the minimum lot sizes setback lines lot coverage and minimum floor areas as specified in the final development plan as approved by the city council buildings or structures shall not exceed the floor area ratio established in the cdp d access and parking all streets and access ways shall be designed to effectively relate to the major transportation plan as shown in the comprehensive development plan of the city offstreet parking shall be provided for each land use as established by the offstreet parking regulations of the maitland ordinances and shall meet landscaping requirements as specified in the landscape ordinance for off street parking and other vehicular use areas established in the maitland ordinances vehicular access from individual lots or dwelling units onto public arterial or collector streets within or adjacent to the development is prohibited e perimeter requirements the city council following a recommendation of the planning and zoning commission may impose one 1 or both of the following requirements in order to protect the privacy of existing adjoining uses 1 structures parking lots buildings and streets located at the perimeter of the development shall be permanently screened in a manner which sufficiently protects the privacy and amenities of the adjacent existing uses 2 wide setbacks from the perimeter line may be imposed to protect privacy of adjacent existing uses f stormwater drainage systems provisions shall be made for onehundredpercent onsite drainage retentiondetention and special disposition of stormwater drainage when such drainage could substantially harm a natural body of water approval of selfcontained stormwater drainage systems shall adhere to the procedures outlined in the maitland ordinances g maitland west side design standards any exceptions to the maitland west side design standards including block configurations access standards pedestrian connection requirements and lot layout requirements shall be made exception process described in section 7581 h sawmill packwood and waterhouse districts within downtown maitland 1 consideration of petitions for pd zoning development projects including ground floor residential development within the sawmill packwood and waterhouse districts shall be subject to additional criteria provided in the maitland city planned development and section 2119b and section 232 downtown maitland special district the location of groundfloor residential uses within each district will be evaluated based upon compatibility with surrounding uses character of the surrounding areas street type road visibility street frontage access and the purpose and intent of each district 2 a livework unit is a single unit that is part of a pd zoning development project within these districts that consists of both a commercialoffice component and residential component occupied by the same resident a livework unit shall be considered a residential use only no livework unit or any portion of a livework unit shall be considered a commercial use in whole or in part however the commercialoffice component of the livework unit shall be restricted to uses consistent with those specified within the dmzd zoning district the livework unit shall be evaluated consistent with the criteria noted in h1 above  112690  exh a  5 102411   41116  offstreet parking and loading it is the intent of this zoning code that the public interest welfare and safety requires that every building and use erected or instituted after the effective date of this zoning code shall be provided with adequate offstreet parking facilities for the use of occupants employees visitors customers or patrons it is also the intent of this zoning code that the public interest welfare and safety require that certain uses provide adequate offstreet loading facilities such offstreet parking and offstreet loading facilities shall be maintained and continued so long as the main use continues 1 generally offstreet parking facilities shall be provided as set out herein required offstreet parking areas for three 3 or more automobiles shall have individual spaces marked and shall be so designed maintained and regulated that no parking or maneuvering incidental to parking shall be on any public street walk or alley and so that any automobile may be parked and unparked without moving another building existing as of the effective date of this zoning code may be modernized altered or repaired without providing additional offstreet parking or offstreet loading facilities providing there is no increase in floor area volume capacity or space occupied where a building or use existed as of the effective date of this zoning code and such building or use is enlarged in floor area volume capacity or space occupied offstreet parking and offstreet loading as herein specified shall be provided for the additional floor area volume capacity or space so created or used change in use of a building or use existing as of the effective date of this zoning code shall require additional offstreet parking and offstreet loading facilities to the extent that requirements for such facilities exceed the offstreet parking and offstreet loading requirements which would have been required for the previous use had the regulations of this zoning code been applicable thereto the required offstreet parking facilities shall be a identified as to purpose and location when not clearly evident b unless otherwise requested by the applicant and approved by the city manager surfaced with asphalt bituminous or concrete material and maintained in a smooth wellgrade condition singlefamily and twofamily residences are exempt from this requirement driveways access aisles and parking spaces for public and private schools offering academic courses and for churches may be surfaced with grass or lawn c drained so as not to cause any nuisance on adjacent property d so lighted if required or desired as to prevent glare or excessive light on adjacent property e arranged for convenient access and to minimize hazard to the safety of pedestrians and vehicles for this purpose the parking shall conform to the minimum standards as noted in the institute of transportation engineers ite transportation and traffic engineering handbook second edition or as may be amended from time to time all parking shall be a standard size nine 9 feet wide by eighteen 18 feet long with twentyfour 24 foot aisle widths is acceptable if ninety 90 degree stalls are proposed up to fifteen 15 percent of the spaces required by city regulations may be designed for compact vehicles minimum eight 8 feet wide by sixteen 16 feet long if designated appropriately on site f offstreet parking for individual uses shall either be consistent with the following offstreet parking requirements or an applicant may prepare and submit an alternative parking study using professionally accepted methods for review and approval by the development review committee rs1 and rs1a 3 spaces per dwelling unit rs2 rs3 uu rs4 rs5 rsd rg1 rg2 rg3 2 spaces per dwelling unit garage apartment in connection with a singlefamily residence 2 spaces per dwelling unit guest house 1 space church and other places of worship 1 space per 3 seats in an auditorium or chapel excluding classrooms elementary and junior high school 2 spaces per class room or office plus 1 space school per every 3 seats whether temporary or permanent in any auditorium gymnasium or cafeteria senior high school 02 spaces per student plus 1 space per employee business school tradevocational 1 space per every 2 seats plus 1 per employee or staff person businessprofessional office 1 space per 250 square feet of gross floor area medicaldental clinic office 1 space per 200 square feet of gross floor area child care center and kindergarten is greater theater 1 space per 2 seats prescription drugstore 1 space per 200 square feet of nonstorage area arts crafts dance music photographic studio 1 space per 300 square feet gross floor area establishment cemetery 1 space per 5000 square feet of lot area plus 1 per 3 seats in a chapel travel agency employment and newspaper office 1 space per 100 square feet nonstorage first floor plus 1 per 200 square feet nonstorage above the first floor banks financial institutions including credit unions 1 space per 200 square feet nonstorage first floor plus 1 per 250 square feet gross area above floor shopping centers 1 space per 200 square feet gross floor area bowling alley 6 spaces per lane privateclublodges 1 space per 100 square feet gross floor area warehousing storage use 1 space for every 2 employees plus 1 per 1000 square feet gross floor area government use 1 space per 100 square feet of nonstorage area tenant dwelling 2 spaces per dwelling unit group dwelling or lodging house dwelling unit within an office building 2 spaces per dwelling unit leasing office in connection with apartment rental 1 space per 250 square feet of gross floor area gymnasiumsportshealth club 5 spaces per 1000 square feet of gross floor area automobile service station 3 spaces per service bay 2 per gas pump plus 1 per 100 square feet of nonstorage space for convenience store function convenience store 1 space per 100 square feet of nonstorage area light manufacturing 3 spaces per 1000 square feet of gross floor area accessible parking and access ramps will be in accordance with federal and state regulations the required offstreet parking facilities shall be located on the same lot or parcel of land they are intended to serve  provided however that the development review committee may allow the establishment of such offstreet parking facilities within six hundred 600 feet of the lot or parcel they are intended to serve when practical difficulties prevent the placing of the facilities on the same lot as the premises they are designed to serve 2 offsite shared parking the owners or operators of parcels requiring offstreet parking facilities which are within six hundred 600 feet of each other may make collective provision for such facilities the development review committee may approve shared parking facilities for developments or uses with differing or nonoverlapping operating hours or different peak business periods or excess parking spaces if the shared parking complies with items a g below a required parking spaces reserved for accessible parking may not be located offsite b shared parking spaces must be located within 600 feet of the lot or parcel which they are intended to serve c required parking spaces reserved for persons who require accessibility shall meet all requirements of the americans with disabilities act accessibility guidelines adaag and of the florida building d those wishing to use shared parking as a means of satisfying offstreet parking requirements must submit a shared parking studyanalysis to the community development department that clearly demonstrates the feasibility of shared parking the studies must be provided in a form established by the community development department the analysis must address at a minimum the size and type of the proposed development the composition of tenants the anticipated rate of parking turnover and the anticipated peak parking and traffic loads for all uses that will be sharing offstreet parking spaces e a shared parking plan shall be enforced agreement among all owners of record and shall be subject to approval by the city the owners shall agree to bear the expense of recording the agreement and such agreement shall bind owners and their heirs successors and assigns an attested copy of the agreement between the owners of record shall be submitted to the community development department recordation of the agreement must take place before issuance of a building permit or certificate of occupancy for any use to be served by the shared parking area f when the uses or property subject to a shared parking agreement are proposed to change the community development director or designee shall have the authority to require a revised shared parking study and shall with the approval of the development review committee either revoke the shared parking agreement when it is determined that it is no longer necessary to meet the parking requirements of the uses or shall require a new shared parking agreement when the revised parking study indicates additional parking is required g the community development director or designee may reevaluate a parking agreement previously approved by the city under the following circumstances 1 expiration of the agreement  2 when there is proposed revision to the use or property that would require additional parking under the maitland city parking such as an increase in square footage of structuresbuildings affected by the agreement or increased seating or employee counts for restaurants  or 3 when there is a proposed revision to the use or property that would require less parking under the maitland city parking such as modifications to reduce seating area for restaurants or changes in use combined onsite parking onsite parking for the owners or operators of adjacent buildings or uses or uses within the same building requiring offstreet parking facilities may make collective provision for such facilities combined onsite parking provisions for a site or parcel may be reevaluated by the community development director or designee when there is proposed revision to the use or property that would require additional parking under the maitland city parking such as an increase in square footage of structuresbuildings affected by the agreement or increased seating or employee counts for restaurants such allocation for collective use must be supported by an analysis of expected parking patterns which must completely meet the expected demands consistent with the process outlined in offsite and shared parking and combined onsite parking of the maitland city 3 plans for offstreet parking required a plan shall be submitted with every application for a building permit for any building or use that is required to provide offstreet parking the plan shall accurately designate the required parking spaces access aisles and driveways and the relation of the offstreet parking facilities to the uses or structures such facilities are designed to serve 4 employee parking where offstreet parking facilities are specified on the basis of number of employees such parking shall be clearly marked and reserved for use of such employees where a use is required to provide and reserve a certain number of spaces for employees and the number of employees increases after the building is occupied then the amount of offstreet parking provided shall be increased in ratio to the increase to the number of employees 5 nonconforming use where major repairs alterations or extensions of a use are to be made in a building occupied by a nonconforming use no such repairs alterations or extensions shall be permitted unless and until full provisions for offstreet parking for a new use of the type involved are made for the new use as applicable to code requirements 6 offstreet loading  specifications amounts offstreet loading facilities are required by this zoning code so that vehicles engaged in unloading will not encroach on or interfere with the public use of streets and alleys by pedestrians and so that adequate space is available for the unloading and loading of goods materials or items for delivery and shipping when the use of a structure or land or any part thereof is changed to a use requiring offstreet loading facilities the full amount of offstreet loading space required shall be supplied and maintained when any structure is enlarged or any use extended so that the size of the resulting occupancy requires offstreet loading space the full amount of such space shall be supplied and maintained for the structure or use in its enlarged or extended size each offstreet loading space shall be directly accessible from a street or alley without crossing or entering any other required offstreet loading space there shall be no loading or unloading of commercial vehicles on the public street such loading space shall be accessible from the interior of the building it serves and shall be arranged for convenient and safe ingress and egress by motor truck andor trailer combination 7 plans for offstreet loading required a plan shall be submitted with every application for a building permit for any use or structure required to provide offstreet loading facilities the plan shall accurately designate the required offstreet loading spaces access thereto dimensions and clearance 8 combined offstreet loading collective joint or combined provisions for offstreet loading facilities for two 2 or more buildings or uses may be made provided that such offstreet loading facilities are equal in size and capacity to the combined requirements of the several buildings or uses and are designed located and arranged to be usable thereby 9 offstreet loading requirements offstreet loading spaces shall be provided and maintained as follows a personal service establishment repairservice establishment one 1 space for the first ten thousand 10000 square feet of floor area plus one 1 space for each additional thirty thousand 30000 square feet or major fraction thereof b retail or wholesale facility or restaurant for each additional two hundred thousand 200000 square feet of floor area or major fraction thereof over two hundred fifty thousand 250000 square feet of floor area one 1 additional loading space shall be provided square feet number of spaces 0 to 10000 1 10000 to 25000 2 25000 to 40000 3 40000 to 100000 4 100000 to 250000 5 c hotel motel commercial recreation facility exhibition hall stadium auditorium convention hall theater one 1 space for the first ten thousand 10000 square feet of floor area plus one 1 space for each additional fifty thousand 50000 square feet or major fraction thereof d business and professional office one 1 space for the first ten thousand 10000 square feet of floor area plus one 1 space for each additional fifty thousand 50000 square feet or major fraction thereof e hospital school college or other similar institutional building one 1 space for the first ten thousand 10000 square feet and one 1 space for each additional fifty thousand 50000 square feet or major fraction thereof f multiple family dwelling one 1 to fifty 50 dwelling units one 1 loading space  one 1 space for each additional fifty 50 dwelling units or major fraction thereof g warehousing storage one 1 space for the first five thousand 5000 square feet of floor area plus one 1 space for additional thirty thousand 30000 square feet or major fraction thereof for any use not specifically mentioned the requirements for offstreet loading facilities for a use which is so mentioned to which the use is similar shall apply when offstreet loading specifications are not stated herein determinations shall be made by the zoning administrator based on accepted standards  112690   61096   6997   52404  exh a  7 102411 cross reference offsite or shared parking  7530 et seq  landscaping of offstreet parking and vehicular use areas  812 et seq definitions the following terms when used in this chapter shall be defined to mean abutting  to physically touch or border upon or to share a common property line accessory uses and structures a use or structure which is customarily accessory and clearly incidental and subordinate to permitted principal uses and structures and which are located on the same lot as the permitted principal use or structure or on a contiguous lot under the same ownership adult congregate living facility any building or buildings section of a building or distinct part of a building residence private home boarding home home for the aged or other place whether operated for profit or not which undertakes ownership or management to provide for a period exceeding twentyfour 24 hours housing food service and one 1 or more personal services for four 4 or more adults not related to the owner or administrator by blood or marriage who require such services  or to provide limited nursing services or limited mental health services when specifically licensed to do so pursuant to fs   alley a public or private way which affords only a secondary means of access to property abutting thereon and not intended for general traffic circulation alteration alter or alteration shall mean any change or rearrangement in the supporting members of an existing building such as bearing walls columns beams girders or interior partitions as well as any change in doors or windows or any enlargement to or diminution of a building or structure whether horizontally or vertically or the moving of a building or structure from one location to another arcade a colonnade supporting habitable space that overlaps the sidewalk while the facade at sidewalk level remains at or behind the front setback line this type is conventional for retail use the arcade shall be no less than twelve 12 feet wide and should overlap the sidewalk within two 2 feet of the curb arcade downtown maitland  a series of arches or beams supported by columns or pillars  a covered passageway  a recessed gallery with columns or piers open to the street architectural relief the changes in the facade of a building to provide visual relief along all elevations components of visual relief include such as a change in materials massing roof variation recessed entries awnings etc assessed value  for purposes of this the total value of a tax parcel excluding the value of the land as determined by the county property appraiser and shown on the most recent property tax bill sent to the owner of record by the county in the absence of such information applicants may submit an assessment prepared by a professional appraiser automobile service station any building land area or other premises or portion thereof used or intended to be used for the retail dispensing or sales of vehicular fuels  and including as an accessory use the sale and installation of lubricants tires batteries and similar accessories minor repairs and adjustments such automobile service station may also sell convenience store items such as cold drinks packaged foods tobacco uses permissible at an automobile service station do not include body work painting storage of automobiles not in operating conditions or car laundry automobile wrecking yard the dismantling or disassembling of used motor vehicles or trailers or the storage sale or dumping of dismantled partially dismantled obsolete or wrecked vehicles or their parts awning  a sheltering screen usually of canvas fabric supported and stiffened by a rigid frame extending over or before any place which has windows doors outside walks or the like and providing shelter or protection against the weather block  a group of lots including passages rear lanes and alleys which may service them existing within welldefined and fixed boundaries usually being an area surrounded by streets or other physical barriers and usually having an assigned number letter or other name it is identified block face  the aggregate of all the building facades on one 1 side of a block which abuts an individual street block layout  the arrangement of lots and alleys contained within a city block buildto line btl  the distance at which a building must be placed buildable area the portion of a lot remaining after required yards andor setbacks have been provided notwithstanding other provisions of this any structure either temporary or permanent having a roof impervious to weather and used or built for the shelter or enclosure of persons animals chattels or property of any kind this definition shall include tents awnings cabanas but does not include screened enclosures not having a roof impervious to weather building height the vertical distance of a building measured from the grade level to the highest point of the roof or if a structure or appurtenance such as a penthouse mechanical or equipment room or air conditioning equipment is located above the roof level of the building the height measurement shall include said structures and appurtenances note exceptions to height regulations section 215vi building height downtown maitland  the vertical distance as measured from finished grade to the top of the highest point of the roof outside top covering of the building on a flat or shed type roof and to top of the highest eave excluding dormers for a hip gable gambrel mansard or barrel roof note exceptions to height regulations section 215vi building separation the spacing or distance between buildings designed to ensure adequate light privacy fire safety and amenity building site  any group of one 1 or more lots or parcels occupied or intended for development as a unit whether or not as part of a larger development site building street frontage the length of street frontage that a building occupies along a setback or buildto line business office all or part of a building the administrative portion of a business is conducted cannabis any plant or part of a plant of the genus cannabis whether growing or not  the seeds thereof  the resin extracted from any part of the plant  and every compound manufacture salt derivative mixture or preparation of the plant or its seeds or resin including lowtch cannabis which are dispensed from a medical marijuana treatment center for medical use by a qualified patient as defined in florida statutes   cannabis farm any property used in whole or in part for the growing or cultivation of cannabis plants whether or not such growing or cultivation is lawful under federal or state law change of occupancy a discontinuance of an existing use and the substitution therefor of a use of a different kind or class change of occupancy is not intended to include a change of tenants or proprietors unless accompanied by a change in the type of use child care home five 5 children and less a day care facility located in the operators principal residence which receives not over five 5 children for periods of less than twentyfour 24 hours per day per child child care home six 6 or more children a day care center facility located within the owneroperators principal residence which receives six 6 or more children twelve 12 years of age and under and which must be licensed by the florida department of hrs to operate such a use child care center an establishment which operates for less than twentyfour 24 hours per day caring for one 1 or more children twelve 12 years of age or under and where tuition fees or other forms of compensation for the care of children is charged and which is licensed to operate by the florida department of health and rehabilitative services as a child care facility circulation plan the identification of potential crossandjoint access to adjacent parcels that accommodate pedestrian and alternative transportation modes clinic medical or dental a medical or dental clinic is an establishment where patients who are not lodged overnight are admitted for examination and treatment by one person or a group of persons practicing any form of the healing arts whether such persons be medical doctors chiropractors osteopaths chiropodists naturopaths optometrists dentists or any such profession the practice of which is lawful in the state club night a restaurant dining room bar or other similar establishment providing food or refreshments wherein paid floor shows or other forms of paid entertainment are provided for customers as a part of the commercial enterprise club private those associations and organizations of a fraternal or social character not operated or maintained for profit the term private club shall not include casinos nightclubs bottle clubs or other institutions otherwise operated as a business commercial vehicle any vehicle one 1 ton or greater in rating which is designed intended or used for transportation of people chattel or goods and used for purposes other than for a private passenger vehicle for the purposes of this zoning code any vehicle regardless of weight which displays commercial logos andor lettering shall also be deemed a commercial vehicle community service facility  facilities where food meals or commodities are serveddistributed for notforprofit social services purposes  facilities that provide temporary accommodations generally for notforprofit social service purposes completely enclosed building a building separated on all sides from adjacent open space or from other buildings or other structures by a permanent roof and by exterior walls or party walls pierced only by windows and normal entrance or exit doors comprehensive development plan the citys comprehensive plan adopted pursuant to the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act construction actual the placing of construction materials in permanent position and fastened in a permanent manner  except that where demolition or removal of an existing structure has been accomplished andor excavation has been substantially begun preparatory to new construction such excavation shall be deemed to be actual construction provided that work shall be diligently carried on until the completion of the new construction involved fill and the installation of drainage facilities shall be considered a part of construction construction shall be completed within the period specified in the building permit contiguous abutting or touching and having a boundary or portion thereof which is coterminous crossaccess provides vehicular and pedestrian connections between abutting properties crossaccess easement provides vehicular and pedestrian connections between abutting properties density residential general the maximum density allowed by the land use classification applicable to the subject property multiplied by the proposed gross land area of the property density residential downtown maitland the maximum density allowed by the land use classification applicable to the subject property multiplied by the proposed gross land area of the property plus any density incentives as provided herein for the purposes of site far calculations within downtown maitland residential areas shall be calculated excluding water bodies density residential maitland west side the maximum density allowed by the land use classification applicable to the subject property multiplied by the proposed gross land area of the property plus any density incentives as provided herein downtown maitland development standards manual also referred to as the pattern book in the citys cdp  a supplement to the downtown maitland zoning district and downtown maitland special district regulations which provides 1 additional detailed design standards for building form and architecture related to windows and doors building materials building colors and roof design as well as streetscape furnishing 2 visual examples fundamental design principles and comprehensive direction for the implementation of the regulations included within section 232 and 3 parking standards including singleuse parking ratios and shared parking standards without the necessity of providing additional parking studies development project new construction or redevelopment  a development project is defined as any proposal within the city that involves the following 1 a new use of vacant property or 2 new construction rehabilitation or remodeling of any existing building or any ancillary building however proposals involving an interior modification to an existing building are specifically excluded as a development project development site  the property under consideration for a development which may contain one 1 or more building sites and shall be under single ownership at the time of application or processed under a single development application should the development site contain more than one 1 building site any applicable development site setback requirements shall be established from the development site perimeter dimensional requirement  a code requirement that can be measured with a numerical value examples include length width depth diameter height quantity capacity and proportion expressed in percentage drivein a commercial establishment that provides services or products to customers while they remain in their cars in a parking lot examples of drivein uses include restaurants and theaters drivealso known as driveup  a commercial establishment that provides goods or services special window or station for customers who order from their cars and leave after receiving the service examples of driveinclude restaurants banks pharmacies car wash facilities and dry cleaning establishments for the purpose of this the term drivenot include gasoline filling stations or the accessory functions of a carwash facility such as vacuum cleaning stations driveup see definition for drivegroup a building or part thereof in which several unrelated persons or families permanently reside but in which individual cooking facilities are not provided for persons or families group dwelling may include a rooming or lodging house or a fraternity house and sorority house but which total occupancy shall not exceed sixteen 16 persons group dwelling shall not be deemed to include a hotel motel mobile home park or trailer camp dwelling mobile home a structure transportable in one 1 or more sections manufactured on a chassis and designed to be used as a residential dwelling with or without a permanent foundation with plumbing and electrical connections provided for attachment to utility systems dwelling multiplefamily a residential building designed for or occupied by three 3 or more families with the number of families in residence not exceeding the number of dwelling units provided dwelling singlefamily a building containing one 1 dwelling unit dwelling twofamily a detached residential building containing two 2 dwelling units designed for occupancy by not more than two 2 families dwelling unit one 1 or more rooms designed occupied or intended for occupancy as separate living quarters with cooking sleeping and sanitary facilities provided within the dwelling unit for the exclusive use of a singlefamily maintaining a household earth station height the height of the antenna or dish measured vertically from the highest point of the antenna or dish when positioned for operation to the ground erected includes built constructed reconstructed moved upon or any physical operation on the premises required for building excavations fill drainage demolition of an existing structure and the like shall be considered part of erection faade  exterior wall of a structure family one 1 or more persons occupying a single dwelling unit provided that unless all members are related by law blood or marriage no such family shall contain over five 5 persons but further provided that domestic servants employed on the premises may be housed on the premises without being counted as a separate or additional family or families final development plan a specific plan for each phase of development of the planned development district which complies with a preliminary plan approved by the city council final subdivision plat those submittals required by the city subdivision regulations for all or a portion of a subdivision of land in accordance with an approved preliminary plat financial institution establishments such as but not limited to banks and trust companies credit agencies investment companies and security and commodity exchanges floor area ratio general the gross floor area of all buildings on a lot and contiguous lots being utilized for a particular land use divided by the area of such lots excluding land below the controlled water elevation level parking structures shall not be calculated as a part of a sites floor area ratio floor area ratio total site also referred to as the site far  a formula for determining permitted building area in downtown maitland as a multiple of the developable area of the lot the gross floor area of all building area calculated based upon the total site development nonresidential and residential uses excluding parking structures foster care home a residential facility which provides a family living environment including supervision and care necessary to meet the physical emotional and social needs of not more than three 3 clients frontage the length of a block or lot that runs along a public street frontage walls short walls that enclose outdoor spaces along streets and adjacent to buildings garage apartment an accessory or subordinate building not a part of or attached to the main building where a portion thereof contains a dwelling unit for not more than one 1 family and the enclosed space for at least one 1 automobile is attached to such dwelling unit garage private an accessory structure designed or used for inside parking of private passenger vehicles by the occupants of the main building a private garage attached to or a part of the main structure is to be considered part of the main use an unattached private garage is to be considered as an accessory building garage repair building and premises which may be designed and intended for some or all of the purposes indicated under automobile service station but which unlike an automobile service station includes provision for body work provided that body work and painting shall be conducted within completely enclosed buildings and that selfpropelled vehicles not in safe operating condition shall be stored in completely enclosed buildings gender the use of one 1 gender whether male or female or neuter shall include all genders grade a referenced plane representing the average of finished ground level adjoining the building at all exterior walls green a public space available for informal recreation bounded on at least two 2 sides by streets with facing buildings on all sides a green is landscaped with lawns and trees including existing or natural vegetation and paths and trails grief counseling center an office use in which clients are counseled by psychologists clergy counselors or social workers individually or in groups led by professionals as well as informal support groups offered by churches community groups or organizations devoted to helping individuals grieve specific losses gross floor area for the purpose of determining the floor area ratio the gross floor area of a building is the sum of the gross horizontal areas of the several floors of the building measured from the exterior faces of the exterior walls the gross floor area of a building shall include the basement floor area when more than onehalf of the basement height is above the established curb level or above the finished grade level where a curb has not been established elevator shafts and stairwells at each floor floor space used for mechanical equipment interior balconies and mezzanines and enclosed porches and floor area devoted to accessory uses gross land area the total amount of land area included within the perimeter boundaries of a legally defined property group home facility a residential facility which provides a family living environment including supervision and care necessary to meet the physical emotional and social needs of at least four 4 clients but not more than sixteen 16 guest house or cottage a detached accessory structure separate from smaller than and in addition to the principal residential structure on a lot a guest house or cottage is used for purposes of providing accommodations for occasional nonpaying guests or members of a family who occupy the principal structure residence or domestic servants employed on the premises provided that the property owner must reside in the principal residence for the purpose of this section a lessee of the principal structure shall be deemed the property owner provided said lease is in writing and encompasses the entire premises including the principal structure and the guest house the guest house or cottage shall not be rented let or hired out for occupancy whether compensation is in any form or any consideration except with regards to domestic servants providing services solely to the same property or otherwise used as a separate dwelling unit the guest house or cottage may include a vehicle storage space but shall have no separate utility meter all applicants for building permits to construct a guest house or cottage or substantially improve same or for the conversion of a use to a guest house shall record a declaration of use restriction form 1a as a deed restriction delineating the above stated restrictions and conditions of the building permit in a format approved by the city for the purposes of this section substantial improvement shall mean the cost of work totaling more than twentyfive 25 percent of the current assessed value of the accessory structure the deed restriction shall be recorded prior to the issuance of the building permit and shall be removed only with the written consent of the city manager in no case shall the guest house be constructed prior to the occupancy of the principal dwelling to which it is an accessory home occupation an occupation conducted entirely in a dwelling unit provided that a no person other than members of the family residing on the premises shall be engaged in such occupation  b the use of the dwelling unit for the home occupation shall be clearly incidental and subordinate to its use for residential purposes by its occupants and shall under no circumstances change the residential character thereof  c there shall be no change in the outside appearance of the building or premises or other visible evidence of the conduct of such home occupation other than one 1 sign not exceeding one 1 square foot in area nonilluminated mounted flat against the wall of the principal building at a position not more than two 2 feet distant from the main entrance to the residence  d no home occupation shall be conducted in any accessory building  e no home occupation shall occupy more than twenty 20 percent of the first floor area of the residence exclusive of the area of any open porch or attached garage or similar space not suited or intended for occupancy as living quarters  f no traffic shall be generated by such home occupation in greater volumes than would normally be expected in a residential neighborhood and any need for parking generated by the conduct of such home occupation shall be met off the street and other than in required front yard  g no equipment or process shall be used in such home occupation which creates noise vibration glare fumes odors or electrical interference detectable to the normal senses off the lot if the occupation is conducted in a singlefamily residence or outside the dwelling unit if conducted in other than a singlefamily residence in the case of electrical interference no equipment or process shall be used which creates visual or audible interference in any radio or television receivers off the premises or causes fluctuations in line voltage off the premises  h the following shall not be considered home occupations beauty shops barbershops band instrument or dance instructor swimming instructor art studio for group instruction public dining facility or tearoom antique or gift shops photographic studio fortunetelling outdoor repair food processing sale of antiques retail sales child care center or kindergarten the giving of group instruction shall not be deemed a home occupation  i the giving of individual instruction to one 1 person shall be deemed a home occupation  j fabrication of articles such as are commonly classified under the terms arts and handicrafts may be deemed a home occupation subject to the other terms and conditions of this definition  k a home occupation shall be subject to all applicable city occupational license and other business taxes hotel any building principally containing sleeping rooms in which transient guests are lodged for a fee with or without meals houseboat a floating dwelling unit houseboats may not be used for dwelling purposes within the city limits hrs the florida department of health or the florida department of children and family services as the case may be formerly the florida department of health and rehabilitative services an agency of the state impervious coverage the percentage of lot area which is covered with impervious materials such as building swimming pools decks patios driveways etc intensity as used in this term has been used historically as interchangeable with the term floor area ratio internal streets streets or cross access easements that are within a development or parcel that contribute to the overall street grid and block structure joint use driveway provides vehicular and pedestrian connections between abutting properties light manufacturing for purposes of this zoning code light manufacturing shall not be deemed to be any of the following uses junk yard asphalt manufacturing asphaltconcrete paving mixing batching blast furnace cement lime gypsum manufacturing plaster of paris manufacturing corrosive acid manufacturing and storage animal slaughtering bond distillation garbage and junk incineration etc citrus processing automobile wrecking yard cement mixing plant concrete block and pipe manufacturing fossil fuels and derivatives manufacturing ice plants nonferrous metal foundry saw mills steel fabrication plants newspaper plants fertilizer manufacturing and processing uses similar to those listed herein light technology light technology uses shall include manufacturing fabricating processing converting altering and assembling and testing of products provided that no such uses shall 1 cause or result in dissemination of dust smoke gas or fumes odor noise vibration or excessive light beyond the boundaries of the lot on which the use is conducted  menace by reason of fire explosion radiation or other physical hazards  harmful discharge of waste materials  or unusual traffic hazards or congestion due to type or amount of vehicles required by or attached to the use 2 be dangerous to the comfort peace enjoyment health or safety of the community or the abutting areas or tend to their disturbance or annoyance 3 be inconsistent with the appropriate and orderly development of the city and adjacent areas liner building  a building specifically designed to mask a parking lot or a parking structure from a frontage living area residential the area within the confines of the walls of the structure which is completely enclosed by impervious materials such as masonry wood or glass and is habitable the year round garages are excluded loading space offstreet an offstreet space or berth used for the loading or unloading by commercial vehicles lodging house a building or part thereof other than a motel or hotel where sleeping accommodations are provided for hire more or less transiently without provisions for cooking by guests but which may or may not provide meals for guests and which also may serve as the residence of the operator lot a parcel tract or area of land established by a plat or otherwise permitted by law which can be identified and referenced by a recorded plat or map the word lot includes the word plot or parcel lot area the size of a lot measured within the lot lines and expressed in terms of acres or square feet lot corner  see definition of lot types lot coverage that percentage of lot area covered or occupied by buildings including accessory buildings for the purpose of computing maximum lot coverage by all buildings only the portion of a lot above controlled water level elevation may be utilized in computing the size of a lot lot depth the distance measured from the midpoint of the front lot line to the midpoint of the opposite rear line of the lot lot frontage the length of the lot line measured at the street rightofway line lot interior  see definition of lot types lot line or property line  any legal boundary of a lot where applicable the lot line may coincide with the rightofway line lot of record a lot which is part of a subdivision recorded in the office of the county clerk of the circuit court or a lot or parcel described by metes and bounds the description of which has been so recorded on or before the effective date of this zoning code lot types the diagram which follows illustrates terminology used in this zoning code with reference to corner lots interior lots reversed frontage lots and in the diagram a   corner lot defined as a lot located at the intersection of two 2 or more streets a lot abutting on a curved street or streets shall be considered a corner lot if straight lines drawn from the foremost points of the side lot lines to the foremost point of the lot meet at an interior angle of less than one hundred thirtyfive 135 degrees see lots marked a1 in the diagram b   interior lot defined as a lot other than a corner lot with only one 1 frontage on a street c   defined as a lot other than a corner lot with frontage on more than one 1 street through lots abutting two 2 streets may be referred to as double frontage lots d   reversed frontage lot defined as a lot on which the frontage is at right angles or approximately right angles interior angle less than one hundred thirtyfive 135 degrees to the general pattern in the area a reversed frontage lot may also be a corner lot ad in the diagram an interior lot bd or a cd lot width the distance between straight lines connecting front and rear lot lines at each side of the lot measured across the rear of the required front yard if however a lot fails to meet the minimum lot width at the rear of the required front yard the required front yard shall be established at the point where the minimum lot width has been satisfied for transient automobile travellers natural grade the elevation of the ground surface in its natural state before manmade alterations net density the total number of dwelling units divided by the acreage of gross land area excluding land below the low water control elevations net land area the total amount of land area in square feet within the perimeter boundaries of a legally defined property excluding areas devoted to streets rightsofway easements lakes recreation areas and areas which are not suitable for buildings or structures due to soil limitations nonconforming lot a lot the area dimensions or location of which was lawful prior to the adoption revision or amendment of the zoning ordinance but which fails by reason of such adoption revision or amendment to conform to the present requirements of the zoning district nonconforming structure or building a structure or building the size dimensions or location of which was lawful prior to the adoption revision or amendment of a zoning ordinance but which fails by reason of such adoption revision or amendment to conform to the present requirements of the zoning district nonconforming use a use or activity which was lawful prior to the adoption revision or amendment of a zoning ordinance but which fails by reason of such adoption revision or amendment to conform to the present requirements of the zoning district nonmedical marijuana sales the purchase sale transfer or delivery of marijuana cannabis cannabisbased products or cannabis plants when such sale transfer or delivery is not associated with any medical purpose or use whether or not such purchase sale transfer or delivery is lawful under federal or state law number the singular number includes the plural and the plural number includes the singular nursing home a home for aged chronically ill or in curable persons in which three 3 or more persons not of the immediate family are received kept or provided with food and shelter or care for compensation  but not including hospitals clinics or similar institutions devoted primarily to the diagnosis and treatment of the sick or injured this definition also incorporates convalescent and rest home offstreet parking space a temporary storage area for a motor vehicle which is directly accessible to an access aisle and which provides proper access and maneuvering room to a public street or approved private street but which shall not be located on a dedicated street rightofway or approved private street the space shall be adequate for parking a standard sized automobile open space any fifty 50 percent when landscaped as an amenity driving aisles and parking spaces are not deemed to be open space open space wekiva land area that is left undeveloped or minimally developed to preserve
